loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 35 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school. Emelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, etc.

Emelyn has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 47 years old now.

Josephine has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years.

Josephine requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
As a previous member of Gata Daku MPC, Richel is planning to expand her business by being funded again.

Richel is 43 years old, married and blessed with one daughter. Her husband is a farmer.

Because of the increasing tuition fees of her daughter, she was obliged to look for additional income that can help her to support the education of her daughter. She is now engaged in buying and selling copras (coconut fruits). It’s been five years already that she has been doing this.

At this time, she needs to look for money to pay the labor cost for maintenance of the business. She went to Gata Daku to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000. She was asked by one of the staff about her future plans, and then she replied, “If God will permit, I would like to have a vehicle to use in transporting my copras to the town.”

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost for maintenance of the business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 59 years old and married. She has 12 children, two of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Josephine requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 58-year-old woman who lives in Carles, Iloilo, together with her family. She is married and a mother of three children; two adults and one-school-aged child.

She and her husband raise their family through various businesses. They own a furniture shop, operate a chainsaw, and run a tricycle (a motorcycle with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow). A tricycle is a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines, and it is one of the reasons Victoria is asking for a loan.

She needs an amount for the maintenance of their tricycle. The other part of her requested amount is to buy some materials for furniture making. Victoria’s goal in life is to improve their businesses for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy some materials for furniture making and to provide for the maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is encouraged that he previously received and faithfully paid his loan on time. The proceeds of his loan really helped him render safe and efficient tricycle service; thus, he was able to provide for his family.

He trusts he could borrow funds in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy new tires and pay for the regular maintenance of his tricycle. He values his transportation business, for it is his main source of income. He is thanking God and you in advance for supporting his livelihood.

Eduardo aims to buy another tricycle to augment his income. He prays for God to bless his livelihood. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for regular maintenance and new tires for his tricycle.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has four children: three adult and one teenaged child. Her husband is a fisherman, while Rosemarie has been running a sari-sari store (general store) business for 10 years. She and her husband work hard to earn a living and to provide for the needs of their children. They also want to give good education to their children.

Thus, in the future, Rosemarie wants to increase their livelihood for her children’s education. She dreams for them to improve their basic education.

Rosemarie is asking a bigger amount of loans for additional capital to be able to augment her earnings. She will buy varieties of goods such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

loans.use: to buy drinks, toiletries, laundry soap, spices, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, chips, biscuits, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and juice.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old and married. She has two children, both in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

Judith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 32 years old and married. She has four children. With three children in school, Lanie works very hard to provide for them.

Lanie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

Lanie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Lanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 55 years old and married with four children, with one child in school. Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Edita has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Edita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lydia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
A married woman named Mylene is already 37 years old. She and her husband have a contractual job in her town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, but unfortunately, their salary is not enough to provide for the needs of their four children. They sent all of them to school.

In order to support the financial needs of her family, she has to engage in the buying and selling of RTW (ready-to-wear) dresses and also in a “rent a motorcycle” business. She purchased one motorcycle three years ago, and this makes her earn extra income.

The money she borrowed was used to repair the motorcycle and buy its spare parts. She has a dream of becoming a motorcycle operator in her town. In the near future, she plans to buy a new motorcycle in addition to her old one.

loans.use: to buy tires and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Lourdes is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as spices, rice, etc.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as spices, rice, etc.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is 45, living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store as well, and some of his relatives like to purchase from his store.

He speaks with monotonous tone that is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well.

Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Balqees requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

Balqees thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventories such as soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, pulses, etc. for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Ma. Telma

texts.en:
Ma. Telma is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Telma is 55 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Telma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Telma requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Ma. Telma has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Ma. Telma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 39-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city which is a very populated area. A few days ago he had a road accident. When he was looking for a passenger standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any injury but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed replacement with a new one. He wants to replace the rickshaw body with a new one but does not have enough cash in hand to fix it.

Therefore, Aysha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy an auto rickshaw body and he can drive smoothly again. Aysha is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services so he can repair it after accidental damage.

loans.name: Wend Songda Group

texts.fr: Adèle est une femme âgée de 49 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont tous scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 3 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est qu'elle vend à des prix abordables, son jus a un goût particulier que les gens aiment de plus elle est à coté d'un gare routière dont elle a beaucoup de client.Elle veut acheter des amandes à 150 000 f ; du bissap et du tamarin à 50 000 f ; et 50 000 f comme fonds de roulement. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Adèle is a woman of 49, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are or have been in school. She has had her business for three years. The reasons her business runs well are that she sells at affordable prices, her juice has a special flavor that people enjoy, and moreover she is located near a local bus station so she has lots of customers.

Adèle wants to buy cashew nuts for 150,000 francs, hibiscus flowers and tamarind (flavorings) for 50,000 francs, and put 50,000 francs in her working capital. The point of the loan is to allow her to procure big enough quantities to bolster her business. She has already received three loans and has reimbursed them on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts for 150,000 francs; hibiscus flowers and tamarind (flavorings) for 50,000 francs, and put 50,000 francs toward her working capital.

loans.name: Shika Jembe Group

texts.fr: Orienté dans la concrétisation de travaux champêtres, les effets du premier crédit ont été visibles dans la survie de la famille de Godefroid ainsi que l'achat de deux autres champs. Il sollicite un deuxième crédit afin de renforcer le petit capital qui lui reste mais qui est insignifiant pour répondre aux conditions exigées par la riziculture; sans perdre de vue qu'il a agrandi son espace cultural
texts.en:
Oriented toward projected field work, the effects of the first loan were visible in Godefroid's family's survival as well as in the purchase of two other fields.

He is requesting a second loan to reinforce the small amount of capital left to him, which is too little to deal with the conditions of rice growing, especially as his arable surface was extended.

loans.use: to pay for field labor, plowing, harrowing, transplanting, and buying plant chemicals.

loans.name: Rayim Taab Yele Group

texts.fr: Marie est une femme âgée de 40 ans, mariée mère de 06 enfants dont tous scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 02 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son respect, son accueil, son dynamisme et son écoute de ses clients. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter deux sacs de savon (cabakourou) à 120 000 f, acheter des produits cosmétique (pommade)  à 30 000 f et le reste de 25 000 comme fond de roulement. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité.Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Marie is a woman of 40, married and the mother of six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She has had her business for two years. The qualities that make her business run are her respect, her welcome, her dynamism, and the way she listens to her customers.

Marie wants the loan to buy two sacks of soap (cabakourou) for 120,000 francs, cosmetics (pomade) for 30,000 francs, and she plans to put the remaining 25,000 francs toward working capital. The point of the loan is to increase her stocks so as to bolster her business. She has already received two prior loans and has reimbursed them on ACFIME's due dates.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of soap (cabakourou) for 120,000 francs, cosmetics (pomade) for 30,000 francs and put 25,000 francs toward her working capital.

loans.name: Jennarose

texts.en:
Jennarose is a 30-year-old married woman who lives a simple life with her family in Carles, Iloilo. She was blessed with two young daughters who are the center of her life and the reason why she and her husband work hard to earn a living.

With their determination to lift their financial stability, she and her husband are proficiently running a fish selling business. They have been doing this for 10 years to sustain their daily needs, such as household expenses, food and school fees of their children.

In short, the profits that they earn from their sales aren’t enough for this woman and her husband who dream of achieving a sustainable means of living. That’s why Jennarose is requesting for a bigger amount of loans. She will use the money to buy more fish to sell hoping it will help them enhance their earnings.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Moreno Jr.

texts.en:
Moreno is a married man who has 3 children to provide for. He sends all of them to school. To earn an income, he provides transportation services to the local community. He actively drives and takes passengers to designated areas safely. It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too.

Recently, he requested a loan to buy tires and finance the costs to his other line of business (swine fattening). The availability of these funds helps him to continue the business he started.

With this loan, Joseph is expecting to pursue his job by keeping his motor vehicle in good running condition so he may provide satisfactory service to his customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Estilita

texts.en:
Estilita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estilita is 67 years old now.

Estilita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Estilita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc..

Estilita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Estilita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 43 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Leonora has a purified drinking water sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for nine years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Hazel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Hazel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Hazel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 43 years old with five children. With two children in school, Luzviminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sreysokha

texts.en:
Sreysokha is an 18-year-old. She was an outstanding student when she was in high school. She is from Takeo Province in Cambodia. Currently, she is studying at university to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at the university in the city. Sreysokha’s family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year, so she would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and go through the first to fourth year successfully. For her dreams, Sreysokha wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary, and save money to renovate her parents’ house.

loans.use: to cover her university fees from the first to the fourth year.  She will receive a BSc. in Banking and Finance. He parents are rice farmers.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is an amazing mother who lives in small village near Hebron. She has six children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and to ensure that they do not need anything.

Nada's husband works as employee, but he could not cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, so she decided to open her own business.

Nada started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: her buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Ugiljon

texts.en: Ugilon is a young and hardworking woman. She is divorced and has a son. Ugiljon brings up her son alone. She is a sewer. Ugiljon sews national women's clothes. She is very responsible person and she tries to offer her services in high quality. Ugiljon has repeated clients. She is young but she has experienced a lot of difficulties in life because she is only one to feed her son. Now, her son is ill and she must buy medicines for his treatment. Ugiljon is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for the treatment of her son

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Angelino

texts.en: Angelino lives at Amulung, with his wife and two children. His wife is a teacher while Angelino manages a printing and photography business. He offers photocopy, printing and photography services. He had been in his business for about nine years. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy photo paper, inks, film and papers use in the business. He hopes to continuously offer good services to all his customers and gain better profits as well.

loans.use: to buy photo paper, inks, film and papers use in the business

loans.name: Douamba Awa Group

texts.fr: Awa est une femme âgée de 49 ans, mariée mère de 4 enfants dont  2 scolarisés. Elle exerce son activité depuis 5 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est l'emplacement de son lieu de commerce à coté du marcher ; elle est respectueuse, aimable envers ses clients en plus de ça elle est dynamique et battante. Elle veut acheter  25 000 f de bidon pour conditionner le liquide de savon, acheter des plats thermos à 100 000 f ; acheter des plats super à 50 000 F et des casseroles à 75 000 F. L'utilité du prêt c'est de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 9 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Awa is a woman of 49, married and the mother of four children, of whom two are enrolled in school. She has had her business for five years. The things that make her business run well are that she is located beside the market, she is respectful and friendly toward her customers and moreover she is dynamic and a fighter.

She wants to buy one container of liquid soap for 25,000 francs, thermos dishes for 100,000 francs, stacking dishes for 50,000 francs, and pans for 75,000 francs. The point of the loan is to stock up on inventory in sufficient quantity so as to bolster her business. She has already received nine loans and reimbursed them on the dates established by ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy one container of liquid soap for 25,000 francs, thermos dishes for 100,000 francs, stacking dishes for 50,000 francs, and pans for 75,000 francs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children who are in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Jenelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 51 years old, married, and has three adult children. He is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a hardworking man who operates a sari-sari (variety) store, which he has been doing for 10 years. He sells goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks. Celso earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials such as empty plastic bottles, scrap iron, metals. and other recyclable plastics.

Celso would like to improve both his sources of income but needs additional funds to do so. He requested a loan, which he will use to purchase edible oil, canned goods, and scrap materials. These items are vital in augmenting his business. With the loan, he will be able to have variety on display at his store and improve his financial capacity to boost his scrap metal business. Celso is determined to become successful in his chosen field and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchases edible oil, canned goods, and scrap materials.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 56 year-old IDP from the Bilasuvar region. She is married, and, together with her husband, grows some vegetables and fruits. Elmira, with the support of her spouse, is running quite a successful farming business. She has more than 20 years of experience. She relies on her husband's support for managing the farm He has been supporting her with great love and passion. Elmira sells the natural fruits and vegetables in the local market. In Azerbaijan there is a great demand for vegetables to make traditional foods like dolma, bozbash, and also for fruits for after dinner deserts.

Elmira is currently planning to expand her business. She requires 1500 AZN to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers for the vegetables. She hopes that KIVA lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy new fruit trees and fertilizers

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan got married at an early age. Right now at 27, she has four children, ages one to eight. Her husband is not earning enough for them so she helps him by growing vegetables like string beans, and by working as a vegetable dealer. She is asking for a loan to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds so she can plant more vegetables. Joan's only dream is that all her children will finish schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Madinahan

texts.ru: Мадинахан, 22 года, замужем, детей нет. Мадинахан на протяжении 3 лет занимается торговлей одеялами, полотенцами, посудой на дому. В обороте есть товар на сумму 30,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мадинахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара. Она является участником группы "Бекзод", всего в группе состоит 3 человека. Доходы от кредита Мадинахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и планирует накопить средства на покупку контейнера на центральном рынке города.
texts.en:
Madinahan is 22 and married with no children. She has been working in retail for three years, selling items for the home such as blankets, towels and dishes. She has 30,000 KGS worth of inventory and a monthly income of 4,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Madinahan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to increase her selection of inventory. She is a member of the Bekzod group, which includes two other people besides herself. She plans to put profits from the loan toward further expanding her business and plans to save toward buying a stall at the city's central market.

loans.use: to buy blankets, towels, kitchen utensils and other goods in order to increase her selection of inventory

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Maria de 50 años de edad vive casa propia con su hija de 18 años de edad quien trabaja y le ayuda en los gastos de la casa, ella se dedica a la crainza y venta de cerdos desde hace 2 años, es asi como ella puede salir adelante con su hija, Doña Maria esta solicitando un credito para la compra de alimentos para los cerdos y mejorar el lugar donde los mantiene y asi poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria, age 50, lives in her own house with her 18 year old daughter. Her daughter works and helps with the household expenses. Maria has been raising and selling pigs for two years. That is how she is able to get ahead with her daughter.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy feed for the pigs and to improve the place where she keeps them. This way she will be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and to improve the place.

loans.name: Mustafo

texts.ru: Мустафо мужчина среднего возраста с прекрасной репутации и человек с большим именем. Он уважаемая персона в своем районе и человек, который всегда протянет руку помощи. Мустафо более 20 лет продвигает деятельность земледелия. За столь время, он сумел до мельчайших тонкостей. Началось работа Мустафо, он собирается подготовить землю для зимнего посева урожая. Для этого ему нужно минеральные удобрения, чтобы обработать землю. Денежных средств не хватает, чтобы закупить достаточное количество удобрений. Также он собирается купить угля на зиму. Поддержите Мустафо.
texts.en:
Mustafo is a middle-aged man with a wonderful reputation and a well-known name. He is a respected individual in his region and the kind of person who always lends a hand. He has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years, during which time he has learned the subtleties of his profession. 

Mustafo has started preparing this land for the winter sowing and needs mineral fertilizer to amend the soil, but doesn't have enough money to buy a sufficient quantity of fertilizer. He is also preparing to buy coal for the winter. Please support him.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and coal

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
Cristina es una madre cabeza de familia de 35 años de edad, una persona responsable, honesta y amorosa, madre de dos hijas de 10 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de deditos de queso, con esta actividad genera el sustento para su hogar.
A Pesar de ser una mujer humilde, Cristina lucha día a día por vender mayor número de productos pues tiene como objetivo pagar la educación superior de su hija.
Para lograr sus objetivos necesita aumentar su producción es por ello que quiere acudir a la ayuda de un préstamo, para comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar más palitos de queso.
El único propósito de Cristina es, que sus hijos estudien y aspiran a una mejor vida que la que tienen ahora.
texts.en:
Cristina, age 35, is a mother and the head of her household. She is a responsible, honest, and loving person. She has two daughters, ages ten and six. She makes cheese sticks. With this business activity she generates the support for her household. In spite of being a humble woman, Crisitina struggles day to day to sell a greater number of products. Her objective is to pay for her daughter's higher education. In order to achieve her objectives, she needs to increase her production.

That is why she wants to turn to the help of a loan to buy the supplies needed to make more cheese sticks. Cristina's only goal is for her children to go to school and to aspire to a better life than the one they have now.

loans.use: to buy the supplies needed to make cheese sticks.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is separated from her husband and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, with her family. She earns a better income from her transportation business and was able to support their daily needs. She also bought some home appliances from her generated income. Her previous loan was used for maintenance of her vehicle and it was repaid successfully.

To make her services more comfortable and safe, she took a new loan recently to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for repair costs. She plans to used her profit to buy a sidecar for improvement of her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and accesories.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is 21 years old. She lives in Nablus with her small family. One year ago she started trading birds. It’s a good business, but still needs a lot of improvement.

She applied for this youth loan to buy different kinds of birds and rabbits per customer requests, and cages and food for them, which will increase her income, helping her to improve the financial conditions for her family.

Farah is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of birds and rabbits per customer requests, and cages and food for them, which will increase her income,.

loans.name: Jana Group

texts.en:
Rana is the featured borrower for Jana Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rana is a 43-year-old married mother of two, who started three years ago selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her customers.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from KIVA's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes. Rana is the first lady on the left.

With respect to the other group members, Sohair is the lady sitting in the middle, and Houriah is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Five months ago, Mary Ann successfully starts her rice retailing business in the town of Baybay, Leyte to earn a living while her husband does driving. She and her husband work hard to provide the needs of their nine-year-old daughter, as to give her good a good life.  In the future, Mary Ann wishes to have enough capital to operate her business continuously. Thus, she is requesting a bigger amount of loans to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Rosa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Rosa is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Rosely

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosely works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Rosely is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to  buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business for her bicycle transport business.

Rosely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Qahraman

texts.en:
Qahraman is 71 years old. He is refugee from the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. Qahraman has a large family. His family consists of seven daughters and one son. Some of them are married and have their own separate families.

Qahraman at this age is known for being tireless and energetic man. He has a beehive and produces honey. Thirty years' experience has made him a great expert in this field. Honey is at great use in Azerbaijan. People like honey for breakfast. Also, many use it for cures against colds and flus. Qahraman sells his honey in the local market. His daughters and only son also support their father in daily activities. Currently, Qahraman is planning to open a new stall in the local market. He requires a 1200 AZN loan. Hopefully KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to open a new stall in the local market

loans.name: Lubang Jati Group

texts.en:
The Lubang Jati group is made up of 5 women who live next door and know each other well and is chaired by Helena, a 36 year old married woman (who standing in the middle of picture) with 3 children. Their ages are between 1 to 8 years old. 2 of them are enrolled in school. To make a living, Helena’s husband – Tomas, 36 is working as a handyman but Helena does not want to lean on him therefore she decided to sell cakes from door to door in her village. With the capital amounting of 300,000 she initiated the business. She has been involved in the business for the last 2 years.

She, through this business, supports her husband with finances . She was thinking to produce more cakes therefore she seeks a loan. Helena and other women got information from an Account Officer on the group loan product provided by TLM for the small entrepreneurs like them. They then formed a group named Lubang Jati and requested a loan of totaling IDR 10,000,000. They are happy for Kiva through TLM cares to their business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of baking ingredients such as; wheat, cooking oil, butter, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
Ambrocio has previously received a loan through Kiva which definitely helped fund the maintenance and registration of his jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service thus continuous income to help support his family's needs.

Once again he trusts you could lend him an amount of 25000 trusts to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney. His transportation business means a lot to him for it helps to adequately provide for their daily needs and fund the education of his children.

To improve his income, he plans to buy another jeepney. He desires for his children to get a College Education to allow them a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina creates different sizes of coin purse, cellphone pouch, backpacks and body bags with the use of beautifully designed ethnic cloths commonly called as “batik”. She has great appreciation to indigenous people’s creativity and she strives to promote it by using their intricately woven or printed cloths as raw materials for her products. She distributes her finished products to stores that sell native items. It’s attractive to foreign and local tourists that usually visit their area.

Rosalina would like to enhance her business further. She anticipates higher demand for her products as the Christmas season approaches. For sure, she would be very busy along with her two helpers. She has to buy volume of raw materials such as cloths, zippers, threads, and other accessories for her business. Additional capital amounting to PHP 50,000 would be enough to meet this need. This will not only help her generate higher income and savings for her and her helpers’ families, but most importantly, it will endorse the use of locally made products and uphold the creativity of indigenous people. 

She is married to Jesus, a Dental Technician. Together, they work really hard to ensure that their children will finish their schooling to obtain stable jobs in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of raw materials such as cloths, zippers, threads, and other accessories to make 'ethnic' design pouches, etc.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marian is 26 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marian has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marian requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, fish, etc..

Marian has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Marian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, vegetable, fish, etc.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 37 years old and has four children. Michelle is a woman and has three children who are in school.

Michelle is in the agricultural business raising pigs  in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Michelle has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
As a married parent, Rosal works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Rosal is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Rosal has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 62 years old. She is married and has four children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Einer De Jesus

texts.es:
Einer es un joven de 23 años de edad, una persona que quiere hacer las cosas bien, obtener recursos y conformar una familia, es padre de una bebe de tan solo 1 año de edad y como persona responsable, honesta y correcta que es, trabaja incasablemente para darle todo a su hija y pareja.
Einer es reciclador, una actividad que aprendió solo, encontró en este trabajo un medio útil y práctico para generar ingresos, poco a poco se ha ido consolidando, sueña en algún momento poder comprar una vivienda, y tener empleados.
En busca de aumentar sus clientes, incrementar su utilidad, tener sostenibilidad del negocio, mejorar y ampliar su inventario, Einer quiere solicitar un apoyo económico principalmente para disponer de dinero para comprar la chatarra, cartón, plástico que diariamente le llevan a su negocio.
Esto le permitirá juntar mayor material para buscar mejores precios con los clientes.
texts.en:
Einer, age 23, is a person who wants to do things well, get resources, and make his family happy. He has a baby that is only one years old. As the responsible, honest, and courteous person that he is, he works tirelessly to give everything to his daughter and life partner.

Einer is a recycler. He learned this business activity by himself. In this work he found a useful and practical way to generate earnings. He has been consolidating little by little. He dreams of sometime being able to buy a house and of having employees. He is looking to increase his number of customers, to increase his profitability, of having a sustainable business, and of improving and expanding his inventory.

Einer wants to request finanial support pirmarily to have the money to buy scrap materials, cardboard, and plastic that is brought to his business daily. This will allow him to get together more material in order to look for better prices with his customers.

loans.use: to buy scrap material, cardboard, and plastic that is taken to his business daily.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia  is 26 years old, married woman. She is been in business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She needs to deal more customers time after time. That is why; she has applied a loan of 40000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will allow her  to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.  She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 55 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Emerita has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 38-years old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s cloths. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not built up a good relationship among his customers, this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now with the increase in their needs they consider it necessary to grow the business. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.

Therefore, Rubina took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothing to sell.
She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Rabiya

texts.en:
Rabiya is 61 years old. She is IDP. Rabiya lives in Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is married. She is involved in raising cattle. She has dozens of cows. She uses them for both milk and meat purposes.

Rabiya is a very energetic and hard-working person. She knows that being a successful farmer in the rural area requires more dedication and expertise. At this age she works tirelessly. Her energy and dedicated approach makes her different and more preferable. She fattens the calves and sells their meat to many clients in the local bazaar. People prefer meat for the traditional foods like kebabs, kufta, etc.

Currently, she is planning to expand her business. Rabiya wants to buy three calves. In order to buy these calves she needs a 1500 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy three calves.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 63 years old, married, and has four children. He is an IDP from Bilasuvar region. He is raising cattle and sheep. Usually he raises them for meat but he also uses the milk for his family's daily needs.

Aziz is a very smart, honest, and hard-working man. He knows how to make the calves fat and sell their meat in the local bazaar. The meat is being sold to clients who use it for traditional dishes such as kebabs and kufta. His meat is raised in a very natural way, which is why people prefer it. Clients trust him and refer him to others.

Aziz requested a loan for 1,200 AZN, which he will use to buy a calf and four sheep.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and four sheep.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.en: Zulhumor was born in 1965 year. She is married and has 2 sons. Her sons are adults. Zulhumor lives with her family together in a house which is located in a rural area. Zulhumor and her husband have animal husbandry business. Zulhumor mainly feeds cows. She works in this field more than 15 years. Zulhumor works hard every day. She is asking for a loan because she must to buy medicines for treatment of her eyes. Zulhumor needs to your financial support and awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her eyes.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is from the town of Valencia, Bohol.  She is 54 years old who has been in the pottery business for fifteen years to make a living. She makes clay pots and clay stoves. Many mothers prefer cooking using clay pots because for them it retains the authentic taste of the food, specially if with the use of firewood. With the demand for this product, she is asking a loan to buy clay, cement and paints. With this additional capital, she can increase her production so she can produce and sell more for her income. Amalia hope to experience progress in life out of this business.

loans.use: to buy clay, cement and paints for making pottery

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of fertilizer, seeds and agro-chemicals.

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of fertilizer, seeds and agro-chemicals.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She operates a farm where she grows onions and other vegetables and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and has three children. Elena is a woman and has three children who are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raised her livestock.

Elena has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Umi, who is a 36-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter.

Umi has been selling vegetables for four years and her husband has been a builder for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Umi will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 39 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Merlita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina who is in his early 30s is married with two children in school. She has been selling fish for seven years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the fish stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees for her two children, to repay loan, bought a TV set, a radio, sofa sets and covered household expenses. She will use his loan to increase on fish stock, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of sending her children to good schools and to build her own house.

Christina will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on fish stock, to buy cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Ulvi

texts.en:
Ulvi is 23 years old and single. He is IDP and lives in Bilasuvar region. Ulvi is very stern man and is loyal to his principles. He knows that success requires dedication and likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from the region where people are more familiar with farming, gives him an advantage in the local market. Ulvi is more familiar with local area people and knows the peoples needs and demands.

In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of meat. He raises calves, fattens and sells their meat. In his locale there are many butchers selling meat. But Ulvi has the advantage, because people know him as an honest person, who sells natural meat.

Currently Ulvi is planning to buy 4 calves and for this he needs 1200 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Visezi Group

texts.en:
SALUMU, who is in his early 60's, is married. He has five children, one of whom is still in school while the others are grown up. He has been running a retail shop selling mostly cereals, for three years now. He works from 6am to 9pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salumu's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his business stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan. He used the profit to reinvest in the business, bought a goat, paid school fees for his child and covered household expenses.

Salumu will use this loan to buy more stock of cereals such as rice, flour, etc., to meet customers' demand. He dreams of opening a wholesale shop of selling cereals..

SALUMU will share this loan with his loan group "VISEZI" which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the stock of cereals such as rice, flours, beans, peas,  etc., to meet  his customers' demand.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has 9 children. He describes himself to be capable. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes, peas, cabbages, maize. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Caroline is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Caroline has a food vending business in the Philippines. Caroline requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like macaroni pasta, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Caroline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Caroline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like macaroni pasta, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 52 years old and widowed. She has five children, one of whom is in school.

Rosalie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. Rosalie has been in this business for 18 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ginger Marie

texts.en:
Ginger Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional frozen foods to sell for her buy and sell frozen foods business.

Ginger Marie has been in this business for 10 years. Ginger Marie earns more income from general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of his family, he left school at early age to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family. Four years ago, Ali started working in the transportation field where he transports students and employees. He is now well-known among his region and has his loyal customers. 
Today, Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to maintain his car's engine. This loan is very important for his car is his only source of income. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase income and improve his living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to maintain his car's engine which is his only source of income

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more water storage containers. His business goal is to be the sole distributor of water within the region within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more water storage containers.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 59 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines, selling veterinary products, which she has been doing for eight years.

Tessie requested her third loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of veterinary products to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of veterinary products to sell.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Paula una mujer de 33 años de edad, una persona independiente, luchadora, una persona perseverante que ha sacado su negocio de elaboración de piezas publicitarias, actividad que desempeña hace 7 años y el cual aprendió a realizar trabajando para un amigo.
Ella trabaja sola, ha sobrevivido en la actividad gracias a sus buenas relaciones, ya que escalar y posicionarse en este medio es complicado principalmente por los precios tan competitivos que en ocasiones son tan difíciles de sostener.
Actualmente se encuentra tras un objetivo el cual es montar su propio local, trabaja informalmente desde su casa, tiene su maquinaria e insumos, con las ganancias alcanza a cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar surtido de artículos para elaborar sus productos, principalmente tintas, variedad de papales y prendas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Paula is a 33-year old woman. She is an independent, persistent person. She is a perseverant person who has launched her own business manufacturing advertising pieces. She has carried out this business for 7 years, after she learned to do it while working for a friend.

She works alone. She has survived in this business thanks to her good relationships, since climbing and positioning oneself in this medium is complicated--mainly because the prices are so competitive that they are on some occasions difficult to sustain.

She is currently coming up on her objective of putting together her own shop. She works informally from her house. She has her machinery and supplies. With the profits she earns enough to cover her basic household necessities.

She currently finds herself requesting a loan in order to buy a selection of items to produce her products--mainly inks, a variety of papers, and wholesale clothes.

loans.use: to buy a selection of articles to produce her products--mainly inks, a variety of papers, and wholesale clothing.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man with two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation of goods. He will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will own a home. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sovichea

texts.en: Sovichea is a 19-year-old single student. He resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. Currently, he is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking in his second year at university. His mother is widowed, and she is a rice farmer. Sovichea is lacking the money to pay his tuition fee from the second to the fourth year, therefore he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through the second to the fourth year successfully. After graduation, he hopes to find a good job in the bank with a decent salary and build a new proper house for his mother for living standards.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee from the second to the fourth year

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Marina, una mujer soltera de 52 años de edad, una mujer que se ha valido de sus habilidades culinarias para salir adelante, puesto que no cuenta con alguien que le ayude económicamente, siempre ha sido ella.
Luz Marina trabaja por un objetivo que es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, tener un alimento para comer, dinero para satisfacer sus necesidades y deseos, por ello solo pide al todo poderoso, tener salud para trabajar que lo demás ella lo hará con sus propias manos.
Actualmente le señora Luz Marina se encuentra solicitando un préstamo que tendrá un doble impacto, pues quiere remodelar su cocina para mejorar la efectividad y tiempo de producción de alimentos, al mismo tiempo que obtendrá una cocina hermosa en su hogar, pues es allí donde produce sus productos.
texts.en: This is Luz Marina, a fifty-two-year-old single woman who has relied on her culinary skills to get ahead, since she has no one to help her out financially, she has always relied on herself. Luz works to improve the condition of her home, to have food to eat, money to pay for what she needs and what she wants. She always asks the All Mighty to give her good health to work, and she will do the rest with her own two hands. Right now Luz Marina is asking for a loan which will have a double impact, as she wants to remodel her kitchen to improve the efficiency of her food production, and at the same time she will have a beautiful kitchen in her home, since that is where she produces her products.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen to optimize her work.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en: Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Santi, who is a 34-year-old, married woman with two daughters. Santi has been selling meatballs for four years, and her husband has been a village official for five years. She has asked for a loan of 7,200,000 IDR from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet and water source at their home to improve access to clean water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to to pay for these improvements, but Santi will be able to repay the loan received. She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build a toilet and water source at their home

loans.name: Sandra Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Sandra de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 10 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Sandra is 50 years old and lives with her husband in her own home. For the last ten years she has run a small shop from her house selling a variety of products including snacks, sodas, basic staples, coffee, soups, eggs, jellies, sugar etc. She has many customers because of her competitive prices. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale for her shop. The shop is her only source of income and will provide improved profits giving her a better life.

loans.use: to make wholesale purchases of snacks, sodas, basic staples, coffee, soup, eggs, jellies, sugar etc

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a divorced woman with three children. She describes herself to be polite. For three years, she has operated a retail business where she sells a variety of goods. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more shoes, socks, brooms and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger and better business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business woman. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn resides in Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines, a village where the main livelihood is farming. She is happily married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer, and the income earned from farming is not enough to provide the needs of the family. Merlyn helps her husband to earn a living. She planted coconut trees for an additional income. It's almost 15 years since Merlyn planted those trees, and now she is getting income from selling the copra (coconut fruits). The area surrounding the trees should be clean so that the trees will bear more fruit. She took out a loan from GDMPC to pay for the maintenance cost. Merlyn hopes the business will help provide for the needs of their children. If the profit increases in the coming year, she would like to save it to purchase new land to plant more coconut trees.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance cost

loans.name: Munis

texts.en:
Munis,who is in his early 30's is married and has no children. He has been running a general store for four years now. He works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Munis's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase on general store inventory and has managed to pay his loan successfully. He is so happy with the loan and appreciates. He used the profit to take care of himself, his parents, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the general store stock. Munis dreams of expanding his business.

Munis will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the general store stock.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 28-year-old married mother of four children and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started at the beginning sewing and baking bread to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved kids. After she took training sessions in the sewing field, she decided a year ago, to focus on the sewing business but she faced some financial difficulties.

Thus, today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new sewing machine which will facilitate her business and allow her to provide customers with better and quick service.
Zainab hopes to expand her business through opening her own shop to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to facilitate her business .

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables as well as farming. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. This is her sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. 

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for the farm and cabbages, onions, kales, tomatoes, and fruits for the green grocery business. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and financially stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for the farm and cabbages, onions, kales, tomatoes, and fruits for the green grocery business.

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron needs your compassion and he needs your financial help as well. He is a father of two in his early 60's and lately has been having health complicated issues and his condition becomes evident from the picture. He has had multiple surgeries in the past and has been fed through a tube that must be replaced very soon. To do that he has to go to Greece where he has been treated from the very beginning.

90,000 Albanian Lek will be used for the procedure and 30,000 Albanian Lek will be used for the travel by bus. Agron and his wife own some land, yet neither one of them cannot do any rural activities due to their health issues, thus, their income is the disability income for both making it very difficult financially living on a total of $250/month for them both.

"Sometimes our kids help us, but they are poor as well.they have their own families to feed and care," said Agron's wife who did not want to be in the photograph.

loans.use: Agron suffers from complicated health issues and this loan will be used for such expenses

loans.name: Chames

texts.en:
Chames is a 27-year-old married mother of four. Ten years ago, she started working in agriculture to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has professional skills in this domain. She gained experience from her parents.

Chames is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to apply an irrigation canal network and plant pecan trees which will facilitate her work and increase her production.
Chames hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to apply an irrigation canal network and plant pecan trees.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 46 years old, married, and has one child. He has been working as an accountant for seven years to support his family and provide them with the necessary standards of living.

Samer is a hard working man and is putting so much effort to succeed. Education is his main aim, and providing his family members with the best is what he seeks for even though to achieve this goal he needs a loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to pay or his son's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his son's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She has a retail shop which she has been running for 15 years. This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully paid her previous loans.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to educate her children.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, milk, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married and has three children. He describes himself as kind. He operates a photography business, which he has been doing for four years. His business is located in a marketable place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Richard requested a loan for 30,000 KES, which he will use to buy photography materials. He hopes that in the future he will be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase photography materials.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 43 and a married father of two; 18 and 12 and their family lives in a village in the northern Albania located along the national road leading to countries such as Montenegro, Croatia etc. It's in his advantage that his site work where he makes things of marble & stones is off this road, because by-passers end up buying items from him, with some of them becoming steady clients, according to him. Roland has been running this activity for the past twelve years making a monthly income of approximately $285.

"The money I make is not enough for our family; I'm the breadwinner for the family and as the children grow they demands grow as well, making the money seem less and less everyday,' said Roland to the loan officer.

In the little land his family owns, they just plant the family's staple food and have also ten olive grooves and fifteen chickens all for the family.
The loan will be used to buy marble/stones for his activity.

loans.use: Roland works with stones & marble and he needs to buy marble in order to make all things made of it.

loans.name: Wilson Jose

texts.es:
7 días a la semana, 6 horas diarias, es el tiempo que dedica Wilson a su negocio de fabricación de baldosas y adobes, una actividad que nació de la necesidad económica de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad.
Wilson es un hombre Humilde, con trabajo y perseverancia tiene claro que sacara su familia hacia adelante, su propósito es brindarles una excelente vida y educación a sus pequeños, que no tengan que repetir sus pasos y conformarse con un negocio que solo alcanza para cubrir las necesidades básicas, está en él la oportunidad de crecer y ser una gran empresa para dejarle una buena herencia a sus hijos.
Wilson quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de baldosas y adobes, principalmente cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Six hours per day, seven days a week is the time Wilson spends at his business making tiles and adobe bricks. This activity was born out of the need to generate income to sustain his wife and three children aged 16, 14 and 10 years old.

Wilson is simple man who with work and perseverance is certain he will get his family ahead. His goal is to provide his young ones with an excellent life and education so they don't have to follow his footsteps and be satisfied with a business that only manages to cover the basic necessities. There is the opportunity to grow and become a large business to leave as a good inheritance for his children.
