Wilson wants to request a loan to buy materials to make tiles and abode bricks, mainly cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy materials to make tiles and adobe bricks.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 35-year-old, married mother of five children. Eighteen years ago, she started working as a hairdresser, and she has professional skills in this domain.

Kholoud and her husband are working hard to satisfy their children's increasing needs and expenses, as they are sacrificing themselves for the sake of their children.

Despite their two businesses, their income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses. Thus, today, Kholoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house through buying necessary salon furniture.

Kholoud hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and provide her kids with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house through buying necessary salon furniture.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be kind.

Naomi operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado María Auxiliadora II están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida,  es por ello que ponen todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella además de ser una de las que integra este grupo es la presidenta, siempre se esfuerza para poder sobresalir y ser un ejemplo para las demás integrantes.
 La Sra. María solicita  este préstamo para la compra de ropas de temporada para mejorar la variedad de sus prendas de vestir, con esfuerzo de todos los días, logrará mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called María Auxiliadora II is part of a program of eradication of poverty. They want to improve their living conditions, and that is why they make every effort to grow and succeed.

One of the members is María, who is very hard working and perseverant. Besides being one of the members, she is also the president of the group. She always tries to excel and to be an example for the other members.

María requests this loan to buy seasonal clothing to improve the variety of her clothing items. With her daily efforts, she will succeed in improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to improve the variety of her clothing items.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 29-year-old, married father of one child. He has been working in selling fruits and vegetables for 10 years to provide his family with a good income business and develop their living.

Hamza is a hardworking man; in parallel to his current business, he works in a construction business specialized in outer stone decoration, but this business isn't one with a daily income — it depends on projects acquired.

That's why Hamza is working hard to expand and develop his fruits and vegetables selling business. For this reason, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with special seasonal products highly requested by his customers.

He hopes to keep on expanding and diversifying his products to reach a wholesale level of business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special seasonal products highly requested by his customers.

loans.name: Jonigul

texts.en:
Jonigul is widowed. She is the only feed keeper of her child. She started her own business with buying and selling women's clothes three years ago because she needed to have the source of income.

Jonigul sells a variety of women's clothes in a local market where she has a store. Jonigul works hard and tries hard for the well-being of her child. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods, and in this way, she tries to attract more buyers.

Jonigul is going to buy a new assortment of goods for the new season, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy clothes for the new season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Abadacogorakumurimo Group

texts.en:
Rachel, holding the book in the picture, is the president of Abadacogorakumurimo Group. The group consists of 16 members although only 12 are in the picture.

Rachel is 65 years old, married, and has one child. She operates a beans and sorghum business. She works from 6 AM until 5 PM every day, and still manages her household.

Rachel requested a loan from Vision Finance Company, which she will use to purchase a large quantity of beans and sorghum to sell. She intends to use the profits from her business to save for the future and to pay school fees for her child. Rachel has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2012 to develop her business and is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Centrine

texts.en:
Centrine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and mobile phones. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and mobile phones. She hopes that in the future, she will own a company.

She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and mobile phones.

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Adjowavi est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans résidant à Agoè. Adjowavi est une coiffeuse qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de ses marchandises et expose dans son salon de coiffure  pour vendre à ses clients. Adjowavi nécessite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de mèches en vue de gagner des bénéfices suite à une bonne vente puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à subvenir à certaines charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjowavi, age 33, is married with 3 children. She lives in Agoè where she works as a hairdresser. She buys merchandise 3 times per month at the market to sell out of her salon.

Adjowavi is seeking this loan to purchase dozens of hair extensions. She hopes that a boost in sales will bolster her profits. She wants to support her children's studies and help to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen hair extensions.

loans.name: Nurian Amparo

texts.es: Nurian es una microempresaria independiente domiciliada en el municipio de Bogotá en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge, ella aprendió a mantener el equilibrio entre sus labores en el hogar, su rol de madre de dos hijos y su trabajo, permitiéndole llevar a cabo cada responsabilidad en consideración a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su negocio inició cuando recibió la propuesta de una docente del colegio en donde ella laboraba, quien tenía una papelería y miscelánea, oportunidad que no desaprovechó y en la actualidad lleva 13 años funcionando con muy buenos resultados.  Nurian apertura su negocio a partir de las 7 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 5 p.m. todos los días de la semana, permitiendo el acceso a estudiantes de colegio y personas del sector que requieren de servicio de fotocopiadora, corresponsal no bancario en donde recibe pagos a terceros  y comercio de variedades y papelería. Nurian solicitó un crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en mantenimiento de sus equipos y el resto del capital lo destinará a comprar libretas, plumeros, lápices, carpetas, cartulinas, marcadores y demás. Su meta a futuro es que sus clientes sigan fidelizados y en lo personal desea ver a sus hijos prosperar.
texts.en:
Nurian is a small-business owner residing in the city of Bogotá with her spouse. She has learned how to balance her housework, her role as a mother of two, and her work. She is able to take on each of these responsibilities in order to improve her family's quality of life.

She started her business when a teacher at the school where she used to work offered her an office-supplies shop she owned. She took the opportunity and accepted. She has been running the store for thirteen years now with very positive results.

Her business is open from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm every day of the week. Her customers are students from the school, as well as people in the neighborhood who need photocopies. She also processes money transfers and sells office supplies and novelty items.

Nurian is requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which is her first Kiva loan. She will invest it in equipment maintenance, and use whatever is left over to buy notebooks, pens, pencils, folders, cardstock paper, markers, and other merchandise. Her long-term goal is to maintain her customers' loyalty and, on a personal level, to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to invest in equipment maintenance and stock up on notebooks, pens, pencils, folders, card stock, markers, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 56-year-old married woman who has been working in selling home products and toys for eleven years. She started her business to help her husband in making their living.
She is acquiring her third loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with new collections of products and toys to satisfy her customers' demands. She is a hardworking woman, with a special trading talent and a remarkable reputation.
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collections of products and toys to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La Joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una clinica veterinaria desde hace 4 años ubicada cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes ya que realiza un buen trabajo y con lo que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de productos de veterinaria y maquina para cortar pelo y asi poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The young woman who has had her face blurred because she is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone has had a veterinary clinic for four years. It is located near her home. She has many clients because she does a good job. She is able to cover some household expenses with what she earns. She lives in her own home with her family.

She is asking for the loan to purchase veterinary products and an electric grooming razor to continue with her work.

loans.use: A loan of $1,200 helps this borrower to purchase veterinary products and an electric razor for grooming.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna con 40 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Giovanna cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a ala agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Giovanna se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, así como al servicio agrícola. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales para su negocio y otros gastos personales.De esta manera obtendrá un mayor ingreso y por consiguiente una mejora en su calidad de vida.

Giovanna es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 40 years old and her civil status is married. She lives together with her husband and their two children in the Zaña district, which is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, in Peru.

Giovanna has very good references, both personal and professional, from the region's inhabitants. The people in her village work mainly in agriculture, trade and breeding livestock. Giovanna makes a living breeding and selling animals, and also in farming. She is requesting a loan to buy animals for her business and for other personal expenses. She will increase her earnings this way and therefore improve her quality of life. 

Giovanna is a recurring member at Edypme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals for her business and for other personal expenses.

loans.name: Mary Queen

texts.en:
Mary Queen is a 26-year-old woman from the municipality of Valencia in the province of Bohol. She has a four-year-old daughter. For six years she has made clay pots, flower pots and stoves for a living. She also started selling beauty soaps recently.

Mary Queen is asking for a loan to buy clay and beauty soaps to sell. Once these are available she can be assured of increasing output. Mary Queen hopes that someday she can expand her business and be more profitable so she can raise her daughter and give her the right support for her education.

loans.use: to buy clay and beauty soaps

loans.name: Cesar Alfonso

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre de 31 años de edad, que trabaja todos los días y lucha incansablemente por sacar su profesión de maestro de obra adelante, es una persona humilde y honesta, un hombre casado, serio y comprometido, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y actualmente está buscando un apoyo para comprar la herramienta complementaria que necesita para prestar un excelente servicio.
Con el dinero solicitado comprara los siguientes materiales: taladro, sierra eléctrica y corta baldosa.
Su propósito a largo plazo es construir con sus propias manos una vivienda, consolidarse el gremio de construcción y siempre tener trabajo para darle una excelente calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 31 years old. He works every day and fights tirelessly for his professional success as a construction foreman. He is a humble and honest man, earnest and dependable. He is married and has a three-year-old child.

Currently he is looking for financial support to buy additional tools that he needs in order to provide excellent services. He will use the money he is requesting to buy a drill, an electric saw, and a tile cutter.

His long-term goals are to build a house with his own hands, to become well established professionally, and to always have enough work so that he can give his family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Gustavo Manuel

texts.es:
Trabajar por un mejor futuro, trabajar por sus dos princesas, simplemente trabajar porque es la mejor manera de salir de la pobreza, es el pensamiento del señor Gustavo que con su negocio de cría de cerdos busca pagar la educación de sus hijas, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Gustavo se dedica a la cría de cerdos y pensando en aumentar su cantidad de animales y tener mayor espacio quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para construir una porqueriza y el resto de capital será destinado en cerdos, alimento, vacunas y vitaminas.
 Un apoyo será muy significativo para el trabajo de Gustavo no solo en la parte laboral sino anímica, la motivación que le dará saber que hay personas que apoyan a emprendedores y luchadores de la vida como él, lo hacen volver un mejor trabajador y creer que todo lo que hace tiene sentido.
texts.en:
Working for a better future, working for his two princesses, simply working because it is the best way to get out of poverty. Gustavo's idea is that with his business raising pigs he is looking to pay his daughter's education and improve the conditions of his house.

Gustavo works raising pigs and is thinking of increasing the quantity of animals and have a better place for them. He wants to request a loan to invest in buying materials to construct a pigpen and the rest of the money will be used for pigs, feed, vaccinations and vitamins.

This support would be very significant for Gustavo's work and also for his soul, motivation knowing that there are people who support entrepreneurs and fighters in life like him. It would make him a better worker and believe that what he is doing makes sense.

loans.use: to buy material to construct a pigpen, buy pigs, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Don armando de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y ganado bovino desde hace 10 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de comida para cerdos y asi poder continura con la crianza ya que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Armando is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their three children. For the past ten years, he has been working raising pigs and cattle. He sells his products in the surrounding villages and has lots of regular customers. The profit he makes allows him to cover some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy pig feed so that he can continue raising pigs, because this business earns him a good income.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Dúo Gardenias De San Bartolo Group

texts.es: Dúo Gardenias de San Bartolo Este dúo está formado por doña Rosa Audelia, ella tiene 55 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de refacción en la  calle principal de san Bartolo y los fines de semana vende tamales, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su venta de refacciones y compra de un par de ollas para frituras, su mayor deseo es que  Fape la siga apoyando como hasta ahora y sobre todo seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Audelia is a member of Dúo Gardenias de San Bartolo. She is 55 years old and makes her living selling snacks on San Bartolo's main street. On weekends she sells tamales.

She is requesting this loan to invest in her snack sales and to buy two frying pans. Her greatest hope is for Fape continue to support her as it has been doing and, more than anything, to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make snacks for resale.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 33 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marita operates a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Marita requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy containers of coconut wine to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Adalgisa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Adalgisa es una mujer de 63 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene un hijo mayor de edad, es  una persona que trabaja por comprar sus medicamentos, sus alimentos, por tener una vida digna y no pasar necesidades, vive y ama el campo, optó por convertir en criadero de cerdos, puesto que es la profesión que desde pequeña le han inculcado y la cual le ha dado de comer por largos años.
Pensando en la estabilidad de su negocio, la señora Adalgisa quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de lechones, alimento para cerdo, vacunas, vitaminas, todo ello pensando en continuar con la profesión que ha desempeñado pro largos años y seguir con el ritmo de vida al cual esta tan acostumbrada.
texts.en:
Adalgisa is a 63 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has an older son. She is a person who works to be able to purchase her medications and her food to have a worthy life and not lack the necessities. She lives in the country and loves it. She decided to become a piglet raiser, given that since she was little, it was the profession that was instilled in her. It was also the profession that has fed her for many years.

Planning for the stablility of her business, Adalgisa would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets, pig food, vaccines and vitamins. All of this while planning to continue with the profession that she has been in for many years and to continue with the rhythm of life to which she is accustomed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, pig food, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, who is married and has a business in the Philippines, works hard to support her five children. She has requested a PHP 10400 loan through NWTF to buy solar equipment because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Nancy is aware that by using solar power, she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar equipment.

loans.name: Circiaco

texts.en:
Ciriaco is a hard working married man. He earns a living by operating a tricycle (rickshaw). He transports passengers from one place to the other with a particular fee. He resides in the rural town of Getafe, Bohol together with his wife and three children. Aside from operating a rickshaw, he also engages in buying scrap metal as an additional source of income to the entire family.


He wants to access loans to boost his sources of livelihood. Ciriaco has requested a loan to buy tricycle parts and additional capital for his scrap business. These will slowly augment his earnings and continue to provide his family with healthy diets. Then he will be able to start to set aside some of the profit for emergency use.

With his previous loan, Ciriaco managed to invest in transportation services, for which he is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy tricycle parts and additional capital for his scrap business.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She sells blankets and spread sheets. She always has a great collection, which she buys from the wholesale market, to offer to her customers. She has a strong customer base.

Meena requested a loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a greater variety of blankets in different colors for her business. This loan will give a boost to her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of blankets in different colors for her business

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.es:
Escolástica es una mujer humilde, trabajadora, honesta y honrada, una persona que cumple con sus obligaciones, madre de 7 hijos, una enorme responsabilidad que la conllevo a iniciar un negocio de cría de cerdos y gallinas puesto que su pareja no podía conseguir los recursos suficientes para mantener su abundante familia, puesto que viven en un modesto hogar, donde quizás puedan faltar muchos lujos, muebles, pero sobra el amor y las ganas de sacar a sus hijos adelante.
Su principal objetivo en la vida es trabajar para su familia, mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus seres amados y brindarles un pequeño rayo de luz, una ilusión, una oportunidad de aspirar a otro tipo de vida, inculcarles de pequeño que estudien para que sean alguien en la vida.
Escolástica actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gallinas, cerdos, alimento y vacunas.
texts.en:
Escolástica is a humble, hardworking, honest and honorable woman. She is a person who fulfills her obligations, a mother to seven children which is an enormous responsibility. This led her to start a business raising pigs and chickens, as her spouse could not earn enough money to maintain their large family. They live in a modest home where they are lacking, perhaps, luxuries and furniture, but where love and a desire to let their children succeed abound.

Her principle objective in live is to work for her family and better the conditions of the lives of her loved ones. She would like to offer them a small ray of light, an illusion, an opportunity to aspire to another type of life. To instill in them from childhood that the should study to be someone in life.

Escolástica is asking for a loan to purchase chickens, pigs, food and vaccines.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, food and vaccines.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel es un hombre de 53 años de edad, él vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 23 años de edad al que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Manuel se dedica a prestar sus servicios de molida de nixtamasa en su vivienda, con un molino que adquirió, y con lo cual se gana la vida. Manuel desea reparar las paredes de su vivienda, ya que estas se encuentran deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para reparar las paredes de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 53 years old and lives with his life partner and their son, who is now 23 and whom he raised with lots of hard work. Manuel works providing grinding services with a corn mill that he purchased. This is how he makes a living.

Manuel wants to repair the walls of his home because they are in disrepair. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, and gravel, so that he can repair the walls and provide safety for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to repair the walls of his home.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has been a fish vendor for almost 10 years now. She sells fresh fish to the locals in her place of residence.

Julieta is a 39-year old married married woman with three children. Her oldest child is 17, and the youngest is 12. Her husband is a fisherman. His catch is a source of income and for consumption as well.

Julieta would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to enhance her current source of income. She has requested a loan to buy fresh fish, foam (for fish storage) and fishing net. These could help boost her income and continue to improve her business to become productive, which would help augment the catch of her husband and improve the economy of her family.

Julieta hopes that someday she will successfully manage her livelihood well and also continue to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, foam (for fish storage) and fishing net.

loans.name: Lesiel

texts.en:
Lesiel is 43 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is from Buhangin, Davao City. Her husband is a senior salesman.

One major key in the success of any business is the capacity of the entrepreneur to gauge the prevailing needs of the consumers. Leisel wants to take advantage of the Christmas season, so she decided to venture into paper bag or gift bag making. This is in addition to her existing businesses which are variety store and Piso Net.

Lesiel distributes her finished gift bags to several retailers in the city. They are very willing to resell her products because these items are in demand this Christmas season and beyond. Many people are too busy to do the gift wrapping themselves, so they prefer to buy gift bags. Besides being fashionable, these are also reusable.

With positive anticipation, Lesiel plans to produce more of these gift bags. She requested a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy thick gift wrappers, card boards, rolls of yarn, glue, and gift tags.

Lesiel dreams of a happy and successful life together with her whole family. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase gift wrappers, card boards, rolls of yarn, glue, and gift tags.

loans.name: Ludivico

texts.en:
From the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, Ludivico is 55 years old, married to Percy, a housewife, and the father of two elementary school-age children. Being a tricycle driver is no easy task, but Ludivico does not mind the scorching sun nor the rains on the road during rainy season as long as he can provide for his wife and children.

Ludivico has been tricycle driver for three years already. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. Since proper and regular maintenance of the tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service, he is humbly seeking your help in the amount of 8000 PHP to pay for new tires, oil, a tuneup and fuel for his tricycle.

Ludivico aims to acquire another tricycle to augment his income, better provide for his family's needs and save enough for his children's college education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, oil, a tuneup and fuel for his tricycle.

loans.name: Javier Mauricio

texts.es:
El sueño de Mauricio es tener una taberna, un sitio de diversión para adultos, pero uno donde prime la alegría, que sea reconocido por su sabor, por su música, por su ambiente, un lugar donde las personas se encuentren para bailar y disfrutar de un buen trago, este es el gran proyecto que hoy Mauricio puede darle inicio, pues actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de sillas, mesas, cemento, madera y surtido de cervezas, son los insumos restantes para completar la construcción del su lugar soñado.
Para Mauricio es muy importante este préstamo, no solo porque terminara la construcción de su local, sino porque todos sus esfuerzos, ahorros, los tiene invertidos en este negocio, donde espera crecer financieramente y brindarle una excelente calidad de vida a su muchacho de 10 años de edad al igual que a su pareja con quien vive en unión libre.
texts.en:
Mauricio's dream is to have a bar. A place for adults to relax, but one where happiness dominates that is known for it's flavor, it's music and it's atmosphere. A place where people meet to dance and enjoy a good drink. This is the project that Mauricio wants to start as he is currently requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables, cement, wood and an assortment of beer. These are the remaining supplies to complete construction on his dream place.

This loan is very important for Mauricio not only as it will complete construction of his bar but also all his efforts and savings are invested in this business. With it he hopes to grow financially and provide an excellent quality of living for his 10 year old son as well as his partner who he lives with in a common-law relationship.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, cement, wood and an assortment of beer.

loans.name: Gisela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gisela es una madre cabeza de familia, una persona que se está esforzando enormemente por generar los ingresos necesarios para pagar la educación de sus dos hijas adolescentes.
Gisela se dedica a la confección, adoptó el papel de padre y madre al momento que su esposo falleció y ahora junto con sus hijas quienes le colaboran mucho en el taller, trabajan para salir juntas adelante y progresar.
Actualmente para mejorar sus ingresos están tratando de sacar una línea de propia de confección, pero necesitan un apoyo en la compra de insumos, pensando en tener éxito puesto que se avecina la temporada navideña 
Por ello  solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos decorativas para elaborar blusas.
texts.en:
Gisela is the head of household for her family. She is making an enormous effort to earn enough to pay the required school fees for her two teenage daughters' education. She makes her living as a seamstress. She took on the role of mother and father when her husband passed away. Now she and her two daughters, who help her a lot in the shop, are working hard together to get ahead.

In order to improve their income they are currently trying to start a new clothing line of their own design but they need help to buy the supplies. They expect to be successful as the Christmas season is approaching. They are requesting loan to buy fabric, thread and other decorative supplies to make blouses.

loans.use: to buy supplies to start her own clothing line.

loans.name: Robert Edson

texts.es:
Robert continúa estudiando y trabajando en su tienda de barrio. El crédito que obtuvo lo empleó comprando una computadora portátil, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su tienda funcionó correctamente. Actualmente su tienda trabaja todos los días y él continúa estudiando, “sigo con mi tienda de barrio y a punto de finalizar mis estudios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su tienda es bastante surtida, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar libros. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y ejercer su carrera, él desea comprar sus libros finales para rendir los últimos exámenes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Robert solicita un préstamo para comprar los últimos libros de su carrera para finalizarla.
texts.en:
Robert continues studying and working in his neighborhood store. He used the prior loan he got to buy a laptop. The payment of his dues was punctual because his store did well. 

Currently his store operates every day and he continues to study, "I continue with my neighborhood store and I'm close to finishing my studies..." Robert says. The benefit of his business is that his store is pretty well stocked. The drawback is the lack of money to buy books. His dream is to finish studying and practice his profession. He would like to buy his last set of books to study for his final tests. 

This is the second set of loans with the institution in the 2 years that he has been working on both activities. For these reasons, Robert requests a loan to buy the last set of books to finalize his degree.

loans.use: to buy the last set of books to finish his degree.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
One lighted candle can illuminate a room. A person who is a blessing to others is like a candle that brings light and warmth in the house. Merlyn is a blessing to others because she has the capacity to give employment to five workers in her candle making shop located in Buhangin, Davao City. She’s been in this candle making business for twenty years now. She continuously appreciates the importance of candles, such as emergency lighting in case of electric interruption, as decorative items, or fragrances. Because of these uses, candles are sellable throughout the whole year.

Merlyn would like to enhance her business further so as to secure the salaries of her workers, to ensure that her children will finish their college degrees, and to establish a grocery store in the near future. As a step towards realizing these dreams, she would like to borrow PHP 8,000 additional capital to procure raw materials for candle making. It will surely increase her production, sales and profit.

Merlyn is married to Candido, a furniture maker, who also works really hard to improve their lives. They hope to become channels of blessings to other people in need.

Merlyn meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to procure raw materials for her candle making business

loans.name: Dairo

texts.es:
Dario es un simpático habitante del sector rural de Momil, una persona muy enérgica que se dedica a vender productos de la canasta familiar, vive en unión libre con su pareja, no tiene hijos pero aspira en un futuro poder tener descendientes.
Dario encuentra en su negocio una dificultad que es el acceso a la vereda, lo que imposibilita que pueda surtir muy seguido puesto que debe desplazarse a la cabecera municipal y esto lleva un gasto grande en transporte de alimentos.
Dario se encuentra en etapa de consolidación, ha ido surtiendo su tienda poco a poco, crece a la medida que sus ingresos se lo permitan pero aún debe adquirir varios productos que escasean en su tienda.
Pensando en ser un tendero más completo y poder cumplir las expectativas de sus clientes, el señor Dario solicita un préstamo para la compra de un enfriador y productos como abarrotes y de refrigeración, una inversión que ayudara mucho en las ventas pues tendrá disponibles productos lácteos y refrescos que son tan solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dario is a kind inhabitant of the rural sector of Momil, an energetic person who sells groceries. He lives with his spouse, he does not have kids but hopes to have some children in the future.

Dario has a problem in his business with an access to the street, which makes frequent deliveries difficult, as he would have to displace the municipal buildings. This adds to the transportation costs.

Dario is now in a consolidation period. He has begun stocking his store little by little. He has increased his stock but should still add various products that are scarce in his store.

Hoping to be a more complete shopkeeper able to fulfill his clients' expectations, Dario is asking for a loan to purchase a cooler and products such as groceries and some refrigerated products. This investment will help him in sales as he will have dairy products and sodas which are much requested by his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler and products such as groceries and refrigerated items.

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Angela es una madre cabeza de familia que quiere iniciar un negocio como independiente de venta de mercancía y ropa, para complementar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, pues es empleada.
Ella tiene dos hijos, uno de 17 y el menor de 13, como madre responsable, amorosa quiere lo mejor para ellos, estudio, lujos, que crezcan en un buen ambiente, rodeado de amigos, juegos, didácticas y es su responsabilidad brindarles todo esto y más.
Al ser madre cabeza de familia todos los gastos recaen en ella y con su salario básico siempre se ve muy apretada para pagar todas las deudas, hasta el punto de endeudarse, pero ya que su mentalidad es progresar, quiere montar su negocio y generar buenas utilidades que le permitan tener un mejor presente y futuro.
Con el monto solicitado la señora Luz Angela comprara ropa para todos los géneros, accesorios y calzado, inicialmente distribuirá a sus amigos, familiares y conocidos.
texts.en:
This is Luz Angela, a mother's who head of her household and wants to start an independent business selling clothing and merchandise to provide the additional income she needs to support her family. She currently works as an employee.

She has two kids, the elder is 17 and the younger is 13. As a responsible, loving mother she wants the best for them, an education, luxuries, to grow up in a good environment, surrounded by friends, games, teaching and her responsibility is to give them all of these things and more. As a mother who's head of a household she bears all of the expenses and with her base income paying everything she owes is very tough, to the point that she has indebted herself, but her's focused on moving forward and wants to set up her business and generate good revenue that will allow her to have a better present and future.

With the the amount requested Luz Angela will purchase all types of clothing, accessories, and footwear. At first she'll sell to her friends, relatives, and acquaintances.

loans.use: To purchase all kinds of clothing, accessories, and footwear. At first she'll sell to friends, relatives and acquaintances.

loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
Marly is a married woman with six children. Marly is 39 years old and five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marly has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

Marly has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Lucia

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer enérgica, una persona inquieta, activa, se levanta a primera hora a trabajar en sus cultivos, también tiene un criadero de cerdos el cual es su actividad principal, puesto que los años de experiencia le dan el aval de ser una empresaria seria y responsable en sus actividades.
Heredo su negocio de su padre, que fue el que le enseño a realiza su actividad, a la cual le dedica 10 horas todos los días de la semana, pues busca siempre mejorar como empresa, para aumentar sus ganancias y tener sostenibilidad de su negocio.

Actualmente han nacidos muchos emprendedores que han optado por la cría de cerdos, algo que la motiva pues su profesión está haciéndose popular entre los empresarios de la zona y le da un compromiso de ser un ejemplo de empresaria, por ello no se descuida ni se relaja.

Carmen quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, alimentos y vacunas en grandes cantidades, también quiere comprar mercancía de materiales para adecuar y construir porquerizas.
texts.en:
Carmen is an energetic woman. She is restless and active as she is up at first light to work on her crops. She also has a nursery of piglets which is her main activity. Her years of experience have given her the support to be a serious and responsible businessperson .

She inherited her business form her father. He taught her how to succeed at this activity, to which she dedicates 10 hours a day, every day of the week. She is always looking to improve as a business to increase her earnings and to have sustainability in her business.

Lately many people have started businesses raising pigs. This motivates her as her profession is becoming popular among businesses in the area. This gives her the commitment to be a business example, for this reason she does not neglect her business nor does she relax.

Carmen is asking for a loan to purchase pigs, feed and vaccines in large quantities. She also wants to purchase materials to build pigpens.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and vaccines in large quantities.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Mariyam, who is a 39-year-old married woman with two children.

Mariyam has been selling fish for around twenty five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 8,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and a water supply but Mariyam will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Elisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Ella es Elisa, una mujer admirable, una persona trabajadora, una madre cabeza de familia que sale a trabajar todos los días, las horas que sean necesarias para llevar el alimento a su amada familia, conformada por 4 hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas, tiene un puesto que con mucho esfuerzo compro y es con esto que genera el sustento para sus muchachos.
Hoy es un día diferente, Elisa puede tener un cambio radical en su vida, pero para ello necesita tu apoyo, ya que ante ella está la enorme oportunidad de comprar un restaurante en funcionamiento y el monto que actualmente se encuentra solicitando es para completar el dinero necesario para adquirirlo.
texts.en: This is Elisa, an admirable woman, a hardworking person and the head of her family. She goes out to work every day for as many hours necessary to provide food for her beloved family, which consists of 4 children of 13, 10, 8 and 6 years of age. She sells food from a stall which she worked very hard to buy and this enables her to earn enough to support her children. Today is a different day. Elisa can radically change her life, but to do so, she needs your help as she has the wonderful opportunity of buying an established restaurant and the amount which she is seeking will enable her to buy it.

loans.use: to buy an established restaurant

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy thanks *CCT and Kiva from the bottom of her heart for their untiring spiritual and financial support of her transportation business. It has made it possible for her tricycle to be properly maintained and thus allowed her family to have a steady income.

Regular maintenance is necessary for the efficient and safe service of her tricycle which leads her to request a PHP 10,000 loan to pay for some spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle. She thanks God for your continuous support of her livelihood.

Daisy aims to sustain and grow her transportation business to allow her better opportunities in life and so she can send her child to the best schools. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Merlissa

texts.en:
Merlissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlissa has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing nets.

In the future, Merlissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Fedda

texts.en:
Fedda is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and her only child. Her husband represents the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her child with his education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of her child's study fees.

She will be more than happy to see him achieving his education properly and she said that she will be a permanent Kiva's Clients.

loans.use: to pay her child's study fees

loans.name: Telma Edelmira

texts.es: Telma a sus 28 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 5 años de edad a la que siempre busca brindar lo mejor. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años contando con muchos clientes. Telma desea mejorar su vivienda, ya que los soportes del techo son de madera y se encuentran deteriorados, además el piso es de tierra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir los pilares y encementar el piso de su vivienda, y de esta manera cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Telma, at the age of 28, lives with her life companion and their five-year-old daughter, for whom she always seeks to offer the best. She sells fruits and vegetables, work that she has been doing for two years, with many customers.

Telma wants to improve her house, since the supports for the roof are of wood and are deteriorated. In addition, the floor is of earth. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build the pillars and cement the floor of her house and in this way care for the safety of her household.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build the pillars and cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 23-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing the spare parts of sewing machines for many years. He buys steel scrap material from the market and puts it into a high temperature oven to melt. The raw material melts under high temperature and then he injects it into the dies, to give the material specific shape. In this way, he manufactures the spare parts, sells them in the market, and makes enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood.

Kiran has two children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her sixth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan and it will be her first loan with Kiva.

Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing sewing machine parts, so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business.

Kiran is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for manufacturing sewing machine parts for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rosevida

texts.en:
Rosevida is 55 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Rosevida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries.

Rosevida has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from mineral water. Rosevida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nemai

texts.en:
Nemai works hard to support her family. She is married and has a seaweed culturing business in the Philippines.

Nemai has requested a 18,000 Nemai loan through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc. She has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Nemai would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es: Asunción es un hombre trabajador de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, a la que siempre está buscando la manera de brindar lo mejor. Él es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 2 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes. Asunción no cuenta con energía eléctrica en su vivienda, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, toma corriente, caja térmica entre otros materiales para instalar energía eléctrica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Asuncion is a hardworking 27 year old man who lives with his wife and a 4 year old daughter, and he's always looking for ways to provide her with the best. He's a hardworking man whose job has been selling french bread and pastries which enables him to support his family. This is what he's done for two years so he has lots of customers.

Asuncion's home doesn't have electricity so he's decided to apply for a FUSAI loan to invest in: electric wiring, outlets, and an electrical panel among other materials to install electricity in his home.

loans.use: To invest in: electric wiring, power outlets, and an electrical panel among other materials to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a coconut wine-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell through her coconut wine-vending business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Mtendere Group

texts.en:
Femiya is 35 and married. Her husband sells sells secondhand clothes. She has five children and one orphan who depend on her.

Femiya sells used clothes for a living. She is going to use this loan to buy one bale of used clothes to sell. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her children. She started her business to be self-dependent.

Femiya hopes for her business to grow from buying one bale to three bales of used clothes in years to come.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 53-year-old lady who lives with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. When she got newly married, her financial condition was very poor because her husband was not very skillful working with lathe machines. He has been learning the techniques for using lathes from professionals. Now that he knows how to operate them, he can conduct his newly started business. Due to his lack of experience, his lathe got damaged and needs maintenance.

Bushra requested a loan for her husband so he could repair his lathe and buy additional tools, dies, spare parts, etc. Bushra is tension-free now because she hopes that her husband will be an expert soon and earn a reasonable income as an expert turner. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair lathe machine and buy tools, dies, spare parts, etc. for the her husband's manufacturing  business.

loans.name: Sokveng's Group

texts.en: Sokveng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokveng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 37-year-old woman, living with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Sajida hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income. Sajida is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rickshaw seat covers and body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and has five children. Rowena is married and has five children who are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Rowena has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Zubairu

texts.en:
Zubairu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Zubairu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Zubairu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zubairu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Zubairu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: M'bwemba Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a tailor. She has three children and two relatives that depend on her.

Joyce owns a grocery store. She will use this loan to buy more sugar, soap and beverages to stock up her store. One of her family members helps with the running of the store. She started her business to be self dependent and to assist her husband in buying household necessities. The profits from the business will enable her to buy livestock for the family.

In years to come, Joyce hopes to open a big grocery store at a trading centre and to start selling livestock.

loans.use: to buy groceries like soap, sugar and beverages for her store

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadoras Con Éxito De Patzun Group

texts.es: LDúo Trabajadoras Con Éxito de Patzun la señora Marta Judit de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija y juntamente con su esposo viven en Patzicia ella de dedica a trabajar en el cultivo de verduras, pero la actividad principal de ella es la elaboración de cajas de madera que sirven para empacar verduras como lechuga, chile pimiento, apio, tomate etc. Ya que en Patzicia la mayoría de personas se dedican a la agricultura y es muy rentable este negocio. Ella Necesita comprar madera y clavos para elaborar cajas para lechuga que les han pedido y como no cuentan con el dinero suficiente, solicitan su crédito para ayudarse y poder comprar lo que necesitan para cumplir con el pedido que tienen de los clientes. el deseo de ella es tener más clientes para que el negocio crezca y asi pueda  sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
The duo "Trabajadores con Éxito de Patzun" [Successful Workers from Patzun]

Señora Marta Judit, who is 32 years old, is married. She has a daughter, and together with her husband, they live in Patzicia. She works in raising vegetables, but her principal business is making wood boxes that serve to pack vegetables such as lettuce, pimento peppers, celery, tomatoes, etc. Since the majority of people in Patzicia work in agriculture, this business is very profitable.

She needs to buy wood and nails to make boxes for lettuce that have been ordered. As she doesn't have sufficient money, she is applying for her loan to use and be able to buy what she needs to fill the order that her customers have placed.

Her wish is to have more customers so that the business grows and thus she can raise her family.

loans.use: make boxes for packing vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Juditha has been in this business for five years. Juditha earns additional income from buying and selling marine products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is 64 years old and widowed with eight children, three in school. Cipriana works very hard to provide for her children.

Cipriana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cipriana has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cipriana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 39-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body.

Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Kalsoom hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income.

Kalsoom is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seat covers and a body for her husband's rickshaw transportation business.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 54 years old, married and has six children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú, and grows organic mangoes.

Pablo needs US$ 1,000 as a loan for buying tools and manure for his fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the increased income, he will pay for his son to study English.

loans.use: for buying tools and manure for increasing his organic mango production

loans.name: Sanah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sanah,, who is a 38-year-old married mother of three children. Sanah has been selling fish for 20 years and her husband is an employee.

Sanah has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to improve access to sanitation in her home and clean water for her family.

Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sanah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to sanitation and clean water for herr family.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: As they do for many women, it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Razia to approach Kashf Foundation in search of a loan. Razia is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of eight children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Serengeti Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her early twenties, is single. She has been running a mamalishe business for one and half months. She works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to earn a small monthly profit.

This will be Amina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items for her mamalishe store. She dreams of expanding his business.

Amina will share this loan with his loan group Serengeti which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in his mamalishe store.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a kind woman. She is 45 years old and a caring mother of three children.

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than ten years, but she has additional experience in this field as she helped her parents in animal husbandry when she was a child. They live in a village and so she has good opportunity to develop her business.

Zuhro’s son is ill now and she needs financial support. Zuhro must buy medicine for her son's treatment and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicine for treatment of her son

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es: Ana es una mujer que a sus 33 años de edad se dedica a la venta de perfumes de forma ambulante, principalmente en el mercado municipal y sus alrededores. Ana vive junto a su compañero de vida, su padre y su sobrino en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años. Ana desea construir un chalet en su vivienda, que le permita instalar una tienda de productos básicos, además de su venta de perfume en la que ya cuenta con muchos clientes. Por lo anterior Ana solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, lámina, madera, clavos y arena para construir el chalet en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and works as a street vendor selling fragrances mainly at the local market and the surrounding areas. She lives with her boyfriend, her father, and a nephew in the home she has owned for several years now.

Ana wants to build a porch outside her house. She plans to set up a store there, where she will sell basic products, aside from her fragrances business, which already has a lot of customers. For this reason, Ana is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sheet metal, wood, nails, and sand to carry out her project.

loans.use: to buy cement, sheet metal, wood, nails, and sand to build a porch outside her home.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela continúa con su negocio de venta de refrescos y empanadas. El crédito anterior lo invirtió refaccionando un cuarto de su casa, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio mejoró e incursionó en la elaboración de otros alimentos como; gelatinas, flanes y helados tipo bolo, “estoy elaborando nuevos alimentos para mejorar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda, la desventaja es la falta de una heladera para mantener congelada su producción. Su sueño es abrir una heladería, ella desea comprar una congeladora para mantener frescos y congelados su producción. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que lleva con este nuevo emprendimiento.
Es por esos motivos que Micaela solicita un préstamo para comprar una congeladora para mantener frescos y congelados sus helados y otros alimentos.
texts.en:
Micaela continues with her business selling soft drinks and empanadas. She invested the previous loan in financing a room of her house, and her payments were punctual. Currently, her business improved and she made incursions into the manufacture of other foods such as gelatin, flan, and ice cream in bags. “I am producing new foods to improve my business,” she comments.

The advantage of her business is that she can count on demand. The disadvantage is the lack of a freezer to maintain her products frozen. Her dream is to open an ice cream shop. She hopes to purchase a freezer to maintain her product fresh and frozen. This is the third sequence of loans with the institution in the 1 year that she has with this new business venture.

It is for these motives that Micaela is requesting a loan to purchase a freezer to maintain her ice creams and other foods fresh and frozen.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer to maintain her ice creams and other foods fresh and frozen.

loans.name: Top Class Group

texts.en: This group called Top Class consists of five (5) ladies who have an average age of 35 years. Ruth is a member, a woman who appears to be the source of encouragement to her counterparts. She is a mother of two and married; she is behind the woman holding the jewelry in the photo. Ruth has been sewing for eight years now. Ruth, who is helping her husband to feed the family, confessed that Kiva through ID-Ghana has helped her a lot since many potential micro-finance institutions were just giving her false promises. Ruth hopes to have the biggest sewing shop in the area but has to have constant financial assistance--that is why she has come to join ID-Ghana. Ruth hopes her work will increase if she becomes a member of the association that take loan from micro-finance. Ruth wants a loan from ID-Ghana so that she will be able to buy more materials to sew and sell to customers, being a woman of such creativeness and industrious in this kind of business speaks volumes of her hardworking character.

loans.use: to be able to buy more materials to sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and variety of canned goods. She is a 34-year old married women with two school-aged children. Her husband is a fisherman.

For the past six years, she has owned her sari-sari store, serving mostly locals in her area. Hazel is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the store like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, rice, and toiletries. These serve as tools to improve her business and attract potential customers to her shop.

Hazel is determined to be more productive to improve the living conditions of her family. In the future, she looks forward to continuing to improve her livelihood to support the schooling of all her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store like canned goods, cooking oil, soft drinks, rice,  and toiletries.

loans.name: Esmeralda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la ojalatería y a sembrar maíz, tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando.

Esmeralda, tiene 8 años de tener una tienda, ella decidió colocarla porque observo la necesidad que tenían los habitantes de su comunidad, porque no había tienda cerca, ahora ella ofrece productos de la canasta básica desde su propia casa y su esposo le ayuda cuando van a comprar productos a la ciudad.

Esmeralda, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos para su tienda como, arroz, azúcar, maíz, café, detergentes, entre otros.

Esmeralda, siempre ha soñado con construir una casa de bloque, porque donde vive es de lámina.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, who is 34 years old, went to school through second grade. She is married. Her husband works in a body shop and raises corn.

Esmeralda has had a store for eight years. She decided she would set it up because she observed the need that the inhabitants of her community had because they didn't have a store nearby. Now she offers products for the basic family food basket from her own home, and her husband helps her when they go to buy products in the city.

Esmeralda needs the loan to buy products for her store such as rice, sugar, corn, coffee, and detergents, among other items.

Esmeralda has always dreamed of building a house of blocks, because the place where she lives is made of metal sheeting.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, corn, coffee, and detergents, among other items.

loans.name: Taw Ka Yan Shae Village Group

texts.en: The Kiva community’s loan helped 30 villagers from Taw Ka Yan Shae Village expand their livestock business and increase their income. This increment from affordable credit allowed group members to cover their monthly expenses, and some households purchase a meter box for home safety. The featured borrower, Daw Aye, aims to expand her livestock business by purchasing more ducklings. The entire group is very grateful for all the help from Kiva lenders, and excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s loan.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Taw Ka Yan Shae Village Group

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Nathalie est une femme célibataire qui vit à Agoè avec un enfant à charge. Nathalie est âgée de 30 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Nathalie fabrique et vend des pagnes traditionnels. Nathalie s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa fabrication et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Nathalie demande ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de fil servant à cette production en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et de bien vendre puis avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider son enfant dans son éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Nathalie, age 30, is a single woman who lives in Agoè with one dependent child. She works hard to do well financially. She sells traditional pagnes that she makes herself. She buys supplies at the market twice a month, and she sells the pagnes from her home and around surrounding neighborhoods.

To that end, Nathalie is seeking this loan to purchase dozens of spools of thread that will help her to meet customer demand and to bolster her sales. Her goal is to achieve complete financial autonomy so that she may support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy 6 dozen spools of thread.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Doña Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Con un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($500), podrá incrementar y diversificar la oferta de productos a sus clientes. Con esto espera ampliar su mercado, generar mayores ingresos y así incrementar su aporte en la economía familiar.
texts.en: Sandra works selling beauty supplies. A loan in the amount of $500 will allow her to increase and diversify the merchandise she offers to her customers. She expects it to enable her to expand her market and generate more income so that she can contribute more substantially to her household's economy.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari takes orders to sew men, women and also children’s clothes. This activity at first was just way of earning money for her single son, after losing her husband and being alone face-to-face with the life’s hardships. Now this occupation is the way of her life. She cannot imagine being without this work every day. Mari used to rent some places as a workshop, but now she has decided to reduce her expenses and use her own garage, which she changed to a very comfortable workshop.

Mari asks for this loan of 1.500 USD, as she wants to separate a small bathroom and also toilet in her workshop. She is impatient to end all the repairing works in her workshop, in order to work in a clean and comfortable place and manage all her sewing orders.

loans.use: to separate a small bathroom and also toilet in her workshop, in order to work in a clean and comfortable place and manage all her sewing orders.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is 50 years old and she lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region with her husband and two daughters. Gayane has no higher education.  For several years she was a worker.  Now she works as a cleaner at a rest home. Her husband is a builder. Their two daughters work at the supermarket as salesgirls. Gayane is upset and worried about her husband’s health. He has some health problems which makes him feel weak and unhealthy. He gets tired very early despite working little. So this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams will be very important for Gayane's husband as he must take a medical exam at the hospital in order to find out what is the reason of feeling so unhealthy.

loans.use: Gayane's husband must take a medical exam at the hospital in order to find out what is the reason of feeling so unhealthy

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de pupusas y nuegados, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima como: maiz, quesillo, chicharron, frijoles, dulce para los neugados, etc. todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia is forty-seven years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters. She has worked for several years selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and nuegados (fried dumplings). Her business is located near her home, and she has many customers. With her profits she is able to cover some of her household costs.

She’s asking for a loan to buy wholesale raw ingredients like corn, cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, sugar for neugados, etc. so that she’s able to continue selling and generating a good profit.

loans.use: to buy wholesale raw ingredients like corn, cheese, fried pork rinds, beans, sugar for neugados (fried dumplings), etc.

loans.name: Maria Dorila

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Su deseo es ampliar su tienda con el fin de mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos ya que desea darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida, por esa razon esta solicitando un credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: huevos, cereales, golosinas, aceite, macarrones, detergente, etc. para tener mas mercadeia y asi tener mejores ingresos econocmicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter. She has a store in her home in which she sells a variety of basic necessary products. She wishes to expand her store with the goal of improving sales and her income since she wishes to give her daughter a better quality of life.

For this reason, she is requesting an INTEGRAL loan to invest in the purchase of products for the store such as eggs, cereals, candies, oil, macaroni, detergent etc. in order to have more merchandise and thus have a better economic income.
