Anthony will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal, to restock his genge and to service his boda boda. He dreams of opening a big charcoal store.

Anthony will make sure he pays back his loan within the loan schedule time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, to restock items in his genge (grocery store) and to service his boda boda (bicycle).

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de cuarenta años de edad, casada y tiene una hija quien ya tiene quince años, su esposo es comerciante el vende carbón por costal, y también maíz,  doña Elena tiene una tienda de consumo diario, vende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, en su tienda tiene a la venta golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, pastas, azúcar, maíz, frijol, y otros productos este es su préstamo, No siete, y está feliz por los resultados que ha obtenido y espera seguir creciendo,  y ve sus ganancias a tenido obstáculos pero a Dios gracias a superado todos los problemas. Agradece el apoyo y la oportunidad de creer en su negocio y espera poder cumplir sus sueños y metas, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old, married and has a daughter who's already 15 years old. Her husband is a salesman who sells charcoal by the sack, and also corn. Elena has a store in which she sells household goods, and she sells from 6:00 AM to 9:00 PM. At her store she carries sweets, soft drinks, juices, pasta, sugar, corn, beans, and other products. 

She took out a previous loan and she was happy with the outcome and hopes to continue expanding and increasing her profits. There have been obstacles but thanks to God she has overcome every problem. She's grateful for the suppport and the opportunity to make her business grow and she hopes to achieve her dreams and goals. 

She's applying for this loan to purchase food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from Catigbian, Bohol and she buys and sells frozen goods. She successfully started this business just this year to help her husband raise their two children, who are 13 and 11 years old.

Janet’s husband is a chainsaw operator and works hard for their family. In the future, they wish to be successful in their business, to have a better means of living, and to give their children a comfortable living.

Janet is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy assorted frozen goods such as hotdogs, ham and sweetened pork. Definitely, we can help this woman reach her goal by helping her with the loan we entrust to her.

loans.use: to buy frozen goods such as hotdogs, ham and sweetened pork.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 30, married, and a mother of two children. She is a housewife; her husband is an auto rickshaw driver and sole earner in the family. They live a humble life and day to day expenses are a challenge for them to bear. Her husband has to work very hard to make ends meet. He drives shifts of students and professionals to earn good income apart from the regular random transportation services in Lahore.

Due to constant driving, his rickshaw has worn out and he does not have sufficient income to repair it. Therefore, in order to help her husband, Samina has requested a loan to help her husband with the rickshaw repair. She is happy to get the loan and hopes to educate her children and provide them with a better quality life.

loans.use: To help her husband repair his auto rickshaw

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 21-year-old single lady who has been working as a nurse for five years. She attended nursing training at an early age and acquired the requested experience.

Today, Mariam is working hard to improve her social living, especially through developing her career path. To achieve her goals, Mariam registered to acquire a Master's degree in nursing.

Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in paying for her nursing major Master's degree tuition fees.

She is seeking to continue educating herself with no set limits on degrees to achieve.

loans.use: to pay for her nursing major Master's degree tuition fees.

loans.name: Ataya

texts.en:
Ataya is a 53-year-old married mother of three. Thirty-three years ago, she got employed as a nurse to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother. Ataya's children are her priority; she deprives herself for their sake.

Although Ataya and her husband are working hard, their income is still not enough to cover any additional expenses. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house through buying new salon furniture. Ataya hopes to stay capable of providing her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house through buying new salon furniture

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 45-year-old married woman, who has been working as a tailor from her house for 18 years. She is a hard worker, and is well known in her region with the special talents and designs she provides.

Salma is working hard to develop her business and talents. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's Field Partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new tailoring machine to facilitate her work and provide her customers with better service.

Salma hopes that one day she can open her own clothes factory outside her house and develop her business widely.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine to provide her customers with better service.

loans.name: Dúo Rivera Del Rio Ll Group

texts.es:
Dúo rivera del rio 2
Doña Rutilia tiene 50 años de edad es soltera tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad que actualmente estudia su negocio es de lácteos y de venta de producto ella quiere poder invertir en comprar más productos lácteos y productos de catálogo (cosméticos)ella inicio vendiendo de ambulante trabaja su proyecto sola esto la ha ayudado a poder ganar clientes poco a poco sus metas son: mejorar la calidad de vida, mejorar los ingresos económicos, alimentar la producción, fortalecer el negocio , pero sobre todo poder ofrecer variedad de productos, Está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos lácteos y productos de catálogo para vender, es su primer préstamo kiva y agradece la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Dúo Rivera del Río 2

Rutilia, 50, is single and has a 15-year-old son, who is currently in school. She runs a business selling catalog and dairy products.

She wants to be able to buy more catalog products (cosmetics) and dairy products. She started as a street vendor. She runs her business alone and has managed to attract customers little by little.

Her goals are to improve her standard of living, earn a better income, strengthen her business, increase production and, especially, be able to offer a variety of products.

She is requesting this loan to buy dairy and catalog products to sell.

This is her first Kiva loan, and she is grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Ubumwe Nyabikenke Group

texts.en:
Marie, who is holding the book in the picture above, is the president of the Ubumwe Nyabikenke Group. She has worked with Vision Finance Company since 2014 to develop her business, and is happy to report that she is a repeat client, which shows her diligence and commitment.

There are 22 members in the group but only 15 members are pictured. Others who were not in the picture because they had faced some challenges and they apologize for that.

Marie is a 43-year-old married mother of six children between the ages of 2 and 20 years. She has owned and operated a restaurant business, selling food to the community where she stays. This enterprise requires her to work from 6 a.m. until 7.30 p.m. every day, and still manage her household.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her restaurant business by purchasing a large quantity of food (beans, bananas, sweet potatoes).to sell. She intends to use the profits from her business to save for the future, to pay school fees for her children, to buy new clothes for the family and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of food (beans, bananas,sweet potatoes.) to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children.

Irene operates a retail business where she sells roasted maize. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. Irene hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Cerelina has owned rice paddies. She toils on the land and grows rice.

Cerelina is a 44-year-old married woman and has four children, of which three are still attending school. She is an industrious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children.

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. With these, it could help boost her yield. Thus, it would augment her earnings and she could seek ways on how to be more efficient.

Cerelina hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing in another business to increase her income and be able to continue finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Betty Giovana

texts.es: La señorita Betty es una joven de 22 años quien siempre trabajo con su mama en el servicio de jugos de frutas y sus relacionados en el mercado de su zona, desde que ella tenia 12 años le ayudaba a su mama, cuando ella tenia 15 años su mama falleció dejando a su cargo a sus hermanos conjuntamente con su papa quienes supieron levantar a su familia. De esa forma heredo el puesto de ventas de jugo que hasta  ahora esta a cargo de Betty, donde lo maneja muy higienicamente, atiende con muy buen trato y calidez a sus clientes; es por ello que la señorita Betty requiere un préstamo para la compra de estantes, sillas para una mejor atención a sus comensales y de esta manera genera mejores ingresos que le ayudaran a a su familia
texts.en: Betty is a young 22 year old woman who always worked with her mom selling fruit juice and related items at the local market. Starting at the age of 12 she was helping her mom, but when she was 15 her mom passed away, leaving her and her father to take care of her siblings. They were able to keep their family going and that was how Betty inherited her place at the juice stand that she still operates. She runs a clean stand and is warm and attentive to her customers; that's why Betty requires a loan to purchase counters and chairs to provide better service to her customers and that way earn more income to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture to expand her juice store and provide better customer service, and this way earn income for her family.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is a-45-year old married woman with five children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital city of the Solomon Islands.

Debbie operates a small convenience store and sells a variety of food items such as rice, noodles, sugar, and snacks; and also household items like soap, wash detergent and toiletries. She has been doing this for four years.

Debbie requested a loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles and biscuits to assist her in running the business. She plans to use her profits to help cover her family's weekly expenses. She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles and biscuits for her general store.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is 29 years old, married and has three children. She runs a small grocery store in Al-Jalazoon camp in Ramallah city.

Hala chose to take out a loan from ACAD to buy a new refrigerator for her grocery store since her sales went up. Hala started her business when she was 24 years old.

The grocery store is the only source of income for Hala and her family. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her living status. Hala says that the challenge for her business is the difficulty in getting the goods from the suppliers.

In the future, Hala would like to expand her grocery store into a small supermarket. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduadro is 54 years old, married, and has 8 children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Peru and grows organic mangoes. He feels that organic production is the future, and he dreams of growing the best organic mangoes ever.

Eduardo needs $500 USD as loan for fertilizing the fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income he earns, he will send his daughter to university. She wants to become an Agronomist.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve organic mango production.

loans.name: Dúo Riveras Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Dúo rivera del rio 1
Doña Rosa María esta de blusa rosada tiene 42 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de 23,15,5 años de edad y están estudiando ella tiene su negocio de vender producto de diferentes catálogos(cosméticos) ella quiere poder invertir en más producto y poder ofrecer variedad a su clientela ella inicio su negocio sola ya que tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos sus clientes son alrededor de 60 señoras y vecinas, de su colonia sus metas son: ofrecer variedad de productos, mejorar los ingresos económicos, fortalecer el negocio, y poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Es su primer préstamo de kiva y agradece por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Duo Rivera Del Rio Group 1

Rosa Maria is in the pink shirt, she's a 42 year old single mother of 3 kids ages 23, 15, and 5 and they're in school. She has a business in which she sells products out of different catalogues (cosmetics) and she wants to invest in buying more products so that she can have a wider variety for her customers. She started this business on her own since she had to support her kids, and her customers are approximately 60 women and residents of her neighborhood. 

Her goals are: to sell a variety of products, to increase her income, to strengthen her business, and to be able to pay for her children's education. This is her first Kiva loan and she's grateful for the support.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a man who is 45 years old. He is a “tuba” gatherer and sells the “tuba” respectfully to earn a living. “Tuba” is a local term which means coconut wine. This coconut wine is very popular in the Philippines. It consists of pure sap, with no bark mixed in, and it is generally milky white in color or occasionally it will have no color at all. To add color to the wine, “tuba” gatherers used “tungog” (a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). And this is the reason why Romeo is asking for a loan. He will use the money to buy “tungog” powder to improve his sales and his earnings. In the future, Romeo wants to have a sustainable business to support the needs of his family. He has three children, ages 21, 17 and 14 years, who are still dependent on him.

loans.use: to buy “tungog” powder

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Wilma dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sumaiah

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Sumaiah from Ramallah city. She is single and has no children. Sumaiah used to work in salons for other employers for daily wages. After 11 years of experience, she saved the needed capital to open her own salon six years ago. She named it Al-Nijmeh Salon. Sumaiah chose to take a loan from ACAD to renovate her beauty salon.

The main challenge for Sumaiah's business is having too many competitors in this field. Sumaiah hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve and expand her business. In the future, Sumaiah plans to open her own beauty training academy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to renovate her beauty salon.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and has three children. She is married and her three children are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la ciudad de Itá, estudia para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia ayudándoles económicamente, comenta que estudia la carrera de nutrición para poder cumplir su meta de ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida. Además pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir sus anhelos y realizarse como persona.
texts.en:
Laura is from the city of Itá. She studies in order to improve her life and the lives of her family members by helping them financially. She mentions that she studies nutrition in order to achieve her goal of being a useful professional in society.

She is a very self-sacrificing person who gives it her all to grow and be somebody in life. Moreover, she is seeking this loan in order to pay the fees for her courses, and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

She is thankful for the opportunity to follow her dreams and fulfill her personal goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 37-year-old married woman. Fourteen years ago, she started working as a detergents saleswoman to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She has a wide experience in this domain and succeeded in gaining loyal customers.

Five years ago, Samah decided to start working independently. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is acquiring a loan from Kiva's Field Partner, Al Majmoua. She would like to increase her business merchandise with new detergents to satisfy her customers' demands.

Samah hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new cleaning detergents to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Las Inquietas Group

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 7, 10, 15 y 17 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de niño de segunda mano.
Ella es paciente, buena oyente y muy solidaria (de pie a la derecha, viste polera negra y esta al medio de las de amarillo). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. En esta ocasión lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano infantil, ella compra ropa por fardos y la separa por edad y genero escogiendo la ropa infantil, “la ropa de segunda mano tiene buena rotación pero la ropa infantil aún más…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los niños crecen y necesitan ropa acorde a su edad, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería. Su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar ropa infantil por fardos. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa infantil de segunda mano por fardos.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 39 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 4 children ages 7, 10, 15, and 17 and her business is selling second-hand children's clothing. She's patient, a good listener and very supportive (she's standing on the right wearing a black shirt in between the two women dressed in yellow). She lives with her partner who works in agriculture and with her children who are in school. They live in their own home, built from wood and equipped with electricity and supplied with water from a well. 

Now she's leading a group of entrepreneurs. Her business is second-hand children's clothing sales, she buys by the bundle, picks out the children's clothing and separates it according to age and sex. "Second-hand clothing has good turn-over but even more so with children's clothing..." she states. The advantage of her business is that children grow and need clothing based on their age, the disadvantage is the scarcity of merchandise. 

Her dream is to have a permanent retail site, and she wants to buy children's clothing by the bundle. This is her second loan from the institution in the 5 years that she has engaged in this line of work. These are the reasons why Maribel is applying for a loan to purchase second-hand children's clothing by the bundle.

loans.use: To buy bundles of second-hand chlidren's clothing

loans.name: Rafika

texts.en:
Rafika is a 42-year-old, married mother of six children. Six years ago, she started selling cosmetics to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who succeeded throughout the years to gain her loyal customers.

Today, Rafika is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through increasing her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' requests.

Rafika hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying her children with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Sixty-four-year-old Beatriz hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her main source of income is through farming. She grows and sells rice. She has been working in the rice paddies for almost 20 years now. She is a single woman. She needs additional funds to support her farming livelihood.

Beatriz has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. In that way, she would be able to produce a higher yield. Thus, she would be able to pay her obligations and set aside some of the profit for future use.

She is determined that she will be productive and sustainable in the years to come, coupled with hard work and the determination to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
Doris, with her unique and outstanding dedication to selling provisions, including food stuffs, seeks the help of Kiva with her friend. Through the assistance of ID-Ghana, she wants to increase her capital and buy food items to provide provisions that will be of much interest to her buyers.

Doris represents the Noyaa Group from the Teshie locality in the greater Accra region of Ghana. She is a single parent taking care of two children. Having three years of experience and an attitude to repay, she will be very much happy to be able to meet her needs once again.

loans.use: to buy food items to provide provisions that will be of much interest to her buyers.

loans.name: Onua-Do Group

texts.en:
Ekua is a representative of the Onua-Do Group, located at Teshie in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She sells clothes and braziers in a busy marketing area where there has been an increase in customer demand.

She is an experienced and well-focused businesswoman who is on her seventh cycle of seeking a loan to enlarge her business for her buyers' satisfaction. She works so hard to sustain her business and also to supply goods for her buyers.

Ekua will be very grateful if her needs are met due to her loyalty and attitude of repaying loans.

loans.use: to enlarge her clothing sales business for her buyers' satisfaction.

loans.name: Atiya

texts.en:
Atiya is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago, she started her business of tailoring for running her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time, to get a boost in her earnings.

She wishes to spend her earnings on providing a quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time, to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.name: Auring

texts.en:
Auring is 43 years old and married with three children.

Auring works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, charcoal, etc.

Auring has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Auring aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in a populated area of Lahore.

Her husband is a tailor by profession. He can sew ladies' and gents' clothes. He is known for his stitching of ladies' kurta shalwar. He also sews trousers and shirts. Ladies prefer his stitching. The majority of the population in Pakistan wear tailor-made clothes.

Due to electricity shortage and increasing electricity charges, his income has been affected, making it impossible for him to save. He wants to increase his sewing by buying a new sewing machine and employing a person to help him with stitching clothes. But, as he does not have sufficient income, Saima has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

They are hopeful for a better future, and Saima also wants to learn the art of tailoring to help her husband in the business.

loans.use: to buy sewing a machine and other related accessories for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es la mayor de sus hermanos, ella trabaja como funcionaria de un Banco hace varios años, y también se encuentra cursando la carrera de Administración de empresas. Su meta es ir capacitándose cada vez más y así poder ser útil a la sociedad y a su familia.  Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada y pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los costos de sus materiales de estudios, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus anhelos de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en: Laura is oldest of her siblings.  She has worked as a bank clerk for several years, and she is also taking courses in Business Administration.  Her goal is to continue building her credentials and thus be productive in society and to her family.  She is thankful for the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it has offered and is seeking this loan to be able to cover the cost of her study materials, in this way following her dreams of making something of herself.

loans.use: to cover the cost of study materials.

loans.name: Adjor Man Group

texts.en:
The Adjor Man Group at the community of Teshi in the greater Accra region of Ghana contains three members who sell foodstuffs, wigs, shampoo, hair pomade, and used clothes. The group members have a heart full of gratitude for the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana for their business sustenance.

Victoria is a married woman who is very active and dedicated to the repayment of the loan. This is her eighth cycle of receiving a loan. Due to the rapid sale and the demand of her buyers, she seeks a loan to buy more foodstuffs and cooking items to satisfy her buyers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and cooking items to satisfy her buyers' demand.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es una joven muy simpática de 19 años de edad, una persona tierna, muy apegada a su madre y familiares, ella tiene deseos de estudiar, de prepararse, de ser alguien en la vida, pero no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para pagar una universidad.
Marisol hoy se encuentra ante la comunidad Kiva solicitando una ayuda, un pequeño empujón para iniciar un negocio de venta de jugos naturales, quiere generar los ingresos suficientes para pagar una matrícula universitaria y en la medida de lo posible ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Con el dinero solicitado la futura empresa quiere comprar una licuadora industrial, exprimidor eléctrico, herramientas y enseres, también comprara surtido de frutas en cantidades.
texts.en:
Marisol is a very likable young woman of 19 years old. She is a tender person very attached to her mother and family. She hopes to study, to be prepared, to be somebody in the life, but she does not count with the enough resources to pay a university degree.

Marisol is today finding herself in front of the Kiva community. requesting a help, a little boost to start a business of selling natural juices. She was to generate the enough income to pay the university fee and, as much as possible, to help her parents his the household expenses.

With the requested money, the future business want to buy an industrial blender, a juicer, tools and supplies. In addition she will buy a big selection of fruits.

loans.use: To initiate a business of selling  natural juices. To buy a blender, a juicer, tools and supplies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina and her family live in the town of Calape in Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and has three children, ages 15, 12 and 9 years old. She earns a living by running a sari-sari store business, which she has done for almost 26 years.

But Marcelina is not focusing on her sari-sari store for the time being. She helps her fisherman husband in his fishing work, and Marcelina wishes them to have their own fishing boat.

This will help them enhance their catch as well as their earnings to have enough money to send her children to school and finish their studies. Therefore, she is asking for an additional loan amount to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 31 and blessed with a child. She lives with her husband and child in a populated area of Lahore.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. People prefer to use a rickshaw, as it is cheaper and can also move in the narrow streets of Lahore. Her husband is fair and honest.

Due to constant wear and tear, his rickshaw needs repairs, as he gets disturbed due to malfunctions while driving. Due to insufficient funding, Kishwar has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband repair his rickshaw and drive it smoothly.

They want to educate their child and give him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
It was very difficult for Rehana's family to bear their daily expenses. That is why she started her business selling milk with her brother who is also shown in the photo.

Rehana has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her brother sells the milk in nearby areas. Rehana’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them.

Currently, Rehana has requested a 40,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers and be able to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo so she can cater to more customers.

loans.name: Ghafooran

texts.en:
Ghafooran is 53 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

Ghafooran aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Maximo está estudiando porque quiere salir adelante para progresar en la vida. Para su desarrollo personal, con el objetivo de conocer más y para tener una vida sustentable, y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Estudia la carrera de gestión pública, y por medio de ello quiere abrirse camino al mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa manera poder ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Maximo is studying because he wants to get ahead in life. For his personal development with the goal of knowing more and to have a sustainable life and to offer his family a higher quality of living.

He is studying Public Management and through it he wants to open the doors to the work world.

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the fees for his studies and in this way he can become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Andy

texts.es:
Andy es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es estudiante de la carrera de Arquitectura, comenta que su meta es poder culminar sus estudios y al poco tiempo poder ejercer su profesión.
Se esfuerza para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus padres, y quiere poder llegar a tener su propia consultoría y de esa forma abrirse camino al mundo laboral.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Andy is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is studying for an architecture degree. He notes that his goal is to complete his studies and in short time, to be able to practice his profession.

He strives to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his parents. He wants to be able to have his own consultancy and to in this way, open up his path into the working world.

He requests this loan in order to invest it in paying the fees for his degree and to in this way be able to continue striving for his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es:
Ciro es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, trabaja en un banco, con el cual tiene los medios para poder cubrir sus estudios.
Su sueño es poder estudiar más al terminar sus estudios, y de esa forma poder tener un mejor futuro.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ciro is a student of Business Administration. He works in a bank, which enables him to cover the cost of his studies.

His dream is to be able to complete his studies, and in this way have a better future.

His is seeking this loan to be able to pay his university fees, and in this way be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gharaam Group

texts.en:
Gharam is the featured borrower for Gharaam Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Gharam is a 49-year-old, married mother of seven children. Five years ago, she started selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her region.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests. Gharam is the woman in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Fatima is the first lady on the right, and Iman is the lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is an industrious woman from South Tajikistan. She is divorced. Sabohat has four children, and she loves her children much. Since her husband has died, she is the only feed keeper of the family, and it is very heavy for her to provide her family with all the necessary things.

Sabot has been a sewer for more than two years. She sews a variety of women's dresses in European and Tajik styles. She little by little has developed her business. She needs to buy a new sewing machine to make the quality of her service better. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for developing her business.

loans.name: Ndulu

texts.en:
Ndulu is 61 years old. She is widowed and blessed with six children. Her business is selling vegetables and farming. She has been in the business for 19 years. She earns a monthly income of 23,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of cabbages, onions, tomatoes, kale, potatoes, bananas, avocados, etc., for sale. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children fully.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable business and stable family.

loans.use: to buy stock of cabbages, onions, tomatoes, kale, potatoes, bananas, avocados, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 68 years old. She is married and blessed with seven grown-up children. She has a retail shop and also does livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 15 years. This is her sixth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she has successfully repaid her previous loans.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of bread, milk, soft drinks, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour to sell. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to expand her business.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to buy more retail goods to sell, as well as goats and cows for rearing. Her future hopes and dreams are to grow her businesses and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, milk, soft drinks, sugar, paraffin, detergents, rice and maize flour to sell; she hopes this will enable her to make more income to expand her business.

loans.name: Ama  Mawassi

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée avec cinq enfants à charge qui vit à Agoè. Ama est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Ama sollicite ce prêt pour commander des tas de friperies en vue de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ama is married with 5 dependent children, and she lives in Agoè. She is a reseller of used clothing, buying merchandise twice a month at the market and selling in surrounding neighborhoods.

Ama is seeking this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise and maximize her profits. She will buy bales of second-hand clothing to meet the high demand from her customers. She hopes to make a profit and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a 71 year old mother with 8 children, she runs a small business of selling tuna sandwich, toast sandwich in her community to earn a living. Fialelei requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish, canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish, canned tuna, plastic bags, containers, butter,.

loans.name: Faatafunaina

texts.en: Faatafunaina is 62 years old with 5 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Faatafunaina requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2007, and will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
“Abundant life for all” based from the Bible passage John 10:10, is Leticia’s desire for her family and for all Filipino people.

She operates a variety store in front of her house in Toril, Davao City. For 9 years of operation, her perennial problem is the long time debts of her neighbors which disturb the stability of her business. Her kind consideration to them is not enough to maintain her store. This is why she fervently prays that these collectibles will lessen so she can roll her capital wisely. Even if she’s single, she takes the initiative to support her siblings, nephews and nieces.

She applied for PHP 10,000 loan as additional capital for her business. She plans to add rice to her inventory, buy more grocery items and cases of beverages. She’s hoping that this additional capital will keep her business running. Eventually, she aims to offer a car wash service as another income generating venture.

Leticia is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to add rice to her inventory, buy more grocery items and cases of beverages

loans.name: Diomedes

texts.en:
Diomedes is 59 years old, married and has a daughter. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes.

Diomedes needs US$ 500 as loan manure for fertilizing the fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income, he will build the second floor of his family’s house.

loans.use: to buy manure for the fields and increase his organic mango production.

loans.name: Ka Mar Par Village Group

texts.en:
Ka Mar Par Village group members used loans to increase their duck business by purchasing more ducks and high quality feeds. A previous loan from Kiva freed them from taking on extra loans with high interest rates. Instead of paying higher interest rates, village members were able to save money for their children's education.

The next loan will help 16 members to expand their duck businesses. Pictured above are committee members from Ka Mar Par Village named San, Thawe, Aung, Than, and Aung. All the members are so excited to continue these generous support from Kiva community to increase their monthly income that covers most of their living costs and supports their children's education as well.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks as well as good quality feed

loans.name: Lamiaa

texts.en:
Lamiaa is a 43-year-old, married mother of five. She is a Palestinian refugee married to a Syrian citizen, and living in a Palestinian refugee camp in Lebanon.

She has been working as a tailor from her house to support her husband in covering their family's living expenses for 15 years, and has proved to be very skillful in her domain.

Lamiaa's family members need legal identification papers to make their residency permit legal in Lebanon. Through her previously acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Lamiaa started her first necessary procedures for legalizing her children's residency situation in Lebanon.

Today, Lamiaa is finalizing her children's situation, and the acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Macjmoua will be used to pay for her Syrian children's legal registration identification papers.

loans.use: to pay for her Syrian children's legal registration identification papers.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Barrio Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  lleva por nombre “Mujeres del Barrio María Auxiliadora” está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene el sueño de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adela quien vende frutas y verduras en una feria, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, quien hace un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Adela solicita  este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio, lo que le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas  el cual ayudara a  mejorar sus ingresos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “Mujeres del Barrio María Auxiliadora” is in its 1rst cycle of the Women's Committee Program. It is a new group that has the dream of being able to improve their and their families' living conditions through the poverty elimination program.

One of the members is Adela, who sells fruit and vegetables at a market. The Fundación Paraguaya must also be noted. It does a permanent follow up of trainings and verifications that challenge and incentivize women to fight to overcome poverty.

Adela is asking for this loan to buy the fruits and vegetables for her business. This will help her to increase her sales which will help to increase her income. She is grateful for this opportunity she is receiving, because it will be very helpful to her to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 21 años, está estudiando la carrera de Medicina. De aquí a 4 años se ve como todo un profesional y ayudando a su familia.
Ella es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios y pone todo de sí para poder lograr su meta de ser una doctora y con ello poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Paraguari. She is 21 years old and studying for a career in medicine. In 4 years she will look professional and be helping her family.

She is a person who is very dedicated to her education. She puts forth all of herself in order to achieve her goal of being a doctor and to with this, be able to help other people.

She requests this loan in order to pay fees for her degree and in this way be able to continue with her education like she has been.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Rory, está integrado  por  16 mujeres ,está en  el 5to.ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Tamara, quien tiene un kiosco humilde, donde vende minutas, gaseosas, galletitas, y más, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella se esfuerza para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener, es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora.
La Señora Tamara pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para vender en su kiosco, como ser golosinas, comestibles, jugos y otras bebidas, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Rory. It is comprised of 16 women, and it is on its 5th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program, where everyone work and help each other to advance their lives. They are in this poverty elimination program fighting to improve their life conditions.
One of the members is Señora Tamara, who has a humble kiosk, where she sells quick meals, sodas, cookies, and more, and with it she has the means to help her loved ones. She exerts herself to be able to give her loved ones all that she could not have. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who is willing to fight for herself and others.
Señora Tamara is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to sell at her kiosk, such as candies, groceries, juices and other drinks. She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to make something of her life. She appreciates the opportunity to grow and advance her life forward.

loans.use: To buy supplies to stock their kiosk, such as: candies, groceries, juices, and other drinks.

loans.name: Gonzala

texts.en:
Gonzala owns a sari-sari(variety) store for more than 10 years now . She sold goods ranging from coffee, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste,eggs, fabric conditioner and assorted canned goods. She is 63-year old married woman with five grown children. She mostly caters neighbors and local settlers in her place.

Gonzala has requested a loan to buy stocks like beverages, toiletries and other dry goods. With these, it could boost the inventory and attract potential customers to shop. She could start to save and continue to expand.

Gonzala is determined that she could make it to be more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy stocks like beverages, toiletries and other dry goods

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabatha is 58 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children. Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of eleven thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of fertilizer, seeds and agro-chemicals. She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings.

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of fertilizer, seeds and agro-chemicals.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 36 years old, married woman. She has 2 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Saima expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Miriam works very hard to provide for them.

Miriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Miriam has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Miriam would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado  “Divino Niño Jesús” está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comités, ellas en cada ciclo se fijan como meta ayudarse las unas a las otras, y de esa manera dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
La Sra. Francisca, se destaca en este grupo por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, ella se dedica a la agricultura y con sacrificio está ayudando a su familia y les da una mejor calidad de vida. Ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo da a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Se esfuerza para ir capacitándose y es por ello que siempre participa muy activamente.
Pide este préstamo para comprar semillas de mandioca, maíz, maní, poroto, y otros y cultivar en su campo, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos y a la vez cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
There are 17 women in the group called “Divino Niño Jesús”. It is in its 12th cycle in the committees program. In every cycle, they set a goal to help one another, and this way they give their families a better quality of life.

Francisca stands out in this group as a very hardworking woman. She works as a farmer and with sacrifice she is helping her family and she gives them a better quality of life. She says that through her work she gives her lived ones every thing that she was unable to have. She is striving to get trained and that is why she is always participating very actively.

She is asking for this loan to buy tapioca, corn, peanut, corn and other seeds and grow them on her land. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue helping her loved ones and at the same time fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy tapioca, corn, peanut, bean, and other seeds to grow on her land.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en: Willie is 58 years old, married and had three grown up children. He is a farmer and his wife stays at home and also help him manage the business. In the farming business, they plant and harvest rice to sell with the help of laborers he pays. Willie hopes to continue improving his crop production that is why he is now asking for a loan of P20,000. He will buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides in farming. This additional inputs will help his crops obtain good nutrition. He will pay back his loan in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides in farming

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en:
Roselle is 28 years old and married with four children.

Roselle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Roselle has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from personal products retailing.

Roselle aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 34 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, one of them still studying. Her husband owns a bakery and in parallel raises cattle and as for her she doesn’t work, she is only dedicated for her home and kids. Today, she is in need for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy her children’s books what makes her very happy that she will able to secure him a brilliant future.

loans.use: to buy her children’s books

loans.name: Kori Ampara Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORI AMPARA II” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de repuestos de auto, venta de juguetes, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa para niños.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de juguetes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga, hace más de cinco años, cuenta la señora que inicio con un poco de mercadería, sin embargo a la fecha, su negocio ya es más solvente. Comenta también, que en ocasiones quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de juguetes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad del departamento de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “KORI AMPARA II” credit group will begin its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Collpani Focal Center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Miriam is the Secretary. The businesses the members of the credit group have are varied. Among them are selling food, selling blankets, selling car replacement parts, selling toys, selling jackets and selling children's clothing.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Miriam. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of a promoter who is a part of the institution. Now she has a toy selling business. She says that she learned this business from a friend more than five years ago. She says she started with just a little merchandise, but nonetheless her business is more profitable now. She also says that at times her daughter helps her in the business.

The loan she will take out now will be to increase capital by buying toys wholesale. She will acquire them from wholesalers in the department of Oruro and later sell them in the markets of El Alto. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three daughters.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Mauaiala

texts.en: Mauaiala is 29 years old and operates a small business of selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. Mauaiala requested for a loan to buy a sack of taro, banana, vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon, to assist her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide her family daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, banana, vegetable oil, fry pan, wooden spoon,

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en: Bernadeth is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is 25 years old and a mother of an eight-month-old child. Her husband raised them through fishing while Bernadeth is helping her husband financially by selling dried fish. She successfully started this business within the last year, that is why she is in need of capital to operate this business continuously. She is requesting an amount to buy more dried fish to sell. In the future, Bernadeth wishes to improve this business to enhance their livelihood and have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes, kale, fruits. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 30 years old and has two children. Melanie is married and has two children who are in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Melanie has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Recena

texts.en:
Recena is 57 years old and married with five children. Recena works very hard to provide for them.

Recena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Recena has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, snack food, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future Recena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 45 years old and married with five children.

Lilian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Lilian has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Lilian aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido es estudiante del último año de ingeniería comercial, vive con su madre y está emprendiendo su propio negocio, también está buscando su desarrollo profesional, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho en su carrera.
Comenta que gracias al apoyo de su familia está alcanzando sus anhelos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is a student in his final year of business administration. He lives with his mother and is starting his own business. He is also seeking professional development. This is why he works so hard on his degree.

He notes that he is achieving his aspirations thanks to his family's support. He requests this loan in order to pay his tuition and in this way, to be able to continue studying as he has been. He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Las Vengadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENGADORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de sombreros, venta de comida, servicio de construcción, venta de polleras, venta de ropa y medias, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía y con el apoyo de la misma tía emprendió su propio negocio hace más de dos años; en la actualidad quien le ayuda es su mamá.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias del departamento de Tarija. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “LAS VENGADORAS” communal bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani branch office. It is made up of nine members led by a board of directors with Julia as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied. Amongst them are: the sale of polleras (traditional skirts), selling shawls, selling fruit, the sale of hats, selling food, a construction service, the sale of clothing and socks and selling furniture.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, Julia being one of them. She indicated that this was the first time she has been part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a promotion that the institution had in her area. She currently has a business making and selling shawls. She said she learned the business from an aunt and with the help of the same aunt started her own business more than two years ago. Her mother is presently helping her.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (buying fabric wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto and later after making them, sell in the markets of the department of Tarija. This form of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
When asked to describe himself in a word, Peter said “active.” For the past five years he has had a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows vegetables. He sells his farm’s output locally.

Peter is applying for a 10,000 KES loan to buy inputs for his farm. He will save his anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his farm.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is the father of a big family and he lives with his wife and 3 children in Tsav village of the Syunik region of Armenia. Ara has vocational education, and now he works as a pit-man at the mine. Ara’s children are school-aged. He has a son and twins - a girl and a boy. His wife is unemployed and simultaneously cares for her children and house as well as helps her husband in their agricultural works.

Ara has a nice and rich fruit and vegetable garden. Here, he cultivates potatoes, beans, and tomatoes, and he also has apple and pear trees. He sells all the harvests from his farm to re-sellers mainly but also to his regular customers from the city.

Ara also is engaged in bee keeping, and he sells very tasty honey for which he also has customers. This loan of 300,000 AMD will be used to buy several beehives and also some diesel fuel for his final agricultural works.

loans.use: to buy several beehives and also some diesel fuel for his final agricultural works.

loans.name: Las Purapureñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PURAPUREÑAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Petrona es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa de lana para niños, venta de mantas, venta de leche, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de gelatina.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Petrona es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que realizo en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido venta de ropa de lana para niños; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace más de tres años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Las Purapureñas” communal bank will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional hub for Alto Lima. They are comprised of 8 members and lead by a board of directors where Petrona is the president. The businesses which the members of the communal bank carry forward are varied and among them are: selling wool clothing for children, milk, chamarras (a blanket with an opening in the middle to wear like a poncho), food and jelly.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesses where Petrona is a member. She notes that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago. She joined because of an invitation from a promotion that the institution carried out in her area. She currently has a business weaving wool clothing for children. She discloses that she learned this business more than three years ago on her own accord.

The loan that she will now take out will be to increase her capital (to buy wool wholesale) which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell it at the city markets in El Alto. This type of work has allowed her to generate income to financially support her family, since she is single and has three children

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 adult children. He has been a cash crop farmer for 15 years and it has been profitable.

This is his 5th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

Peter will use his generated profits to pay the college fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business, be financially stable, and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old, with 5 children. He is a farmer and has been growing cash crops for sell for 13 years. This is his 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm so as to harvest more farm produce for sell and get more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business by growing more cash crops, be financially stable and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in his farm so as to harvest more farm produce for sale and get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 38 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Saturnina is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Saturnina has been in pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tipag Nawuni  Saabon-Zongo Group

texts.en:
Amina is sitting in the first chair on the right. She is a 50-year-old married woman with five children and lives in Saabon-Zongo, a community in the upper-eastern region of Ghana. She is also the leader of this group of business-minded women called Tipag Nawuni Saabon-Zongo, or the “We thank God group of Saabon-Zongo.

For the past ten years Amina has sold food, a good business because of the large number of potential customers in the area. Like her colleagues, she is challenged by a lack of capital, especially for expanding their businesses.

In view of this, Amina has applied for a 21,900 GHC loan through Kiva's field partner Grameen Ghana that will be apportioned among the members of the group. Her share, 1200 GHC, will be used to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

Amina dreams of becoming a major supplier of foods to her fellow food vendors in the area. Her aim is to earn enough money to both pay back this loan and support her family. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

loans.name: Anneth

texts.en:
Anneth is 60 years old and is married with 7 children. She lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of Solomon Islands.

Anneth raises and sells chickens in her community or at the market to earn a living, and she has been doing this for 3 years.

Anneth needs a loan to buy day-old chicks and chicken feed to help assist her in running her poultry business. She hopes to build a big house for her family with the profits she earns in her business. Also, with the little she has, she is able to help cover her family's daily expenses.

Anneth joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy day-old chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
José, un hombre con principios, orgulloso campesino de 50 años de edad que trabaja con un objetivo, dar lo mejor de sí en su trabajo de agricultura y producción de panela, para mantener a su familia, que la conforma su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 13 años de edad que aparte de brindarle estudio, le está trasmitiendo todos los conocimientos en cultivo y procesamiento de panela.
Para mantener sus cultivos es necesario aplicar ciertos insumos agrícolas principalmente para alejar plagas, es por este motivo que el señor José quiere solicitar un préstamo con el comprara venenos, abonos, riegos e insumos de molienda para la producción de panela.
texts.en:
José is a 50-year-old man of principles and proud farmer who works with an objective: to give his best at his work in sugarcane agriculture and production, in order to support his family. His family consists of his wife and his small 13-year-old son. Apart from providing for his son's education, he is transmitting to him all his knowledge of cultivating and processing sugarcane.

In order to maintain his crops, it is necessary to apply certain agricultural inputs first to ward off pests. It is for this reason that Mr. José wants a loan with which he will purchase pesticides, fertilizers, and irrigation and milling supplies for sugarcane production.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizers, and irrigation and milling supplies for sugarcane production.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a bigger and better business within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo is a farmer. He lives at Solana. He is 50 years old, married and had four children. One is still at school. His wife is raising hogs as source of income. Eliseo's farming activities include sowing, planting and harvesting.

He had insufficient fund to sustain his crops with good nutrition that is why he is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy farm inputs in rice farming. He will buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides too. In the future, Eliseo hopes to continue improving his profits for overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for rice farming.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a M-pesa business where he offers money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add M-pesa float. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful business man.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, bread and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Direct Selling is a business of most housewives in the Philippines. It’s where you’ll become a reseller of a certain company and brochures will be provided once you’ve registered as a member.
