Most of their customers are just their neighbors and friends that’s why delayed payments can’t be avoided. 

In every industry, being patient and persevere are the key factors to succeed. Like Jovelyn one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is engaged on this type of business. She is a 43 years old business woman living in Quezon City, Philippines. She has two children, one in the high school level and the other one in college.

Aside from managing a direct selling business of personal products, she’s also running her own variety store. She dreams of being successful on those businesses, for an approximate amount of P16, 000 is her total earnings. She decided to apply for a Php 10, 000 loan amount as she wants to stock personal products like cosmetics, and perfumes for men and women and to buy grocery items for her variety store business. 

Jovelyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to stock personal products like cosmetics, and perfumes for men and women and to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling purchase order cards.  Marlyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like, sandwich, peanuts, pasta, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like, sandwich, peanuts, pasta, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of Solomon Islands.

She operates a small convenient general store selling different food items such as canned food, sugar, noodles and rice, and alone side she sells strong drinks like beer and whisky. She has been doing this for nine months.

She requested a loan to buy strong drinks such as beer and whisky for her general store. She plan to covers for the family's daily expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy beer, whisky for her general store.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en: Saada is a 49 year old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children, one of them is still attending school. Her husband is the main income provider in the family to help them to live in good conditions. Today, as her child will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to register him at school. The parents’ only target is to provide him with a good educational path until graduation and help him become able to get good jobs that will give him a good income.

loans.use: to register her child at school.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 35 years old business woman, currently involved in a buy and sell business of different designs of towels, bags and mattresses for 3 years with an earnings of approximately Php 35, 000 every month. She’s married to Alex who’s also a vendor. They’re helping each other in running the business.

Each day is tiring, since dealing with different kinds of people and change of weather needs to be considered as well. However, she’s still persevere to run the business and earn more profit. Fatima is thankful when someone told her about Center for Community Transformation (CCT). They’ve been given opportunity to attend business seminars.

Fatima dreams of having her own stall, since currently she’s just paying for a monthly rental. She starts to save more money for her to invest for her own stall someday. She decided to apply for a Php 20,000 loan since she needs additional capital for her business to grow. She’ll buy and stock different designs of bags, bed covers and towels for her buy and sell business.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Fatima spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy products such as bags, mattresses and towels for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Fifty-year old Violeta sold snack foods to nearby tourist spot in her town. She sold buko (young coconut) juice,and popsicle( ice cream or water ice on a small wooden stick). In addition to that, she also sells souvenir t-shirts, as supplemental income.
She lives in the rural town of Carmen, Bohol with his husband and four children. Two of her children are still attending school.

She has been engaged in her food vending business for more than 10 years now, serving locals, and tourists that may come to visit the place going to the famous Chocolate Hills.

She is in need of an additional capital to boost her livelihood. Violeta has requested a loan to buy additional supplies like sugar, young coconut , disposable glasses and additional stocks of souvenir t-shirts. In that way, she could able to purchase more supplies that would help attract buyers to buy.

She is hoping that she will be successful in handling her sources of income to help improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like sugar, young coconut , disposable glasses and additional  stocks of souvenir t-shirts.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Agripina is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Agripina has been farming vegetables for 8 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Teresita has a buys and sells banana business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of banana to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of banana to sell.

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en: Mikayel is 57 years old and he lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. Mikayel is marred and he has two sons. Both of them live and work in Yerevan city. Mikayel and his wife as well are employed. Being very active and laborious person for Mikayel it is very strange to feel weak and unhealthy like he feels lately. He and his all family are very worried of this and he wants to solve this problem quickly and basically. This loan of 510.000 Armenian drams he asks as he must solve his health problems.

loans.use: he must solve his health problems

loans.name: Leocil

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leocil works hard to support her family.

She has a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Leocil is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leocil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 51-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in the Batumi district. Both of them are unemployed and live in poverty. The family gets social assistance from the government. 

Merab decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 Georgia Lari (GEL). 

With the received credit, he will purchase food products and will resell at a local school. He will open a small buffet at the local school and will run it. This will give him a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to open a small buffet at a local school and generate income

loans.name: Santos

texts.en:
Santos is 55 years old, married and has 3 childrens. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes. He dreams of growing the best organic mangoes ever.

Santos needs US$ 1000 as loan for fertilizing the fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income, he will improve the roof on his house to protect it against the rainy season.

loans.use: for manuring the fields and increase his organic mango production.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 40 years old, 40 and married with 3 children. He does motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for 3 years now. This is his 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

He will use the loan amount together with his savings that he had accumulated to buy another motor cycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits from the expanded business to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to own a fleet of vehicles for transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motor cycle and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en: Petrona lives with her little children, in her own house.  Petrona sells cheese, vegetables and potatoes and she needs a loan to buy more of these items.  Petrona doesn't have a farm, so she has to go to many towns to buy the food and to resell it.  Petrona is the only one at her house that makes money. She hopes you can help her because she has to raise her children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, vegetables and cheese

loans.name: Nyame Bekyere Gruop Group

texts.en:
Christiana sells cow feet (meat) (she is on the right side in the picture).

The loan she received will be used to build a roof for her food stand. In the past her loan payments have been punctual because she had good sales.

"Now I can serve more customers and sell more food," Christiana says. The advantage of her business is that she has new customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy more items to provide for her new customers.

Her dream is to strengthen her business. She wants to purchase more cow feet in bulk. This is her second loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She has been in business for eight years.

Her group is called Nyame Bekyere, in the greater Accra region of Ghana.

loans.use: to build a roof on her stall.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 53 year old artisan who makes little guitars that she sells as souvenirs.

She is been in this business for over 10 years Julieta needs a loan to buy supplies for her business.

Julieta is divorced and she is the mother of an 11 years old daughter. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her artisan business

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is 26 years old and married with he is married with two daughters.

He and his wife opened a day care and a room to organize child birthdays.

Edson needs a loan to fix the walls of his day care center.

He has the experience deal with kids and he is assisted by his wife. She studied how to support kids at college.

Edson hopes you can trust him.

loans.use: to fix the walls of his day care center

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una socia que pertenece al Banco "Caminemos Juntas" en la provincia del Cusco,ella sigue dedicándose a su negocio de artesanía y le va muy bien , como su sueño es tener una tienda mas grande , necesita mas capital para comprar tapises ,alfombras y ponchos. así podrá ofrecer mas productos y ganar mas  clientes que le ayuden a conseguir su sueño.
la socia Juana esta contenta y agradecida con KIVA por seguir confiando en  ella.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Bank "Caminemos Juntas” (Let’s Walk Together) in the province of Cusco. She remains committed to her craft business and is doing very well. As her dream is to have a larger store, she needs more capital to buy tapestries, rugs and ponchos, so she can offer more products and win more customers to help her achieve her dream.

Juana is happy and grateful to KIVA for continuing to trust in her.

loans.use: to buy tapestries, rugs and ponchos.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar is a 57 years old father of five kids.

He is a shoemaker and needs a loan to fix his bedroom due to damage from recent rains.

Apolinar is married and his wife washes clothes to support her kids.

loans.use: to fix his bedroom

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es:
Ayda es una persona alegre, muy segura de sí misma, madre soltera cabeza de familia que necesita de tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas ya que necesita capital para mantener a su pequeño de 12 años de edad.
El dinero será utilizado para la compra un carro de comidas rápidas y surtido de productos para elaborar pinchos, chuzos, arepas, perros calientas, papas a la francesa, hamburguesas entre otros, invertir en enseres y un uniforme adecuado para trabajar.
texts.en:
Ayda is a very confident, happy person. She is a single mother and the head of her household, who needs your support to start a business selling fast food, because she needs capital to take care of her little one who is 12 years old.

The money will be used to purchase a fast food cart and an assortment of products for making pinchos (small appetizers), kebabs, arepas, hot dogs, french fries, and hamburgers among others, and to invest in equipment and a proper uniform to work in.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida es una emprendedora mujer que reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Bogotá y siempre le ha gustado el comercio, hace ocho años abrió al público una cacharrería y miscelánea en donde maneja un amplio surtido de productos de temporada, artículos y plásticos para el hogar, juguetería, decoración para fiestas, productos de aseo para el hogar entre otros. El capital para emprender su proyecto de negocio lo consiguió ahorrando las pensiones que cancelaban estudiantes a los que ella les ofrecía el servicio hospedaje.  Ella es muy entregada y todos los días está disponible para recibir a sus clientes a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. quienes en su gran mayoría son residentes de barrios cercanos, vecinos y amigos. En la actualidad cuenta con ocho años de experiencia y su prioridad es continuamente surtir con productos de temporada que se venden muy rápido y le generan una buena utilidad, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir exclusivamente en productos de temporada como mascaras para el Halloween, sombreros y decoración alusiva, así como luces navideñas, guirnaldas, arbolitos navideños y demás.  Su meta es mejorar la imagen del negocio para ser más competitiva.
texts.en:
Candida is an entrepreneurial woman who lives with her spouse in a Bogotá city neighborhood and has always liked sales. Eight years ago she opened a china and sundries shop to the public which handles a wide range of seasonal products, household items and plastics, toys, party decorations, and household cleaning products, among others.

The capital to launch her business she got from saving the rent that students were paying, to whom she offered lodging services.

She is very dedicated and is available every day from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. to welcome her customers who are mostly residents of nearby neighborhoods, neighbors and friends.

Currently, she has eight years of experience. Her priority is to continue to supply very-fast-selling seasonal products which generate a good profit. For this reason she requests an interim loan, her first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], in order to invest exclusively in seasonal products such as Halloween masks, hats and allusive decoration, such as Christmas lights, garlands, Christmas trees, and the rest.

loans.use: to invest exclusively in seasonal products: Halloween masks, hats and allusive decorations, Christmas lights, garlands, Christmas trees and others.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: As a married mother of two teenagers, Amelia is always on the lookout for ways to earn a living. She is 53 years old from Valencia, Bohol. She helps her carpenter husband by making dresses using her sewing machine. She also repairs clothes. In addition to this Amelia is also engaged in the pottery business. She is asking for a loan to buy cement, cloth and clay so she can further sustain her livelihood while also paying for her children's school fees. It is her dream to continue making her business successful so that her children can finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy cement, cloth and clay

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and has one child in school.

Violeta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Violeta has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Emily is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emily has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Christ Our Lord Group

texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old and a single parent. She lives with her three year old child and three relatives.

She is the leader of the Christ Our Lord group and from Praso in the Twifo Lower Denkyira District of the Central Region of Ghana. This is their first group loan.

Gloria runs her own business: selling beans, rice, eggs and local ingredients. She has been in business for five years and this is how she caters to her child’s education and other expenses.

Gloria has decided to include Elsa stove distribution after witnessing its demonstration and climate change education, by the field officers in her community.

Gloria has already surveyed the market for the stove, that uses palm kernel shells (virgin pellets) which are available as waste materials within her community.

There is high demand for Elsa stoves since they improve indoor air quality and health of the users. Additionally, the fuel cost is zero.

Gloria and her group member need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the demand of clients through their market assessment.

Funding their loan will also mean reducing deforestation and put an end to the cutting down of trees for firewood and charcoal by community of stove users.

Gloria and her group's member thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity and help to preserve the forest within their communities.

loans.use: to purchase Elsa stoves for resale.

loans.name: All Is Well Group

texts.en:
Amos is 50 years old man (right side of group picture). He is from Praso in the Twifo Lower Denkyira District of the Central Region of Ghana.

Amos is married with five children which four attend school. He is the leader and group representative of All Is Well.

Amos’ wife is a trader who has been a very supportive and responsible wife. He sells spraying machines, fertilizers, insect traps, weedicides, machetes, wallentin boots, and other grocery items. He has owned and operated his business for 20 years.

Amos also has a commercial vehicle used to supplements his income.

As a business minded person he decided to add Elsa stove distribution to his business after he witnessed the community education on climate change and the introduction of Elsa Stove to his community.

Amos has done the necessary market survey with a very positive result. Due to the availability of the Elsa stoves fuel, which is a waste material within their community the demand for the Elsa stove is very high. The stove uses Palm Kernel shells (Virgin Pellet) as fuel and avoids the cutting of trees from the forest for firewood and charcoal.

The Elsa stove improves indoor air quality and the health of the users, and is cost effective.

Amos and his group's member need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the growing demand.

Funding their loan will also mean improving the health of the household communities and reducing deforestation. Amos and his group member thank all their Kiva micro lenders for their generosity and help to improve the environment within the communities they operate.

loans.use: to buy Elsa Stoves for resale.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old mother of two kids. She sells diet products and needs a loan to buy more diet products to resell.

Iris lives with his parents and she helps them with their expenses, so she hopes you can help her.

Iris would like to go to college in the future and to give his kids a better life.

loans.use: to buy more diet products

loans.name: Gaby

texts.en:
Adelayda is 47 years old teacher and secretary who works at a public school.

She needs a loan due to an emergency; she needs to fix the walls at her house because of rain damage.

Adelayda is married but her husband is in another country working, and he can't send her more money than usual.

Adelayda hopes you can help her. See how bad the walls look in the picture.

loans.use: to fix the walls at her house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Maria Isabel is a Mexican dairy farmer. She owns 18 cows and sells their milk on a daily basis. She also cultivates corn and vegetables on a field close to her house.

When she heard about Sistema Biobolsa, she was above all interested in the opportunity to reduce her operating costs, especially LP gas and chemical fertilizers. With her biodigester, she will be able to transform the manure her cows produce on a daily basis into renewable energy (biogas) to cook and heat water, as well as produce organic fertilizer for her field. Not only will Maria Isabel spend less, but she will also protect the environment by treating manure that was emitting greenhouse gases and contaminating underground water sources. Her farm will turn into a sustainable model of organic farming, while becoming more productive and cost-effective.

This loan represents 18% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a down payment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 12-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Aljune

texts.en: Aljune has been helping his mother working on their own farm to make a living. It is their main source of income. While waiting for the vegetable planting and harvest seasons, he keeps on selling vegetables in their village to cover their daily expenditures. It is his plan to cultivate more. Without hesitation, he joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy planting materials like seeds and fertilizer. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of seeds to plant.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives with his wife and her little daughter at the house of his parents.

He sells milk to a dairy plant. He is been doing this since for along time and is assisted by his wife.

Edwin needs a loan to buy a dairy cow able to produce more milk.

He wants to improve the life quality of his daughter because she is a baby.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 27 years old constructor from Bumbata village, Ungheni region. He worked eight years in Russia where he was injured his back.

After that he decided to grow beef cattle. With money earned he constructed a stone stable and bought ten calves.

But raising cattle is physically very difficult and Ivan decided raising a quail birds for sale. eggs and mature birds.

His mother Eleonora works in Italy on at a railroad. She sends money every month and supports her son’s ideas.

Ivan will use this loan for purchase 1200 quail birds.

loans.use: to purchase quail birds

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en:
Ivana works at a butcher shop cutting bones, which is difficult work due to safety concerns. Ivana also sells lamb and is a good cook.

This time Ivana asks for a loan to buy bed sheets to sell fairs when Christmas season comes.

She is doing great but thinks she can get more money if she takes advantage of the Christmas seasons.

Ivana is single and living with her parents and taking care of her three children. She has many hopes, and hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Iván is a divorced man and father of a little boy.

Ivan got tired of the transportation business and he started to sell cellphones at the city of La Paz and he is doing it great.

Ivan is living at his father-in-law's house. Ivan is the father of two kids and needs a loan to buy more cellphones to resell.

Ivan hopes you can help him. He is pictures at work at his street stand.

loans.use: to buy more cellphones to resell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge needs a loan to buy supplies for his grocery store.

He is not thinking about retirement; he feels good. He is married and still working as a teacher.

Jorge teaches classes at night, but during the daytime he runs his grocery store.

Jorge is a senior citizen and the only one in his house who supports his family; so he hopes you can trust him again.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his grocery store.

loans.name: Inti Pajsi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI PAJSI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Collpani, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de rellenos, venta de edredones, venta de api (bebida tradicional), venta de manteles para mesa, venta de anticuchos (comida tradicional), venta de bisutería, venta de cosméticos, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección y venta de manteles para mesa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa hace seis años, de quien aprendió a elaborar estos manteles es de su amiga, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en este negocio es su esposo.
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela y lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Inti Pajsi community bank is starting their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Center. The group is made up of ten members and is led by an executive board, of which Maxima is the President. The members of the community bank have a variety of businesses, including: selling stuffing, selling quilts, selling api (a traditional beverage), selling tablecloths, selling traditional food, selling jewelry, selling cosmetics, and a butcher shop.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Maxima. She said has joined Pro Mujer for the first time at the invitation of an adviser from the bank. She currently has a business sewing and selling tablecloths. She started this business by her own initiative six years ago. She learned to make tablecloths from her friend, and her husband currently helps with the business.

The loan they are requesting will increase her capital to allow her to purchase fabric and wool at wholesale from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. Later, she will make and sell them at markets in El Alto. This work generates income to support her family financially, since she is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Shodmonoy

texts.en:
Shodmonoy was born in 1962 year. She is married and has 2 children. Shodmonoy has been busy with growing agricultural products more than 15 years. She grows variety of vegetables as carrot, onion, potatoes, cabbage and some kind of crops. Shodmonoy has own growing land and she likes to work in a land. Shodmonoy’s husband helps her with managing business.

She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her grandchild because her grandchild is ill. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her grandchild.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion earns a living by engaging in fishing. She sells crabs and fresh fish to the locals in her town. She lives in her own home with her two children. Her eldest child is 13 and the youngest is 11. Together with her family, she resides in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. His catch is a source of income and for family consumption as well.

Concepcion is asking for a loan to buy crab nets and materials for pump boat repair like plywood, nails and epoxy (adhesive). That would help improve her ongoing catch. It improves the way she transports her catch and provides ease of travel. Thus, her livelihood will improve and she will slowly be able to manage her finances wisely.

In the future, she hopes that her business will become successful in order to continue to send her children to school in preparation for their brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy crab nets and materials for pump boat repair like plywood, nails and epoxy (adhesive).

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 51 years old. Sarah helps her husband to manage their own farm for a living. She has been doing this for many years, earning well for the family. Sarah always finds ways to have a greener farm for a better income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer to improve their farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Wencelsao

texts.en:
Wencelsao has been working with his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for over a year now, and is impressed by the savings he has made, allowing him to fully repay his first loan on time. He has been using the biogas to cook and to heat water in the bathroom, but the biodigester was producing much more than he could use! He seized the opportunity to invest in a 6-kilowatt motogenerator as soon as Sistema Biobolsa launched the product, in order to take full advantage of the biogas. By connecting the biodigester to the motogenerator, Wencelsao will transform the biogas into electricity that he can use for his milking machine, for example. He will further increase his savings and make a step more towards full energy self-sufficiency, simply by transforming his cows' and sheep's manure intro biogas, electricity and organic fertilizer. Wenceslao is innovating and investing in technology that works for him, improving his farm's productivity while protecting the environment and improving his family's quality of life.

This loan represents 32% of the full cost of the motogenerator. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a down payment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a motogenerator and transform manure into electricity.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is 46 years and married with two children. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She runs a small convenient store selling food items in high demand in her community such as rice, canned food and cooking oil. She's been in business for almost seven months.

Lilly requested loan of $5500 to buy bales of rice, a variety of canned foods and cooking oil for her business.

She plan to use her profit to expand her small convenient store to help covers for her family's daily expenses.

Lilly recently joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her convenient store.

loans.name: Justino

texts.en:
Justino needs a loan to buy sheep because he wants to raise them and sell wool.

He is 50 years old, married and has a son.

Justino is the owner of his own house. He makes cheese and sells milk. He collaborates with his wife.

Justino is giving his best to have a bigger and more competitive farm

Justino is working as a mason; and you can see him in the picture with one of his partners in the background.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: La Palma Group

texts.es:
La Palma es el nombre de un grupo pequeño cuyos integrantes son muy alegres pues siempre están sonriendo. Existe una gran amistad entre todos y se demuestran su apoyo ante cualquier situación; el nombre fue elegido ya que les recuerda al lugar donde se reúnen para convivir y charlar de sus negocios. 
   Erika es una de las integrantes más alegres, aprovecha su juventud para trabajar y dar lo mejor de sí con el objetivo de dar beneficios a su familia. Vive casada con su esposo Ángel quien trabaja como constructor y sus tres niños de los cuales dos realizan sus estudios. En la venta de zapatos por catálogo encontró la mejor actividad para cumplir sus objetivos; "siempre llevé una muy buena amistad con mi vecina, ella fue quien me motivó a iniciar con el negocio; me comentó que se obtenían muy buenas ganancias" menciona muy contenta.
   Actualmente sale todos los días para mostrar los catálogos de casa en casa donde, en algunas ocasiones, le piden que los deje para que puedan ver y observar a detalle las características de los productos. Tiempo después regresa para tomar pedidos y poder solicitar el zapato especifico. Otra de sus ventajas es que da plazos para que sus clientes puedan pagar con mayor tranquilidad y seguridad. Hasta el momento la actividad le ha representado buenos resultados, por un lado, por la buena calidad de la mercancía, y por otro, por la excelente atención que brinda. Una de sus metas es aumentar la producción en su negocio para iniciar con una nueva actividad.
   Por otro lado, se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida con los préstamos obtenidos pues son un apoyo inigualable a la hora de reinvertir. En esta ocasión comprará más productos y catálogos
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Norma quien invertirá en sillas y mesas; Angelina, en una florería; María de los Ángeles, en quesos; Kevin, en pollos; Ilse, en mantelería y Emma, en tortillas.  
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Norma quien muestra algunos manteles, Erika es quien viste la playera azul.
texts.en:
La Palma is the name of a small group whose members are very happy and always smiling. They are all great friends and they support each other in every situation. Their name was chosen to remind them of the place where they meet to spend time together and talk about their businesses.

Erika is one of the happiest members. She takes advantage of her youth to work and give the best of herself with the objective of benefiting her family. She is married to her husband, Angel, who works as a builder, and they have three children, two of whom are in school. In catalog shoe sales, she found the best work to meet her objectives. She said, "I have always had a good friendship with my neighbor, and she motivated me to start my business by saying I would earn a good income."

She currently goes out every day to show her catalogs house by house. Sometimes, they ask her to leave them so they can look and observe in detail the characteristics of the products. A while later, she returns to take orders, and she can order a specific shoe. One of the other advantages is that she allows her customers to pay in installments with greater calm and security. Until now, she has had good results from her business because of the good quality of her merchandise and the excellent customer service she provides. One of her goals is to increase her production so she can start a new business.

On the other hand, she is very happy and grateful for the loan provided, since they are an incomparable support for reinvestment. She plans to purchase more products and catalogs.

The other group members are Norma, who will purchase chairs and tables; Angelina, a florist; Maria de los Angeles, cheeses; Kevin, chickens; Ilse, table linens, and Emma, tortillas.

*The photograph was taken at Norma's house and she is showing some tablecloths. Erika is dressed in the blue shirt.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is married and has lived with her husband for many years.

She makes cheese and she learned how to do it from her parents, She goes to the fair of Patacamaya to sell her products.

Felipa needs a loan to buy a milking cow.

She hopes you can help her because her husband is unemployed but has started to help her at the farm.

Felipa would like to be the owner of her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: El Sr. Nelson de 28 años de edad vive y trabaja actualmente en domicilio y terreno propio, no tiene hijos que depende de el, tampoco tiene esposa, es soltero, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Villa Vaca Guzmán. En la comunidad de Iripity  Su principal actividad del solicitante es la producción de miel de abejas que sacara al mercado local de Monteagudo una vez realizada la cosecha ya que cuenta con la capacitación necesaria en dicha actividad, Es por eso que requiere el préstamo que será destinado totalmente para la compra de materiales y equipamiento para la apicultura, con la compra de la misma empezara su actividad ya que tiene la necesidad de facilitar su trabajo con la producción de miel por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir ya que esta actividad requiere de mayor inversión y menos trabajo una vez establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson is 28-years-old. He lives and works at home and on his own land. He has no dependent children, nor a wife, he is single. He lives the Chuquisaca municipality Villa Vaca Guzmán department, in the community of Iripity.

As he has the necessary training, his main trade is honey production, which he takes to the local market in Monteagudo after the harvest. For this reason he requires a loan which will be used fully for the purchase agricultural materials and equipment.

With this purchase, he will begin this activity since he needs it to facilitate his honey production work. It will provide good income and improve his living conditions at home and in his daily life since this trade requires more investment and less work once established.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for beekeeping in order to sell honey to his customer, generate income and improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Johanna Maria

texts.en:
Johana, is a 31 years old single woman from Colombia. Nine years ago she came to Ecuador looking for a new life and to get away from conflict in Colombia since the 1960’s.

She has two children, a fourteen year old son and six year old daughter. They live in Colombia with their grandmother.

Sometimes Johana feels very sad because she misses her children, but she is aware that the only way to help her family is by working in Ecuador. So she opened a year ago an small restaurant where she sells pies, roasted banana, stuffed potatoes and stuffed pone (papa rellena y arepa rellena).

Johana lives alone in a small apartment with two rooms. Outside she runs a small business. She wakes up at 6 o’clock to prepare food and buy things she needs. She works Tuesday to Sunday.

Her biggest problem is that she doesn't have enough money to buy raw material like fruits, potatoes, etc. She also needs to pay for work permission.

Johana is a hard worker and sure this loan will help her improve her business and enable her to save money.

She hopes to bring her children to Ecuador and give them the opportunity to study and get a profession.

loans.use: this loan she will use to buy the raw materials like fruits, potatoes and meet.

loans.name: Lylliam Del Socorro

texts.es: Lylliam una mujer de 51 años de edad, una persona casada, mujer humilde madre de 4 niños, falta de estudio, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabajar por su familia pro su hogar, una mujer que se cansó de ser pobre, para afirmar sus palabras con acciones la empresaria solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa, quiere aprovechar la temporada de diciembre para vender, generar buenos recursos y con las ganancias tener un plante para trabajar todo el próximo año, igualmente para darle a su familia una feliz navidad.
texts.en: Lylliam, a 51 year old woman, is a married person; a humble woman mother of 4 children. She was not able to study, but has many wishes to move ahead and work for her family, for her household. She got tired of being poor. In order to do something instead of just talking, she is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of clothes. She wants to take advantage of the December season to sell, to generate good income; and with her earnings, to have a place from where she can work next year and give her family a good Christmas.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of casual clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Luz Piedad

texts.es:
Luz Piedad, es una mujer de 54 años de edad, una persona que quiere trabajar, quiere superarse y poder sostenerse a ella misma.
Con determinación, con toda la convicción de triunfar, la cliente solicita un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía, iniciara comercializando ropa para hombre y dama. Su objetivo principal es vender a amigos, vecinos y familiares, consolidarse en su sector y en futuro montar un local comercial.
texts.en:
Luz Piedad is a 54-year-old woman. She is a person who wants to work, improve, and be able to support herself.

With determination and all the conviction to triumph, she requests a loan to start a business selling merchandise. She will begin selling clothing for men and women. Her main objective is to sell to her friends, neighbors, and relatives, establish herself in her sector, and one day set up a comercial shop.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 63 year old and has two children, living in Calamba Misamis Occidental, She grows and harvests bananas. Its work she has done since she was married.

Her husband past away; she works hard to provide a good life for her family. Anecita gets up early and goes to the field where she oversees the banana plantation.

Anecita is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she wants to expand her banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana plantation.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is 44 years of age and resides in Mauswagun Calamba Misamis Occidental, Phillipines.

Jocelyn owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She's done this work for six years.

Each month, she earns PHP 6,300. Jocelyn requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase noodles, sardines, etc., to sell.

Recently, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to renovate her sari-sari store and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase Materials for renovation of my sari-sari store

loans.name: Motu

texts.en:
Motu is a 46 year old mother with six children. She runs a small business selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

She requested a loan to buy chemicals, taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, to help her run her business.

Motu will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, taro roots (seedling), banana tube (seedling), wheelbarrow, rake and shovel.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 57 años, una persona con sueños y aspiraciones, vive en la zona rural del barrio Adolfo, donde identifico una necesidad, en el sector no hay un negocio de ferretería y él al no tener empleo quiere solicitar un apoyo para montar dicho negocio y ofrecer este servicio a la comunidad.
Con el monto del dinero adecuara un local en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Este negocio representara la oportunidad de una familia colombiana que busca en el emprendimiento una forma de vivir, una forma de sostenerse en el tiempo y aspirar a un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 57-year-old man. He is a person with dreams and aspirations and lives in a rural area of the Adolfo neighborhood where he identified a need. There is no hardware store in the area and he, not having a job, wants to request a loan to set up this business and offer this service to the community.

With the money he will arrange a shop in the front part of his home.

This business will represent the opportunity of a Colombian family that searches in the undertaking a way of life, a way to support itself over time and to aspire for a better future.

loans.use: to start a hardware business and buy tools to sell.

loans.name: Fathiddin

texts.ru: Это мужчина Фатхиддин. Он из района Джоми. Ему 41 лет. Фатхиддин женат и отец четверых детей. Детям 15, 14, 13 и 12 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. Жена Фатхиддин вместе с ним работает на земле. У Фатхиддин имеется большой земельный участок. Он на земле работает с утро до вечера. Фатхиддин готовить землю к новому посеву урожай, и он работает без трактора. Работать на земле не легкий труд. Фатхиддин энергичный и активный житель. Он любить зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. Фатхиддин хочет обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, на большой земельный участок требуется больше количества минеральных удобрений. Фатхиддин планирует взять кредит и приобрести минеральных удобрений. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему достичь своих целей.
texts.en: This man is Fathiddin. He's from the region of Jomi. He is 41 years old. Fathiddin is married, with four children. They are 15,14,13, and 12 years old studying in middle school. Fathiddin's wife works with him in the fields. Fathiddin owns a big land lot. He works there from dawn till dusk. He is now preparing the land for planting new seeds, and he does it without a tractor. Fathiddin finds working in the land quite easy. He is an energetic and active man. He enjoys making a living from his fair hard work. Fathiddin Wants to apply mineral fertilizers to the land, and his big land lot requires quite a lot of the fertilizers. Fathiddin is planning to request a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. The borrowed money will help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jan Carlos

texts.es:
Jan Carlos, es un joven de 21 años de edad, que tiene una carnicería,  una persona carismática, trabajadora, una persona con sueños y aspiraciones, como lo es pagar la educación de su hijo que increíblemente tiene 7 años de edad, comprar vivienda y jamás dejar que su familia pase necesidades.
Al tener un hijo a tan temprana edad, le toco buscar trabajo, pero encontró una mejor solución, la venta de carne le significo progreso, una oportunidad de generar los ingresos para alimentar su familia.
Jan Calos actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de utensilios para picar y cortar la carne, puesto que los suyos ya se encuentran en muy mal estado, también comprara carne de cerdo y res para la venta.
texts.en:
Jan Carlos, a young man who is 21 years old, has a butcher shop.  He is a charismatic and hardworking person.  He is a person with dreams and aspirations, such as paying for the education of his son who incredibly is 7 years old, to buy a house, and to never allow his family to go without what they need.

After having a child at such a young age, he had to look for work, but he found a better solution.  Selling meat meant progress for him and an opportunity to make income to feed his family.

Now Jan Carlos is requesting a loan to buy utensils to dice and to cut meat since his are in very bad condition; also, he will buy pork and beef to sell.

loans.use: To buy utensils to dice and to cut meat.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa está en el 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas expectativas de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo en equipo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Odulia ella  trabaja en una florería familiar, y comenta que gracias a sus esfuerzos está saliendo adelante y ayuda a sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy luchadora que trabaja de manera incansable para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar flores de mayor variedad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas de flores, y cumpliendo de esa manera con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a sus familias gracias a las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank is in their first loan cycle with the women’s committee program. They are a new group that hopes to be able to improve their living conditions through teamwork. They are part of the poverty elimination program, striving to be able to improve their standard of living.

Odulia is one of the members and she works in a family-owned florist’s shop. She says that thanks to her hard work, she is getting ahead and helping her loved ones. She is a determined woman who works tirelessly to improve her living conditions as well as those of her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a wide variety of flowers and, in this way, continue selling flowers, and fulfilling her customers’ orders. She is thankful for the opportunity they are all receiving of being someone in life and being able to help their families thanks to the trainings.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of flowers for her florist's shop.

loans.name: Los Higos Group

texts.es:
Los nopales son el producto vegetal que identifica a cierta comunidad del Estado de México donde gran parte de la población se dedica al cultivo de este y otros alimentos como el maíz y el haba. Los residentes son personas muy trabajadoras quienes aún conservan su lengua originaria mazahua y mantienen conversaciones que enriquecen la diversidad del país. De igual modo, las fiestas patronales son celebradas con mucho entusiasmo; la más grande es dedicada a San Antonio y tiene una duración de tres días en donde realizan danzas típicas de la región, misas religiosas y convivencias entre vecinos. Todo lo anterior es posible gracias a la tranquilidad de la zona y la amabilidad de locales y foráneos.
   Doña Guadalupe o Lupita, como le dicen de cariño, es integrante de un grupo formado en dicha comunidad. Es muy alegre y entregada a sus actividades laborarles, su mayor motivación es su familia integrada por su esposo Salvador y sus cinco hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Su esposo se ha dedicado desde hace 25 años a la compra y venta de  artículos de fantasía, “porque me gusta tener trato directo con otras personas pero sobretodo porque obtenía muy buenos ingresos" comentó Don Salvador. 
   Cinco años después, Lupita decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar y con la educación de sus hijos, así que inició su propio negocio. Actualmente la pareja gozan de libertad económica y están muy contentos por ello. "Nos gustaría adquirir un local fijo donde pudiéramos exhibir toda nuestra mercancía” comentan ya que hoy en día realizan la actividad de modo ambulante. Por otro lado, se muestran entusiasmados con el crédito que otorga VFMéxico pues dividen en dos el fondo para invertir en ambos negocios. Las mejorías que han visto en su actividad son un aliciente para continuar por el camino que llevan hasta ahora; entre sus logros se encuentra al haber remodelado y amueblado su hogar.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Amelia, Teresa, Manuel y Antonio quienes invierten en productos de fantasía; Josefina, en productos para cosecha; Victoria, en trastes y Eduardo, en lentes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Doña Amelia quien viste suéter y playera azul, Doña Lupita, por su parte, viste un pantalón color rosa.
texts.en:
The nopal (edible fleshy pad of the nopal cactus) is the agricultural product that identifes a certain community in the Estado de Mexico, a place where most of its population earns a living by growing this product and other crops such as corn and broad beans.

The inhabitants are very hard-working people, who still preserve and converse in their indigenous language, Mazahua—a characteristic that enriches the country's diversity. Similarly, the patron saint's day is celebrated with great enthusiasm. The most important celebration is in honour of San Antonio, and it lasts three days. During this time, typical dances of the region are performed, masses are celebrated, and neighbourhood gatherings take place. All of these activities are possible thanks to the peacefulness of the area and to the kindness of locals and foreigners.

Guadalupe, affectionately called Lupita, is a member of a group formed in said community. She is very cheerful and devoted to her work. Her highest motivation is her family—consisting of her husband Salvador and their five children, two of whom are currently in school.

Twenty-five years ago, her husband began earning a living by buying and selling costume jewellery "because I liked to deal personally with other people, but, above all, because I was earning a good income," Salvador says.

Lupita decided to help with the household expenses and their children's education, so she started her own business five years later.

Currently, the couple enjoy financial freedom, and they are very happy about it. “We would like to purchase a permanent stand, where we could display all of our merchandise,” they say. They presently work as street vendors. On the other hand, they seem very excited about the loan granted by VFMéxico because they can use it to invest in both of their businesses. The improvements that they have achieved through their occupations are an incentive to continue along the same path they have followed until now. Their achievements include remodelling and furnishing their home.

The other members of the group are Amelia, Teresa, Manuel, and Antonio, all of whom will invest in costume jewellery items; Josefina, in products for harvesting; Victoria, in dishes; and Eduardo, in glasses.

*The photograph was taken at Amelia's home. She is wearing a sweater and a blue T-shirt. Lupita is wearing a pair of pink pants.

loans.use: to buy costume jewellery items such as earrings.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина милая, добрая, отзывчивая девушка с прекрасным характером и чистой душой. Парвина мама двух сыновей, сыну Шерали 5 лет, Парвизу 3 года. Парвина унаследовала у своей тети талант швеи. Со временем она усовершенствовала свои навыки и сейчас она работает в ателье района Вахш где она живет. Парвина училась и работала столь время на этой швейной машинке (на фотографии). Она решила купить профессиональную машинку и долго копила денег, но к большому сожалению ее средств по не достаточно и Парвина нашла выход из этой ситуации. Она надеется получить кредит и решить свою проблему сразу. Парвина верит и надеется, на то что ее кредит одобрят и уже скоро она начнет шить уже на новой машинке.
texts.en: Parvina is a sweet, kind and sympathetic girl, beautiful in mind and soul. Parvina is the mother of two sons, her son Sherali is five years old, Parviz is three years old. Parvina inherited her aunt's talent as a seamstress. Overtime she has polished her skills and now she's working  for a dressmaking studio in the region off Vakhsh where she lives. The sewing machine you can see in the picture is the one Parvina has learned the trade with and has been working on for so long. She decided to buy a professional sewing machine, and has been saving money for a long time, but unfortunately her funds are not enough. Parvina found a way out, though. She hopes to receive the loan and solve the problem altogether. Parvina believes and hopes that her loan will be approved and she will start working using the new sewing machine very soon.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Rowel

texts.en: Rowel is married with three children and operates a motorcycle transportation business. His wife works in their household while Rowel operates a transportation business to make a living. He has been running the transportation business for many years. Rowel is happy to say that this income helps his family a lot. He borrowed from GDMPC to buy new tires to replace the ones on his motorcycle and some of the proceeds will help him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he wants to have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in demand. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana es una mujer trabajadora, ella se sigue dedicando a la venta de productos artesanales, su deseo es seguir expandiendo su pequeño negocio por eso ella trabaja todo el día por conseguir lo que anhela.
la socia necesita para comprar guantes y chullos. ella esta muy contenta y agradecida con los prestamistas ,y se compromete a pagar puntualmente.
texts.en:
Giovana is a hardworking woman.  She continues working by selling artisan goods.  Her wish is to continue expanding her small business; therefore, she works all day to get want she desires.

Giovana is requesting a loan to buy gloves and chullos (traditional Peruvian hats).  She is very happy and grateful with the loans, and she promises to repay them punctually.

loans.use: To buy gloves and chullos (traditional Peruvian hats).

loans.name: Liền

texts.en:
Mrs. Liền is 62 years old and she is married with four children. She has been working in agriculture raising marine aquaculture for more than 10 years. Liền lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.
.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Liền's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

In the future, Liền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be happy and healthy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense viven personas muy alegres y trabajadoras quienes se sienten orgullosas de sus raíces en la cultura mazahua. Muchos aún conservan algunas de sus tradiciones y fiestas típicas como el 29 de septiembre cuando celebran al santo de la comunidad. Dicha celebración dura 3 días aproximadamente, realizan danzas tradicionales, tocan música con mariachi, se hacen quemas de fuegos artificiales, etc.; en el último día se hacen carreras de caballos. Cabe mencionar que la comunidad cuenta con patrocinios como es el caso los hijos de Juana y María, miembros del grupo Nueva Generación.
   Doña María Concepción S. es una persona muy alegre, y comprometida con su familia, de igual modo es muy respetada por los habitantes de su comunidad quienes de cariño le dicen Tía Concha. Desde hace 31 años vive casada con el señor Enrique y juntos han formado una familia integrada por 9 hijos de los cuales sólo una joven se encuentra estudiando la carrera de ingeniería civil. 
   Tía Concha ha mantenido su relación con VFMéxico desde hace más de 15 años, con su primer apoyo inició la cría de ovejas, misma que mantuvo por 10 años. “Con mis animalitos pude ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de los niños” comentó contenta. Posteriormente las ganancias le permitieron abrir una tienda de abarrotes dentro de su hogar. Al inicio no fue sencillo establecer el negocio debido a diversos factores, sin embargo gracias a su dedicación logró vencer cada obstáculo y ahora goza de una clientela segura. "Estoy contenta, ahora puedo mantenerme con mi negocio, también mis hijos son independientes y mi hija Mariana puede continuar estudiando"  mencionó entusiasmada. 
   Este nuevo préstamo lo utilizara para adquirir leche, pan, huevo, productos enlatados, refrescos, etc. Su mayor anhelo es que su hija pueda terminar su carrera profesional a diferencia de sus demás hijos quienes no lograron continuar por falta de ingresos.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son María de la Luz, Juana, María Concepción M., María y Delfina quienes invertirán en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del centro municipal, Tía Concha es quien viste un traje típico de la región de color verde.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community live very happy and hardworking people who are proud of their roots in the Mazahua culture. Many still maintain some of their traditions and traditional celebrations such as September 29th when they celebrate the community saint. This celebration lasts approximately three days. They carry out traditional dances, play music with mariachi, do fireworks, etc. On the last day they have horse races. It is worth mentioning that the community has financial support, as is the case for Juana and María, members of the Nueva Generación [New Generation] group.

Doña María Concepción S. is a very happy person and committed to her family. By the same token, she is very respected by the residents of her community who out of affection call her Tía Concha. For 31 years she has lived married to señor Enrique and together they have formed an integrated family with nine children of which only one is studying toward a civil engineering degree.

Tía Concha has maintained her relationship with VFMéxico for over 15 years. With her first loan she started raising sheep, which she maintained for ten years. "With my animals I was able to help my husband with the children's expenses," she commented happily. Later the earnings allowed her to open a new grocery store inside her home. In the beginning it was not easy to establish the business due to various factors, however thanks to her dedication she was able to tackle every obstacle and now she enjoys a stable customer base. "I am happy. Now I can support myself with my business, also my children are independent and my daughter Mariana can continue studying," she mentioned enthusiastically.

She will use this new loan to acquire milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc. Her greatest wish is that her daughter finishes her professional degree unlike her other children who were not able to continue due to lack of income.

The other members of the group are María de la Luz, Juana, María Concepción M., María, and Delfina who will invest in sheep.

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the town center. Tía Concha is wearing a green dress that is a traditional dress of the region.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, canned goods, beverages, etc.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Independencia Group

texts.es:
En México, la división entre dos de sus estados es tan sólo por una calle; por lo tanto, cuando se les pregunta a los habitantes cuál es su identidad contestan que son oaxa-jarochos por tener culturas de ambos estados y fusionarlas peculiarmente. Sin embargo, lo que une a la zona es el cultivo de la caña de azúcar ya que ocupa el primer lugar en fuentes de empleo tanto en el campo como en los ingenios (fábricas azucareras) donde, tras una serie de procesos, finalmente se obtiene el  azúcar.
   En dicha región se integró un grupo llamado Independencia haciendo alusión a la manera en que los integrantes desean llevar a cabo su actividad económica. Ellos son: Laura quien vende agua embotellada, cosméticos y bisutería; Teresa, postres, bisutería y bolsas; Juana, ropa y bolsas por catálogo; Rogelio y Ana, comida; Bertoldo, plantas de ornato y Francisco quien tiene un negocio de carpintería. 
   Francisco es mejor conocido por sus amistades y familiares como “chico”; es un joven quien recientemente se convirtió en padre de una pequeña. Desde hace 11 años se dedica al oficio que aprendió de su padre: la carpintería, “lo que siempre recordare es que, por las tardes, después de ir a la escuela, almorzaba, me cambiaba de ropa y acudía a la carpintería con mis libros, mi padre me ayudaba hacer la tarea y al terminar me ensañaba a trabajar” expresa con alegría. Para ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia, decidió incluir a sus hermanos en la actividad ya que quiere hacer de ésta un negocio familiar aunque no descarta que en un futuro todos tengan negocios independientes.
   Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido incrementar su inversión pues compra madera, barniz, brochas, clavos, lijas, discos de corte, martillo, cortadora, etc.  El préstamo actual lo invertirá en la compra de  madera, clavos, tornillos, pegamento, lijas, brocas y un taladro para ampliar la carpintería.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque de la comunidad, chico es quien viste playera negra.
texts.en:
In Mexico, the division between two of its states is only a street; therefore, if you ask one of the inhabitants what their identify is, they answer that they are Oaxa-Jarachos because they have the cultures of both states and they are fussed peculiarly.  But nevertheless, what unites the area is the cultivation of sugar cane as it is the primary source of employment, as much as in the fields as in the sugar factories where, through a series of processes, one can finally get the sugar.

In this region, a group formed that was named "Independencia," making an allusion to the way in which the members want to carry out their jobs.  They are Laura who sells bottled water, cosmetics, and costume jewelry; Teresa with desserts, costume jewelry, and purses; Juana with clothing and purses through catalog; Rogelio and Ana with food; Bertoldo with ornamental plants; and Francisco who has a carpentry business.

Francisco is best know among his friends and family as "Chico."  He is a young man who recently became a father to a little daughter.  For the past 11 years he has worked in the business that he learned from his family: carpentry.  "What I will always remember is that, in the afternoons, after going to school, I ate lunch, and I changed my clothing, and I would go to the carpentry shop with my books.  My father would help me to do my homework, and after finishing it, he would teach me the job," he expresses happily.

To offer his family a better quality of life, he decided to include his brothers in this job since he wants to make this a family business but he does not exclude that in the future they could all have independent businesses.  The earnings that he has made has allowed him to increase his investments as he buys wood, paint, brushes, nails, sandpaper, circular blades, hammers, table saw; etc.

Now he is requesting a loan to invest in buying wood, nails, screws, glue, sandpaper, drill bits, and a drill to increase his carpentry shop.

The photograph was taken in a community park.  "Chico" is the one dressed in the black T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, screws, glue, sandpaper, drill bits, and a drill.

loans.name: Ana Milena

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de campo y madre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría y materiales para la construcción de su cochera.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajará todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Ana is a woman of the country and is the mother of two children for whom she has been through many hardships in her life. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.

She has been wanting to start a business raising and selling pigs for some time. This is why she is requesting financial support to buy some pigs to breed and materials to build her garage. With this new business she will be able to generate income for her family, who are everything to her, and be able to improve the quality of life for her husband and children. She will work every day to boost her business and make it sustainable and profitable. Support a hardworking woman with a loan.

loans.use: to buy some pigs to breed and materials to build her garage.

loans.name: Milagros Concepcion

texts.es:
Milagros se sigue dedicando a la compra y venta de ropa, ella comienza muy temprano su labor. la socia sustenta su hogar con esta actividad , su deseo es seguir ampliando su negocio y tener un local donde pueda expenderlos de mejor forma. ella necesita el préstamo para comprar casacas y pantalones,que son productos de temporada.
Milagros esta contenta y satisfecha con los inversionista de KIVA y les agradece que sigan confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Milagros is still buying and selling clothing. She starts her work early and supports her family with this work. She wants to keep expanding her business and have a stall where she can better sell her clothing.

She needs a loan to buy coats and pants which are seasonal items. Milagros is happy and satisfied with the Kiva lenders and thanks them for continuing to have faith in her.

loans.use: to buy coats and pants.

loans.name: Kulkaiyr

texts.ru: Кулкайыр, 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, закончила мед училище, с 1989 года работает фельдшером. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кулкайыр, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 29 овец, 4 лошади, на участке мерою 2,12 Га собственной и 3,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает люцерну, ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Кулкайыр обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулкайыр планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и строительство жилого дома.
texts.en: Kulkaiyr  47 years old, married, and mother of three. She has completed secondary education, graduated from a medical college, since 1989 she has been working as a  medical assistant. To provide an additional income for her family, she breeds livestock and cultivates plants. Thanks to her hard work, she now owns 5 cows, 29 sheep, and 4 horses on the landlot of 2.12 ha that she owns and 3.0 that she rents. She cultivates lucerne and barley for sale. Her monthly income is 27,000 som (KGS). To further develop the business, Kulkaiyr turned to Bai Tushum Bank  for a loan off 150,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the herd.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Nancy Esther

texts.es:
Ella es Nancy es una mujer soltera de 54 años, una persona valiente, inteligente, trabajadora, una mujer que se ha valido de ella misma para generar los recursos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su hogar, es madre cabeza de familia, tiene 3 hijos, Nancy tuvo el suficiente valor para realizar el rol de padre y madre y se enorgullece de su labor, puesto que a sus familia nunca le ha faltado nada.
Nancy actualmente se dedica a vender productos de uso personal, una labor que desempeña hace poco tiempo, pues es un oficio más tranquilo y de menso esfuerzo físico
Nancy se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar un surtido variado de productos de uso personal, accesorios, ropa y pijamas que tiene encargado, su principal objetivo es posicionarse en el sector y ofrecer a sus clientes comodidades de pago.
Su sueño es poder trabajar por un largo tiempo, que no le falte nada y seguir realizando adecuaciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Nancy is a single woman who is 54 years old. She is a brave, intelligent, and hardworking woman. A woman who has relied on herself to generate the necessary income to maintain her home. She is the head of household and has three children. Nancy had the courage to perform the roles of father and mother and is proud of her work since her family has never lacked anything.

Nancy currently sells personal care products, work that she has done for a short amount of time since it is quieter and requires less physical effort. Nancy is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of personal care products, accessories, clothing, and pajamas which she has orders for. Her main goal is to establish herself in this industry and offer her customers payment options. Her dreams are to be able to work for a long time, that she doesn't lack anything, and that she can keep making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of personal care products, cosmetics, accessories, clothing, and pajamas.

loans.name: Sultonhuja

texts.ru: Султонхуча отец четверых детей. У него один 4 летный сын, и 17, 14 и 7 летные дочки. Его жена занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. Она продает сухофрукты. Сам Султонхуча занимается мастером по ремонту домов. 15 лет назад он начал свою работу. Ему научил его отец. Султонхуча ответственный и честно зарабатывающий человек. Он из города Исфара. Султонхуча обратился к Вам с небольшой просьбой, он просить денег на операция маленького сына. Сыночек болеет  и ему надо сделать операцию, без операцию ни как невозможно вылечить. Султонхуча будет очень рад на Вашу искреннюю поддержку. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Sultonhuja is a father of four. He has a four-year-old son, and three daughters of 17, 14 and 7 years old. His the wife is selling dry fruit  at the local market.  Sultonhuja himself makes a living by renovating houses. 15 years ago he started doing this work. His father taught him everything he knows. Sultonhuja Is  an honest and responsible man. He is from the town of Isfara.  Sultonhuja turned to you with a small request, he is asking for money to pay for his young son's surgery. His son is sick and he needs the surgery without which he cannot recover. Sultonhuja will be very glad if you can help him. He's grateful in advance.

loans.use: to pay for his son's surgery.

loans.name: Johny Ivan

texts.es:
Johny, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, niña y niño de edades de 4 y un años, toda la familia depende económicamente de él; Johny se dedica a la  reparación y activación de celulares, actividad que aprendió en la Universidad donde estudio Ingeniería en Sistemas Informáticos, su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. todos los días.
Con el crédito pretende realizar el incremento de su inventario con la compra de accesorios y repuestos para celulares, la inversión le permitirá ofrecer nuevos productos a sus clientes, además de tener los repuestos que demandan sus clientes, espera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Johny cuenta con muchos sueños pero uno de ellos es  lograr obtener buen record crediticio para poder aumentar la capacidad de su negocio y de esa manera lograr una buena estabilidad económica para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Johny is in a relationship and has two children, a girl and a boy who are four and one years old. The whole family is financially dependent on him. Johny repairs and activates cellphones, work he learned at the university where he studied information systems engineering. His working hours are 8am to 4pm every day.

With this loan he hopes to increase his inventory by buying accessories and spare parts for cellphones. This investment will allow him to offer his customers new products in addition to having the spare parts his customers demand. He hopes to have more income to provide his family a better quality of life. Johny has many dreams but one is to be able to obtain good credit so that he can increase the capacity of his business and thus achieve good economic stability for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy accessories and spare parts for cellphones.

loans.name: Manguiline Santhiaba Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux femmes très dynamique qui exercent le commerce, elles ont toujours remboursé leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Adja Oumou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est veuve, âgée de 62 ans et mère de six enfants dont quatre filles.
