Elle s'active depuis plusieurs années dans la vente de l'huile de palme, du citron et des balais. Femme exemplaire au niveau du banc villageois. Les bénéfices vont servir à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group is made of two women who are very dynamic. They are trained in the business field, and have always fully repaid their loans. Ms. Adja Oumou, who is standing at the right of the photo raising her hand is the group representative. She is a widow, 62 years old, and the mother of six children, four of which are girls. 

She has been in the business of making palm leaf oil, lemons, and brooms for several years now. She is an exemplary woman at the banc villageois. The earnings that she makes will be used to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy palm leaf oil, lemons, and and broom.

loans.name: Mehrubonu

texts.ru: Это красавица Мехрубону. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и двоих детей. Детям 21 и 19 лет. Младший сын учится в университете. Мехрубону училась только в средней школе, и у нее есть талант. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. У нее 16 летный опыт работы.  В течение 16 лет Мехрубону освоила много нужные и интереснее вещей своей работе. Сын Мехрубону учится в городе Душанбе, и он проживает в общежитие. Мехрубону просит кредит на годового оплаты общежитие и для купли швейные принадлежности для своей работы. С такими планами Мехрубону обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This beautiful woman is Mehrobunu.  She's 40 years old, married, and mother of two,. Her kids are 21 and 19 years old. Her younger son is going to university. Mehrobunu has only completed secondary school, but she has a talent. She makes her living as a dressmaker.  She has work experience of 16 years, during which Mehrobunu has acquired a lot of necessary and interesting skills. Her son is studying in the city of Dushanbe, he lives in the dormitory. Mehrobunu requested a loan to pay her son's annual dormitory fees and to buy sewing machine accessories for her work. This is why she requested the loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's annual dormitory fees and to buy sewing accessories

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 37 años de edad, una persona que vive en la zona de Sincelejo, vive en un humilde hogar en unión libre con su pareja y sus 3 hijos las mujeres de 20 y 8 años de edad.
Martha es muy responsable, inicio a vender mercancía por necesidad económica, gracias a la venta de recipientes los cuales son muy comunes en las zonas costeras donde hay zonas donde no hay agua potable y poco a poco ha sorteado sus dificultades monetarias.
Ahora para seguir con su ascenso empresarial, para trabajar con compromiso y constancia la señora Martha quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido en cantidad de recipientes.
Sus principales sueños es pagar la educación de sus muchachos y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is a 37 year old woman who lives in the Sincelejo zone. She lives in a humble home in a common law marriage with her partner and their 3 children, girls ages 20 and 8.

Martha is very responsible. She started to sell merchandise from economic need, and thanks to the sale of containers (which are very common in the coastal zones where there are areas where there is not potable water) little by little, she has avoided her fiscal difficulties.

Now to continue with her business promotion, to work with commitment and persistence, Martha wants to ask for a loan to buy an assortment of containers.

Her principal dreams are to pay for her children's education and improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of plastic containers of different sizes.

loans.name: Sairakul

texts.ru: Сайракул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Сайракул на данный момент имеется 5 коров, 25 овец и 2 лошади. Также на участке 2,60 Га она выращивает клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сайракул вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она будет вкладывать в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы накопить на образование внуков.
texts.en: Sairakul has successfully repaid her previous loan having used it for its designated purpose. She's grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped raise funds. Sairakul currently owns 5 cows, 25 sheep, and two horses. On the land lot of 2.6 Ha she cultivates clover for resale and household consumption. To further develop her business, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank again for loan off 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale. She will invest the borrowed money to further expand her business and make savings for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Lucy Clareth

texts.es:
Lucy es una artesa de 24 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia de dos niños de 2 y 4 años, se dedica a elaborar hamacas, actividad con la que busca complementar los recursos para la alimentación de sus muchachos, puesto que recibe mucho apoyo de sus padres.
El propósito de Lucy es trabajar con empeño y dedicación, pues busca pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Lucy a pesar de su juventud, de tener dos hijos, de no haber podido educarse como ella quería, demostró gran carácter, personalidad y responsabilidad, trabajando para alimentar a sus seres amados.
Lucy quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de hamacas, dichos insumos le permitirá aumentar su producción, mejorando sus ventas, formalizar su negocio y tener sostenibilidad.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 24 year old artisan, mother, and head of the household for two children ages 2 and 4. She works manufacturing hammocks, a job with which she seeks to supplement her resources to feed her children, given that she receives a lot of support from her parents.

Lucy's intention is to work with determination and dedication, since she is looking to pay for her children's education to improve their living conditions.

Lucy, in spite of her youth, of having two children, and of not being able to educate herself like she wanted, demonstrated great character, personality, and responsibility. She is working to feed her loved ones.

Lucy wants to ask for a loan to buy raw materials for the production of hammocks. These supplies will allow her to increase her production, improve her sales, formalize her business, and have sustainability.

loans.use: to buy materials for the production of hammocks.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans résidante à Agoè. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Akouavi est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Akouavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire cinq fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akouavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a married woman aged 38 living in Agoe. Having three children to take care of, Akouavi sells food products which she resells in her at-home store. Akouavi gets her necessary supply of products five times per month at the market and is requesting this loan in order to buy bags of rice. 

With the significant amount of income that will result from this loan, Akouavi will be able to increase the amount of sales and help support her family as well as a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy eight bags of rice.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.fr: Mariée et sans enfant, Rebecca est une femme âgée de 36 ans habitant à Agoè. Rebecca est une revendeuse des pagnes qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour ce fait, Rebecca sollicite ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagne en vue de bien revendre et de gagner une marge bénéficiaire qui servira à venir en aide à son mari pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Rebecca is a 36-year-hold woman who is married and doesn't have any children. She currently lives in Agoe. Rebecca sells pagnes [traditional West African fabric] of which she buys her supply four times per month from the local market and resells it during her travels to the market to the nearby neighborhoods. 

For this reason, Rebecca is requesting this loan in order to buy pieces of pagne in order to resell them and earn significantly more income. This will enable her to help her husband support the daily household family responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy six pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Rigoberto Ramiro

texts.es: Rigoberto tiene 42 años vive en unión libre su conviviente  realiza  quehaceres del hogar, cuida  de sus tres hijos Jefferson de 18, Jurany de 16 están estudiando en unidades educativas del sector, Ángela de 3 años permanece junto a su madre, Rigoberto arregla bicicletas este pequeño negocio inicio hace más de 23 años el necesita el dinero para comprar repuestos, maquinaria facilitando su trabajo aumentado sus servicios obteniendo dinero para alimentar, educar, y pagar el lugar donde vive con su familia su mayor anhelo es construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 42-years-old, lives with a partner, and does domestic chores. He cares for his three children. Jefferson, 18, and Jurany, 16, are studying education. Ángela, 3 years-old, lives with her mother.

Rigoberto fixes bicycles. This small business began more than 23 years ago. He needs money in order to purchase spare parts, and machinery to facilitate his work and increase his services, in order to obtain money to feed, educate, and house his family.

His greatest desire is to build his own home.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and machinery to fix bicycles.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée et  âgée de 29 ans, Akouvi est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec deux enfants à charge. Akouvi est une revendeuse des oignons, gingembres et autres qui s’approvisionnent cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend ainsi là. Vue les besoins de sa clientèle, Akouvi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs d’oignons et des cartons de tomates en vue de satisfaire aux demandes de ses clients et gagner plus de profit suite à une bonne vente; ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux épargner afin d’aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer puis soutenir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and 29 years old, Akouvi is a woman who lives in Agoe with two children to take care of. Akouvi sells onions, ginger, and other foods. She buys her supply five times per month at the market and resells it there. Looking to meet the needs of her customers, Akouvi is requesting her loan in order to request bags of onions and boxes of tomatoes. 

She hopes to satisfy the demands of her customers and earn more income from the increased sales. This will help better save up in order to help her husband with the household expenses which will be used to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two bags of onions and eight boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Cảnh

texts.en:
Mrs Cảnh is 48 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for 10 years.

Cảnh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2014, Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Cảnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Cảnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Miladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miladis es una mujer de 30 años de edad, una mujer que con su negocio de venta de quesos, ella día a día trata de posicionar sus productos, ella se encarga de elaborarlos, de salir a venderlos, una mujer que pone todo su empeño para enamorar a sus  clientes con sus productos.
Ella tiene una hija de 4 años, pagar la educación de su princesa y comprar una vivienda, es el sueño que ha tenido toda la vida, pero para ello abrir su local, ser sostenible en el tiempo y producir mayor cantidad, pero la falta de capital ha sido su principal impedimento, es por este motivo que quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de inventario de quesos.
Miladis debe realizar largos desplazamientos para vender sus productos, ella no le importa el esfuerzo, es una mujer comprometida con su futuro y el de su hija.
texts.en:
Miladis is a 30 year old woman who, with her business selling cheeses, day by day tries to promote her products. She orders their production and goes out to sell them. She is a woman who puts in all of her determination to win her clients' hearts with her products.

She has a 4 year old daughter. To pay for her princess's education and to buy a home is the dream that she has had for all of her life, but to do it by opening a shop, to be sustainable in the time and to produce a greater quantity. The lack of money has been her principal obstacle. It is for this reason that she wants to seek a loan to buy an inventory of cheeses.

She must make long journeys to sell her products, but she doesn't mind the sacrifice--she is a woman committed to her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of cheese to manufacture her products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 53 years old and married with two children. She earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while her husband works on the farm. She has been doing this for many years and she earns well and improves the business. Her earnings go toward the daily family expenditures. To have more stock to offer while waiting for the cropping, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery goods for her retail store in order to raise more profits. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing a better education to her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Kenny Efrain

texts.es: Kenny es un socio emprendedor y trabajador.el se sigue dedicando a su negocio de artesanía donde vende muchas prendas típicas del Cusco . desde hace ya 8 años el sigue dando todo de si para cumplir su deseo de seguir ampliando su negocio. el socio necesita el préstamo para comparar ponchos y chullos. el esta muy contento con el préstamo que se le otorgo y cumplira con los plazos acordados para pagar sus cuotas.
texts.en: Kenny is an entrepreneurial and hardworking man. He continues running his artisan business, through which he sells many outfits which are traditional to the area. For the past 8 years he has done his best to fulfill his dream of steadily growing his business. He needs this loan to purchase ponchos and knit caps. He is very pleased with the loan he received and will comply with the agreed-upon terms of repayment.

loans.use: to purchase ponchos and caps.

loans.name: Alba Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 34 años  de edad es madre soltera de dos hijas Mishel de 9 y Antonella de 7 años de edad ellas están estudiando en escuelas públicas,  inicio hace tres años la idea de vender correas después de ser empleada mal remunerada por mucho tiempo, la ventaja más grande de su pequeño negocio es que cuando sus hijas terminan la jornada educativa ellas pueden estar juntas, Catalina necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería aumentaría sus ventas e ingresos y podría seguir pagando la alimentación, educación , el lugar donde viven  con sus niñas a futuro desea tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old. She is the single mother of two children, Mishel who is 9 and Antonella who is 7. They are both attending public schools. 
Three years ago, after being a very underpaid worker for many years, Catalina had the idea to begin selling belts. The greatest advantage of her small business is that, when her daughters finish their schoolday, they can all be together.
Catalina needs the money to purchase merchandise to increase her sales and income. This way she will be able to continue paying for the food, education and housing for her daughters. In the future she hopes to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase belts.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, chips, noodles, etc.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from selling fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, chips, and noodles

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is a single parent of his five children. To support and provide the needs of his children, he owns a farm planting and harvesting crops just to earn a living. He wants to expand his business in order to support his kids by sending them to school. He joined and gained access from GDMPC, and recently, he took a loan to buy fertilizer as inputs for his crops.

Rodolfo's plan for the future is to save more money and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Mrs Quy is 34 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for five years.

Quy lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. In 2014, Quy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Quy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In the future, Quy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is so encouraged that she accessed loans in the past and has not once failed to pay on time. They have certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in her daily sustenance.

She is again humbly asking for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice and noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the last 10 years, which sustained her family's basic needs.

Gloria's simple dream is for her store to grow. She prays that God will bless them abundantly. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to resell at her store.

loans.name: Sâm

texts.en:
Mrs Sâm is 54 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Sâm lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Sâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FE Y ALEGRIA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Benita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cinturones, venta de frutas, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de comida, venta de artículos de higiene, venta de ropa, venta de mantas, venta de salchipapa, venta de carne de res.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Benita es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, y con el poco ahorro con el que contaba decidió emprender este negocio hace más de ocho años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el ahorro que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece la señora Daniela ya que después del desembolso tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The communal bank "FE Y ALEGRIA" will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Alto Lima Center. It is composed of eleven members and is managed by a board of directors on which Benita is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied--among them are: the selling of belts, the selling of fruits, the selling of sport clothing, the selling of food, the selling of hygiene products, the selling of clothes, the selling of blankets, the selling of fried potatoes, and the selling of beef.

The loan that they take out will benefit small microbusiness owners, of which Benita is a member. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months and joined through a promotional invitation conducted by the institution. She currently sells blankets, which is a business she learned from her mother. She started the business over eight years ago with a few savings she had.

The loan she will take out will be to increase her capital and buy blankets wholesale from dealers in the city of El Alto. Later she will sell them at her stall. Through her work she is able to generate resources to support her family economically. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the training and savings offered by the institution.

Missing from the photo is Daniela who had to go back to work after making payment.

loans.use: to buy blankets wholesale.

loans.name: Las De Mercurio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DE MERCURIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de frutas, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de mantas, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Agustina es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un pequeño capital que tenía hace quince años, aprendiendo el mismo de su mama. En la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su hija.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de frutas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros, la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS DE MERCURIO" will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Focal Center. The group is comprised of eight members and directed by a management board of which Agustina is secretary. The members of the group are involved in different businesses including sales of skirts, fruits, jackets, food, blankets and cosmetics.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners including Agustina. She says she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution. Her current business is selling fruits. She started the business with a small amount of capital 15 years ago and learned the trade from her mother. Now she has the help of her daughter in the business.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy fruits wholesale from dealers in the city of La Paz. Later she will sell them at her stall. Through her work she has been able to generate the resources to support her family economically. She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that it is the savings, training and health area offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: la socia Karina continua dedicándose al negocio de los helados, quiere seguir luchando por sus sueños y ampliara su negocio de los helados. ella desea el préstamo para comprar frutas , leche y conservantes. ella es trabajadora y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
Karina continues with her ice cream business and wants to expand it in her struggle to make her dreams come true.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruits, milk and preservatives. She is a hard worker and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fruits, milk and preservatives.

loans.name: Porvenir De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR DE ALTO LIMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artefactos, venta de mantas, venta de carne, venta de frutas, venta de repuestos de movilidad, librería, venta de ropa, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amelia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía y con un poco capital con el que contaba decidió emprender su propio negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapato por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "PORVENIR DE ALTO LIMA" will start its first cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Focal Center. The group is comprised of eight members and is directed by a management board whose president is Amelia. The members are involved in different businesses including sale of artifacts, blankets, meat, fruits, spare parts, books, clothing and shoes.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners including Amelia. She says she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution. Her current business is selling shoes which she learned about from her aunt. With a little bit of capital she decided to start her own business.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy shoes wholesale from dealers in the city of La Paz. Later she will sell them at her stall. Through her work she has been able to generate the resources to support her family economically. She is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says it is the health area and training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
Willian es un socio que pertenece al banco "QORY CHASKA CUSCO"y sigue dedicándose a vender ropa, con el fin de seguir su suseños que es ampliar mas su negocio de ropa, donde pueda ofrecer mas alternativas a sus clientes .
el socio Willian necesita el préstamo para comprar casacas, chompas y pantalones que son productos de temporada.
el socio esta comprometido con seguir adelante y pagas puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
William is a member of the communal bank "QORY CHASKA CUSCO" and he continues to sell clothing. In order to realize his dream of expanding his business to offer more variety to customers, William needs a loan to buy jackets, sweaters and pants for the season.

He is committed to getting ahead and paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is thankful to KIVA and its supporters, and to CCT, for their tireless support for small business people like her. The loans which were previously granted to her were a great help to grow and sustain her ornamental and landscape gardening business. She trusts that you will continue to help her livelihood as she still has one child going to school.

Aurelia trusts that out of your good heart she will again be able to take out a 19,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan to buy garden soil, seedlings, pots, nets and wire to grow a variety of ornamental plants. She puts her whole heart into nurturing and nourishing her plants as this is her source of income to feed and send her child to school.

Aurelia aims to attract more customers to do landscaping. She prays for the good health of her family. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship co-members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy is 33 years old and married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thúy's family is a low-income household in her village and moreover, the market need is low in this region. Thus, the income from her business is not high enough for her to do what she really needs to have a comfortable life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a resourceful, loving mum at heart. Her motherly love drives her to work hard to help her child grow up with excellent values and a good education. At age 23, she is a small-holder farmer in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Over the past ten years, she has bred dairy cows and sheep and has developed her farm. She has also planted and sold a variety of crops. Evaline says the secret to her success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life. Adopting new technologies and methods, plus crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help.

Evaline was unable to study to find a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practising farming successfully. Due to how much she likes her work, she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows.

With her dairy cow, Evaline is able to obtain between five and ten litres of milk a day and this helps her support her family. She also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor supplies. Thus, she is seeking a loan to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Evaline is a visionary and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production so she produces more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. She believes that through this loan, she will turn her family's life around and be able to give her child a solid education. This loan will be Evaline’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lisber  Janeth

texts.es: Lisber tiene cuarenta y cinco años, de estado civil casada su esposo es guardia de seguridad tiene 2 hijos Andrés de 18 años y Carla de 8 están estudiando en instituciones educativas gratuitas  del sector, hace 24 años empezó a vender en las calles todo tipo de ropa, fue muy complicado a veces le robaban, no le `pagaban, esto hizo que tratara de buscar un pequeño local para poder vender. Lisber requiere el dinero para comprar un mostrador y mercadería generaría mayores ingresos para poder ayudar a  su esposo con los gastos del  hogar ella aspira poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lisber is 45 years old and her civil status is married. Her husband is a security guard and she has 2 children, Andrés, who is 18 years old and Carla, who is 8 years old. They are studying at local educational institutions offering free education.

She started selling all sorts of clothing items 24 years ago. That was very complicated; sometimes she was stolen, they did not pay her, and that was the reason to try to look for a small premise to be able to sell.

Limber needs the money to buy a shop counter and goods. She would earn a higher income to help her husband with the household expenses. She aims to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a shop counter and clothing products.

loans.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es:
Ana, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años de edad, no recibe ayuda económica de otros familiares, es decir que es ella el único proveedor para su pequeño, Ana es propietaria de una tienda con la cual obtiene los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar, ella realiza sus labores de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. 
Solicita un crédito para incrementar su negocio, invertirá en golosinas, sodas, huevos, granos básicos y pan; con ello pretende aumentar la competitividad de su negocio y  atraer nuevos clientes. 
Ella sueña con mejorar su negocio, obtener mejores ganancias y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother of one three-year-old child. She does not receive financial aid from other relatives and is the only source of support for her small child. Ana owns a shop from which her earnings are used to feed her family. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

She is asking for a loan to expand her business. She will invest the money in sweets, soft drinks, eggs, basic grains and bread. She intends to use these to make her business more competitive and attract new customers.

She dreams of improving her business, earning a better income and providing her child with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, eggs, basic grains and bread. She intends to use these to make her business more competitive.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio Rafael continua ejerciendo sus labor como policía, y sigue con su pequeña empresa de servicios de seguridad. Con estas dos actividades está logrando sacar adelante a su familia en esta oportunidad el socio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una laptop.
El socio se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está muy agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The member Rafael is a serving police officer and is also still running his small security services business. Through these two activities he is managing to help his family to get by and progress. On this occasion the member is asking for a loan to buy a laptop.

The member is committed to making his repayments on time and is very grateful to KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Vania Yamil

texts.es:
Vania es una mujer de 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 1 año, y su negocio es el restaurante.
Ella es buena madre, generosa y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizado por el comercio informal, la manufactura y por la cantidad de personas que frecuentan esta área.
Vania es morena de ojos pardos y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran ene edad escolar, viven en la casa propiedad de la familia que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; ‘plato paceño’ que lleva choclo, un puñado de habas, queso retostado, un asado de carne y la tradicional llájua (locoto molido con tomate), “cocino comida que se puede comer fría o caliente, porque mis clientes mayormente compran para llevar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos, la desventaja es transportar la comida a lugares lejanos. Su sueño es vender comida sólo por contrato, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como, carne, choclo, habas, papa, chuño y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Vania solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para preparar comida para llevar.
texts.en:
Vania is 24 years old, is single, and has a 5 year old son and a 1 year old daughter. She has a restaurant business.

She is a good mother, is generous and is very optimistic. Her business is located in the '16 de julio' area which is known for its informal trade, manufacturing and for the amount of people who go to this area.

Vania is dark-skinned with brown eyes and is thin. Her native language is Aymara, this is what she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for business. She shares her life with her children who are not yet of school age. They live in their family home which has drinking water, electricity, gas and a sewage system. Her business is in selling food like 'plato paceño', a typical dish from La Paz, it includes corn on the cob, a handful of broad beans, burned cheese, roasted meat and the traditional 'llájua' (ground peppers with tomato), “I cook food that can be eaten cold or hot because my customers mainly buy it to go...” she says. The advantage of her business is that it has many orders, the disadvantage is that it is necessary to deliver the food to far away places. Her dream is to sell food only by contracts, she hopes to buy cooking supplies such as meat, corn on the cob, broad beans, potatoes, freeze-dried potato and other things. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Vania is asking for a loan to buy cooking supplies to make take-away food.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to make take-away food.

loans.name: Junet

texts.en:
Junet is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, eggs, milk and canned goods.

Junet industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling fish. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Rosmira

texts.es:
Con su sonrisa y gran corazón, Maria ha tenido una gran acogida en su barrio desde que abrió su negocio hace 5 años con gran esfuerzo y con un deseo en su mente, el de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una carpa y para mejorar su sitio de trabajo.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar cocinando y preparando las delicias que con sus manos trabajadoras ha venido ofreciendo y sirviendo.

Su principal dificultad es el Alto costo de los insumos.
Apoya a Maria con su negocio y has que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo!
texts.en:
With her smile and big heart, Maria has had a warm welcome in her neighborhood since she opened her business five years ago, something she did with a lot of effort and a strong desire to get ahead and improve her family's living conditions.

She is requesting this loan to buy an awning and to improve her business location. With these things, she will be able to continue preparing and cooking the delicious food that she serves with her hardworking hands. Her main challenge is the high cost of supplies.

Support Maria in her business and help her have a better life: Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy an awning and to improve her business location.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has previously received a loan which has helped sustain her ornamental plant business. She is thankful for Kiva and its lenders for supporting small business owners like her. She trusts for your continuous help on her livelihood.

Once again she would like to request a loan of 25000 PHP to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamental plants. Lolita puts her whole heart and best efforts to grow and nurture her farm as this is her source of income to feed and send her children to school.

Lolita hopes to always have plenty of customers to live a good life. She prays that her grandchildren will always be healthy. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for pots, wires, net, fertilizer, and ornamental seedlings.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. Fifteen years ago, she started working in the rice paddies to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She grows and sells rice to the local dwellers in her area. Her oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 5.

Criselda is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers. In that way, she can improve her ongoing yield and her financial gain.

She hopes to expand her livelihood to continue supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn supplements her income with earnings from raising ducks. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angel Manuel

texts.es:
Ángel es un joven de 21 años de edad, creativo, dedicado, trabajador, constituyo un negocio de  venta de frutas y verduras en el municipio de Sincelejo, no tiene hijos, solo un propósito trabajar para mantener a sus padres que tanto hicieron por él.
Ángel es un joven con una convicción comprar un hogar y dársela a su madre. 
Trabaja todos los días, aproximadamente 6 horas diarias, que  siempre  busca mejorar en ventas, aumentar sus clientes, tener sostenibilidad.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras en grandes cantidades, también comprar madera para la elaboración de estantes para exhibir mayores productos.
Espera que con esta inversión las ventas en su negocio crezcan.
texts.en:
Ángel is a young 21 year old. He is creative, dedicated and hard working. He set up a business selling fruit and vegetables in the municipality of Sincelejo. He does not have any children, only an aim of working to look after his parents who have done so much for him.

Ángel is a young man with the conviction of buying a home and giving it to his mother.

He works every day, approximately 6 hours a day, he is always looking to increase sales, increase his number of customers and to have sustainability.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables in bulk and also to buy wood to make shelves to display more products.

He hopes that with this investment, the sales in his business will increase.

loans.use: to stock up on fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabela is 52 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living she has been engaged in a food vending business for 6 years. It is a successful business for the family because it helps them a lot in providing for their daily needs. Anabela has an average family income in providing for her children with the help of her husband as a carpenter, and Anabela would like to increase her income so that she can provide a good living for her children. She requested a loan to buy more ingredients for additional menu items to sell, so that she can have more sales and increase her income.

Anabela's plan for the future is to save money from her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients additional menu items to sell.

loans.name: Taman Sari Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed and Taman Sari group was able to pay off their last loan on time. In the journey of their business, they are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get satisfactory results. Because of these results, some of the members of the group earned enough money for saving. During this time, their activities were monitored by the Loan Officer for their achievements and to serve as an example for other farmers.

Gusti Ayu sold all of her piglets and earns enough profit after deductions of other costs. From the profit, she can fulfill her family's daily needs while also saving. She and all the members of the Taman Sari send their greetings to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the prices of feeds are high, the Taman Sari group requested a new loan. At the time of disbursement of funds, 2 members couldn’t attend the meeting because of sickness and attending a religious ceremony at the temple. Each member gets 2.000.000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

Gusti Ayu will use the loan to buy 3 superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not attacked by disease. When she already has enough savings to use as venture capital, she will be able to raise pigs with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una socia muy trabajadora y se sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de chicha. Ella se dedica muchos años a esta actividad tradicional y está logrando sacar adelante a su familia .Ella solicita el crédito para comprar maíz y leña.
La socia está contenta y agradece a los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard working member who continues to work in the business of selling chicha, a corn liquor. She has done this traditional work for many years and is managing to get her family ahead in life. She is asking for a loan to buy corn and firewood.

She is happy and grateful to the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a single mother of her child. She has been selling her goods for many years just to make a profit and she put up a small grocery store. Despite the small income, it brought daily income which is just what the family needed. The opportunity presented itself to request a loan for buying more goods, in order to have a higher sales and to boost her inventory stocks.

Shirley’s plan for her future is to save money to sustain their daily needs and for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Delsy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delsy es una persona con ganas de salir adelante, una persona que por falta de oportunidades no ha podido progresar con su negocio de venta de productos de uso personal, una mujer que por falta de oportunidades laborales optó por el camino del emprendimiento.
Ella es madre de dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad, quiere que sus hijos estudien, tengan las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener en su juventud, construir con sus manos un camino seguro para sus dos pequeños, por ello pide un favor, un impulso económico, un pequeño aliciente para comprar mercancía de productos de uso personal, quiere aumentar su inventario para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Delsy is a person with a desire to succeed, a person who for lack of opportunities has not been able to progress with her business of selling products for personal use, a woman who for lack of employment opportunities opted for the path of entrepreneurship.

She is a mother of two children aged 7 and 12. She wants her children to study, to have the opportunities that she couldn't have in her youth, to build with her hands a safe road for her two young ones. Therefore, she is asking for a favor, an economic boost, a little incentive to buy merchandise of personal use products. She wants to increase her inventory to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise of personal use products.

loans.name: Darem

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Darem hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells such goods as eggs, seasonings, edible oil, mosquito repellent, assorted canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks. Aside from running a store, she also operates a fishing boat. She has one young dependent. Her partner in life has an income that helps to support the needs of the entire family.

Darem decided to avail a loan to to buy a pump boat and assorted stocks for the store. With the presence of these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she could start to save and invest in any possible business opportunities to become successful.

In the future, Darem seeks ways on how to become more efficient in handling both of her sources of income to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a pump boat and assorted stock for the store

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Analie dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Ma. Luisa dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vellarina

texts.en:
Vellarina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vellarina is 67 years old now.

Vellarina has a buy and sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 40 years.

Vellarina requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

Vellarina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, a small village where the main source of livelihood is farming. She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer and the income earned from farming is not enough to provide for the needs of the family. So Analisa decided to help her husband to earn a living and she helps him to sell the coconuts that they harvested from their farm.

It has now been almost 20 years since the couple began their business of selling the copras (coconut fruits) and the charcoal from them. The trees need be maintained in order to bear more fruits and Analisa needs money to do this. She went to GDMPC for a loan. Analisa hopes for the sustainability of their business so that they can provide for the needs of their family and to continue sending their children to school.

loans.use: to maintain the trees for growing coconuts

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She owns and manages her farm planting and harvesting rice to sell to her local community members. She is working hard in order to earn a good profit and to be able to support the needs of her children and send them to school.

She wants to expand her business. She recently joined GDMPC, and used the loan to buy fertilizers, such as manure, for her rice farm. This helps her to produce a good quality of rice for the market. Marites expects an increase in the harvest so as to expand her farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Carosel

texts.en: Carosel is a single mother of her child. She is a farmer who cultivates her own land. Her goal is to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family. Carosel needs to pay for school fees and also cover her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer to produce good quality rice for the market. She is striving for a better life through farming and is grateful for this opportunity. Carosel hopes to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a 32-year-old single mother of two children. She is in the grocery business, selling goods to her local community members. She wants to give a more financially secure life to her children. She wants to expand her business in order to support the needs of her children by paying school fees and other household bills.

She is asking for financial assistance, and recently she took a loan to buy more grocery goods to boost her inventory stock and to have a greater income. Rosalita's plan for the future is to save more money to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is married, and a 57-years-old mother of two children. Marcelina used her previous loans for farm inputs and improvement. She is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve her family's living standards. She is able to cultivate the adjacent farm land and she needs money for fertilizer such as manure and plowing labor costs. She borrowed a loan recently and made her plan a reality. In the future she hopes to be able to expand her business and continue to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure and plowing labor costs

loans.name: Herbicillia

texts.en: Herbicillia is 52-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Over the past 20 years, Herbicillia was able to put up a retail store that absolutely met the market's primary demands in their village. Until now, the business is still doing well and is giving better cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Herbicillia joined GDMPC  to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. Herbicillia expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts in lending her funds several times in the past, which really helped sustain and grow her store. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 15,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of the income that sustained her family's basic needs and in sent her children to school.

She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to enable her store to prosper so that she will be able to buy a delivery truck. She also hopes that construction of their house will soon be completed.

Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Pimarie

texts.en:
Pimarie is 26 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school.

Pimarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Pimarie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Pimarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Arlene dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ligia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 58 años de edad, una persona que hoy le están dando la oportunidad de soñar, ella siempre trabajo preparando alimentos, pero gracias a un apoyo que la corporación Interactuar quiere brindarle a través de su socio Kiva, ella quiere comprar le negocio que ve en la foto, sería una oportunidad muy grande en su vida, de tener lo suyo, de trabajar para ella, por este emotivo con mucha esperanza, Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo para adquirir el negocio y también parte del dinero será destinado en la compra de carpas, mesas y sillas.
texts.en: Ana is a 58 year old person, and today she is being given the chance to dream.  She is always working, preparing foods. She is grateful for the support Interactuar corporation wishes to offer her through their partner, Kiva.  She wishes to purchase the business seen in the photo.  It would be a very great opportunity in her life, to have her share, and work for herself.  For this reason, and with great hope, Ana wishes to request a loan to acquire the business. She will also allocate a portion of the funds to purchase awnings, tables, and chairs.

loans.use: to acquire the business, and also allocate a portion of the funds to purchase awnings, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en:
Malaea  is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Samoa.
Malea owns and operates a convenience store in her village. She has been running her business for 7 years now, and sells her items. 
Malaea is applying for a loan to buy a gas stove and another taxi, to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove and another taxi,

loans.name: Justa Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Justa se sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de ropa. Ella conoce que las prendas salen según las temporadas climáticas y por eso solicita el préstamo para comprar casacas impermeables, dado que se vienen épocas de lluvia en el Cusco.
La socia esta agradecida y contenta por el préstamo , se compromete a pagar puntualmente.
texts.en: The member, Justa, continues with her business selling clothing.  She knows that clothing changes according to the seasons, and for this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase waterproof jackets, given that the rainy season in Cusco is approaching. Justa is grateful and happy to be receiving the loan, and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase waterproof jackets.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and a variety of canned goods. She is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children. Her eldest is 19 and the youngest is 6. Her husband's way of earning is by working as a driver.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more stock like edible oil, canned goods, beverages, and toiletries. These are vital tools that maintain inventory and attract potential customers to her shop. In that way, her earnings will increase and slowly settle her obligation. Thus, she will also be able to support the schooling of all her children and provide proper diets.

Evangeline is determined to be more productive to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like edible oil, canned goods, beverages, and toiletries.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca earns a living by farming. She works on rice paddies and grows rice. She is a 41-year-old married woman with two children who are still attending school. Her husband is a carpenter.

Aside from farming, she also earns a living by operating a thresher machine (a farm machine for separating wheat, peas, soybeans, and other small grain and seed crops from their chaff and straw) for rent.

She has been farming for a quite long time now. She needs funds to boost her livelihood. The thresher machine is on high demand due to the rice harvest season, but it needs a new engine to become more efficient.

Francisca wants to buy a thresher machine engine. In that way, she could be able to continue to provide quality services to her customers.

She is determined that someday she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy a thresher machine engine.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. For the past 11 years, she has been working in her fields growing rice. Her greatest expenses mainly go for food and school expenses.
Aside from rice farming, she also engages in rice retailing business.

She has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and to provide additional capital to purchase rice. In that way, it help improve the yield of the farm and she can continue expand her business. She could then roll-out her capital and start to invest other sources of income to become more productive.

In the future, she would like continue manage her livelihood to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticides and to purchase rice.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia has received a number of loans in the past, which have helped her to purchase various office and school supplies needed in her store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

Once again she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of school and office supplies to sell at retail. As it is school time once again, she needs to fill her store with supplies and serve the office supplies of the factories near her town. She values her store for it has been a stable source of income to sustain her family's basic needs and the education of her children.

Ma. Cecilia dreams of having a bigger school/office supply store. She is looking forward to her children pursuing a college education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Her name is Nelia, aged 53, from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Angelito, a tricycle driver, and they have a child. Raising a family in a third world country is a challenge for the majority of the Filipinos but the couple does their best to provide for the education of their only child.

Nelia operates a tricycle which her husband drives. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. A proper and regular maintenance of her tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this she is humbly seeking help with a loan of 10000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle. This will allow good performance of her unit and thus a steady income for her family's personal and household needs.

Nelia aims to buy another tricycle unit to augment their income. Her precious dream is to see her child finish college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 63 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in Tambogrande, Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes. He feels that organic production is the future and dreams of growing the best organic mangoes ever.

Pedro needs US$ 1200 as loan for fertilizing the fields and increasing the organic mango production,. With the additional income, he will send his daughter to university. She wants to become an lawyer.

loans.use: for manuring the fields for the organic mango production

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a hardworking widow who is 62 years old and has one child.

Rizalina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Rizalina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Rizalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 45 years old, and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Milagrosa has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Milagrosa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia, 66, has been a member of GDMPC since January of 2007. She lives in Becor, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. She is married and blessed with three children (all married).

Her husband is a fisherman and they have their own fishing boat. Fishing is their main source of income. Her husband goes to the sea every morning to catch fish.

One day the fish net was damaged, and her husband cannot go to the sea without the fishnet. Cornelia decided to apply for a loan of PHP 17,000 in order to buy a new fishnet and she plans to use the rest of the loan to make a small store for them to have an additional income.

She wishes to have a stable income for them to have a better lives.

loans.use: to buy fish net and start a small store.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 32 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are in school.

Mylene works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mylene has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Mylene aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is deeply grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their untiring support to sustain and grow her gift shop. Her earnings helped cover her personal, household expenditures and her child's school needs.

She trusts that she could once again request a PHP 3,000 loan that she will use to pay for gift items such as toys, pens, dolls, word puzzles and other supplies like stationery and greeting cards to sell at her gift shop. She thanks God for the kindhearted people who continue to support small business people like her.

Celia aims to expand her store to improve her income and send her high school child to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more gift items to sell at her small gift shop.

loans.name: Mitchell Kay

texts.en:
Mitchell is 29 years old, married, and has two children to provide for.

She put up a retail store almost three years ago to work for a profit, and this business became their main source of living. With the help of her husband, they were able to sustain the business and send her children to school.

She’s planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of her business. She gained access to GDMPC and has decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell in order to have greater sales.

Mitchell’s plan for the future is to save more money for the education of her children when they get into college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Flor Edith

texts.es:
Flor se encuentra solicitando un préstamo ya que quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, con el dinero comprara mercado y snacks, verduras, granos bebidas la tienda la ubicara en su casa, ya adecuo una pieza, su esposo le fabricara la estantería, solo falta inventario.
Flor quiere realizar todos estos esfuerzos por su familia, por ayudar a su esposo económicamente, quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pagar la educación de sus muchachos,  crecer, ser independiente, cambiar su realidad.
texts.en:
Flor is requesting a loan because she wishes to start a business selling basic consumer goods. She will use the funds to purchase merchandise and snacks, vegetables, grains, and drinks. The shop will be located in her home. It has already been fitted with a room, and her husband will make the shelves. All she needs is inventory.

Flor wants to make all these efforts for her family, and help her husband financially. She wishes to make improvements to her home, pay for her children’s education, to grow, be independent, and change her reality.

loans.use: to start a business selling food, and stock it with basic consumer goods.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 45 years old and married. She has four children. With two children in school, Teofila works very hard to provide for them.

Teofila runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Teofila requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 66 years old and married with 11 children. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Estelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Estelita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Grecilda

texts.en:
Grecilda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grecilda is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Grecilda has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Grecilda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en:
FAHMEEDA is the age of 32, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services near his hometown. Most people who have bikes like to have him repair their bikes.

He has been running this business for many years, using very expensive tools for repairing which are now worn. He wants to replace these tools with new ones, but he does not have money to buy the new tools.

Therefore, FAHMEEDA requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new repair tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles.

FAHMEEDA says thank to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new repair tools and some spare parts for repairing motorcycles for her husband's bike repairing services.

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en:
Shahmurad is 50 years old. He is an IDP. He lives in Bilasuvar region. Shahmurad is a married man and has two sons and a daughter.

Shahmurad is a well-reputed man in the local market for supplying fresh fruit. He knows the local market very well. People are in great need of fresh fruit. Shahmurad grows different fruits like apples, pomegranates, figs, etc. He takes his produce and sells it to the rural people. Usually people in Azerbaijan prefer to eat fruit after dinner and serve their guests lovely fresh and varied fruits.

Shahmurad is a very hard-working and energetic man. He wants to become a successful farmer to meet the family's needs in a better way. To do this, he plans to improve his business. Shahmurad is planning to buy more fertilizers. He requires a 1,200 AZN loan. Kiva lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 44-year-old married mother of two; she is a hard working woman who puts so much effort in supporting her husband in making their living.

Siham is well known in her region, with her good reputation. Four years ago she started working from her house; she is a Tupperware salesperson. She runs her business from her house, but is seeking to expand her working area to increase her selling and income at the same time.
