Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for her business development. She will use the car to sell her product freely in nearby villages and thus increase her selling income.

She hopes that one day she can open a shop of her own and display specially released home products, attracting everyone.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for her business development, which she will use to sell her product freely in nearby villages, thereby increasing her income from the sales.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Marina, es una mujer de 60 años de edad, una mujer luchadora, que sale diariamente a las calles a empujar su coche, vendiendo productos como tintos, snack, bolsas de agua y confites, actividad que realizado por mucho tiempo y con la cual costea todos los gastos de su vivienda, ella vive sola, no tiene pareja ni hijos, depende de lo que pueda vender en las calles.
Actualmente la empresaria se encuentra buscando un apoyo económico, la razón es, que quiere comprar un carro más grande, donde pueda ubicar mayor número de productos.
Dicha inversión le puede significar un aumento considerable en ventas, puesto que tendrá mayor espacio para exhibir alimentos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, ella no quiere verse en varios años, como una persona enferma que no tiene dinero para costearse un medicamento, por ello trabaja con tanto esmero pues busca en su trabajo tener salud para vivir muchos más años.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 60 year old woman. She is a hard worker, and she goes out in the streets every day pushing her cart, selling products such as red wine, snacks, bottled water, and candy. She has been engaged in this activity for a long time, and the income pays for all of her household expenses. She lives alone, and doesn’t have a partner or children, so she depends on what she sells in the streets.

Currently, this business woman is seeking financial support because she wishes to purchase a much larger cart where she can store a greater amount of products. This investment means a considerable growth in sales, and a stand that will have more space to display the food, and thus she will have a better quality of life. She doesn’t want to find herself, several years from now, as a sick person that doesn’t have money to pay for medicine. That’s why she works with so much care. She is looking toward her work to help her maintain her health, and live for many more years.

loans.use: to purchase a much larger cart where she can store a greater amount of products.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic house hold commodities such as candies, lollipops, chocolates, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods.

She is a married woman and has four children. One of her children is still attending school. Her husband is a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries and soft drinks. With these, she will be able to maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to her shop. In that way, her financial income will improve.

Marita is determined to become more productive to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and softdrinks.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 42 years old and widowed with seven children. With three children currently in school, Merly works very hard to provide for them.

Merly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, cereals, milk, juice, etc. to sell.

Merly has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, cereals, milk, juice, etc.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, fabric conditioners, cereals, milk and juice to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juliet is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Juliet has a business direct selling avon products in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant, body spray, etc. to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Avon like lotion, deodorant and body spray to sell.

loans.name: Hodohalou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 49 ans, Hodohalou est une femme qui a trois enfants à charge. Résidant à Agoè, Hodohalou prépare de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Hodohalou s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour la préparation. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Hodohalou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaires  dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Married and aged 49, Hodohalou is a woman who is raising three children. Living in Agoè, Hodohalou prepares wrapped dough called « Akpan » and sells it in front of her house, wishing to make a good profit.

Hodohalou buys the necessary ingredients four times a month to prepare her Akpan. So as to order some sacks of maize, Hodohalou is requesting this loan to cover her purchase. She hopes to sell a lot and make a lot of income to meet the needs of her children by helping her husband to pay their school fees for the coming school session.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of maize.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: Lucio es un hombre emprendedor de 48 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hija de 8 años de edad en vivienda humilde pero propia. Lucio se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de medicina, el cual realiza de forma ambulante, pero además gracias al crédito solicitado anteriormente su esposa le apoya, en el cuido de una tienda de productos varios que instalo gracias al apoyo recibido. Lucio desea instalar agua potable en su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con este servicio tan necesario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en instalación de agua potable en su vivienda y de esta manera cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar, el crédito anterior además de utilizarlo para instalar la tienda utilizo una parte para realizar obras de mitigación en su hogar.
texts.en:
Lucio is an entrepreneurial man who is 48 years old and lives with his wife and 8-year-old daughter in a modest house that they own. Lucio earns a living selling medicines, which he does walking door-to-door. However, thanks to his previous loan, his wife supports him by taking care of his store of various products that he opened up with the loan. Lucio wants to install potable water in his household, which currently does not have this important service. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI: to invest in the installation of potable water in his household to keep his home healthy.

His previous loan was used to open a store and to do some home repairs.

loans.use: to invest in potable water for his household to keep his home healthy.

loans.name: Elesita

texts.en:
Elesita works hard to support her family. Elesita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Elesita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like soya, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Elesita has been in this business for 8 years now.

Elesita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like soya and sugar for her food production business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support her family. Nida is married and has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business and payment of the electric bill.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business and payment of the electric bill.

loans.name: Zeneida Yaned

texts.es:
Yaned es una mujer responsable, compresiva, con gran carácter y actitud, una persona muy franca y centrada en sus objetivos, vive en unión libre con su pareja, es madre de dos hijos, el mayor de 20 y la pequeña princesa de tan solo 8 años de edad, trabaja como independiente en una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, tales como abarrotes, víveres, legumbres, productos congelados, cárnicos, lácteos entre otros, con estos ingresos logra complementar el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su casa, puesto que su pareja recibe un salario mínimo y no alcanza para dar abasto a todas las obligaciones.
Su propósito con su trabajo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella no quiere que sus hijos estén condenados a tener una vida como la suya, quiere que estudien y se conviertan en unos profesionales de bien para la sociedad.
Yaned en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra de surtido en grandes cantidades, granos, abarrotes, refrescos, cervezas, productos de aseo persona y doméstico, vegetales, entre otros.
texts.en: Yaned is a responsible and caring woman who has a big personality and attitude. She is a very frank person who is focused on her objectives. She lives with her partner and has two children, an older one of 20 and her little princess who is just 8. She is self-employed, running a shop selling goods for the family and home such as groceries, vegetables, frozen goods, meat, dairy products, etc. Her income provides her with the money she needs to care for her family and home, as her partner earns a minimum wage which cannot cover all their needs. Her aim, as far as her business is concerned, is to improve her family's quality of life. She does not want her children to have to live like she has had to; she wants them to have an education and become successful professionals who do good in society. Yaned is applying for this loan to buy stock in bulk : grains, groceries, soft drinks, beer, personal hygiene products, household cleaning products and vegetables, among other things.

loans.use: to buy grains, groceries, soft drinks, beer, household cleaning products, personal hygiene products and vegetables

loans.name: Dilek

texts.en:
Dilek is a mother of three who worked in temporary jobs in order to support her family. Nowadays she wants to start her own business. 

Dilek lives in Sirnak, southeast of Turkey. Due to fact that, Sirnak is close to borders, there were terrorist actions and community of Sirnak has faced with difficult times. However, nowadays situation has been improved and people are trying to readapt themselves to the joy of life. Therefore, Dilek decided to fill in the blanks by creating platform where women could heal up both physically and mentally.

At that point, Dilek met with b-fit Sports and Social Clubs, a social enterprise in Turkey with numerous sports centers throughout the country. All centers are owned by women, helping empower them economically in a society where businesses are often dominated by men. Dilek will be opening her own franchise and it will have 9 platforms and 9 hydraulic equipments. The aim of this center is increasing physical activity of women. However, it is not just a sport center; it is also a place for women to come together to improve their social relationships, gain skills in different topics via experts’ seminars, and organize many activities together, such as raising donations for charity in their neighborhood. For example; they donate toys to children suffering from cancer, or buy gifts for nursing home residents at holidays and special days like Mother & Father Days.

Accordingly, Dilek thinks b-fit center will be most appropriate place for women who live in Sirnak. Thus, they can improve their physical and mental health together.. However, Dilek needs money to buy the necessary hydraulic workout equipments and to decorate the club so women can utilize it best. 
This is the reason Dilek excitedly waits KIVA lenders help not only for herself but also for women living in Sirnak and she presents her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to buy sports equipment and decorations in order to open her own sports center for women.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 59 years old, a widow with 6 children.

Flordeliza operates her carenderia (eatery) in front of a trucking company. Her business helps a lot to support her children's schooling and provide for her family's expenses. Though a widow for 26 years she has worked hard to raise and support her children until they grow up and have their own family.

Now that only one of her children is still in school Flordeliza is still working hard to support him in his schooling. Her eatery has a lot of customers and she wanted to expand it and add more menu items.

Flordeliza is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy 5 sacks of rice, fish, meat, vegetables, condiments and spices so she can have additional items on the menu at her eatery.

Flordeliza is hoping to increase her income to help provide for their daily expenses and also for her youngest child education.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice, fish, meat and vegetables, condiments and spices so she can have additional items on the menu in her eatery.

loans.name: Umida

texts.en:
Umida is an industrious woman. She was born in the year 1990. Umida is married and has 3 children. Her children are little.

Umida and her husband have an animal husbandry and farming business. They feed sheep and sell in a local market. Also they grow crops and potatoes. Umida and her husband work hard and they try to provide their 3 little children good living conditions.

Umida sells sheep and agriculture products in a local market. She is going to increase the number of sheep she feeds and in this way to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sheep to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Los Chaskis-Quellococha Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS CHASKIS-QUELLOCOCHA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ocobamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa tiene 39 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas, la socia continua cultivando sus frutas para luego  venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando parea de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, semillas entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The featured member belongs to the LOS CHASKIS-QUELLOCOCHA communal bank, which is situated in the district of Ocobamba which is in La Convención province in the department of Cusco. 39-year-old Luisa has 2 children and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities, which include growing fruit. She still grows fruit and then sells them to customers who ask for them. A responsible person, she has been running her business for some time now and everything is going well thanks to the determination which she devotes to it every day. She would like to continue working in this way so that she can continue supporting her family. She is applying for the loan to buy manure, seeds, etc. All the members of the group are grateful for the loans they receive and promise to repay them in full.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 62 years old and married with seven children. Felisa works very hard to provide for them.

Felisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Felisa has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, coffee, sugar, candies, biscuits, noodles, etc.

In the future, Felisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Heidi Fernanda

texts.es:
Heidi Fernanda es una mujer de 39 años independiente y muy trabajadora. La razón de su vida es su hijo de ocho años quién sufre parálisis cerebral. Estudió la cerrera de administración de empresas y ha trabajado desde los últimos 3 años en el Instituto Estatal de Cultura del Gobierno de Villahermosa, sin embargo ha estado en discapacidad para recibir el tratamiento de hemodiálisis.
Hace un año, Heidi inició un negocio de venta de ropa, cosméticos y productos de belleza con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. A inicios de octubre del presente año, agregó a su negocio la venta de sombreros de hule espuma para celebraciones y fiestas con el mismo fin. A pesar de tener estos dos negocios, tiene las ganas de iniciar otro negocio de vente de chamoy el cual quiere producir y envasar ella misma. 
El dinero del crédito que solicitó Heidi le ha ayudado a abastecerse de más productos (ropa y cosméticos) y comprar los sombreros que ahora también vende para que así, sus ventas incrementaran y por ende sus ganancias. De igual forma, este dinero le ha ayudado a brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y la oportunidad de pasar más tiempo con él. 
Su meta en el negocio es crear una cartera sólida de clientes y poder convertirlo en algo formal utilizando su habilidad de negociación y administración y así poder continuar con el sentimiento de orgullo que la caracteriza.
texts.en:
Heidi Fernanda is a 39-year-old, independent, hardworking woman. Her 8-year-old son who suffers from cerebral palsy is her biggest motivation in life. She studied business administration and has worked at the State Institute of Culture, a government building in Villahermosa for the last three years. Nevertheless, she has been unable to pay for her son's hemodialysis treatments.

A year ago, Heidi opened a business selling clothing, cosmetics, and beauty products in order to increase her income and provide her son with a better quality of life. In early October, she added party hats to her stock with the same goal. In spite of having these two businesses, she wishes to open another business selling chamoy (savory sauces and condiments) that she will make and bottle herself.

The money from the loan Heidi has requested previously has helped her to stock more products (clothing and cosmetics) and to buy party hats that she is now selling to increase her profits. In the same way, this money has helped her to provide her son with a better quality of life and has afforded her the opportunity to spend more time with him.

Heidi's goal for her business is to create a solid customer base and be able to start a formal business using her negotiation and administration abilities. This will let her keep the feeling of pride that characterizes her.

loans.use: pay some business expenses and buy more merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sorel Nayibe

texts.es:
Ella es Sorel una tierna y carismática ama de casa, una persona humilde que realiza su actividad de venta de alimentos con mucho amor y esmero, pues agradece a Dios los buenos Resultados que ha obtenido y que puede llevar un alimento diario a su mesa.
Ella es Soltera todo lo que tiene lo ha logrado trabajando honestamente, para montar su puesto de venta de alimentos, donde realiza morcilla y tamales.
Para montar su negocio optó tuvo bastante dificultades, ya que no encontraba ayuda prestó dinero con personas naturales con un interés altísimo diario, algo que la tiene en la desesperación y a punto de cerrar el negocio que con tanto empeño monto, por ello hoy necesita de tu apoyo, un préstamo para pagar esa deuda e iniciar a pagar con una entidad sería, justa y que se preocupa más pro su crecimiento como empresaria que por cobrarle.
texts.en: Sorel is a warm and charismatic housewife. A humble person, she runs her food-selling business with a lot of love and dedication. She is grateful to God for her success and the fact that she can put daily bread on the table. She is single and everything she has, namely her food stall where she makes black pudding and tamales, is the result of her honesty and hard work. It was quite difficult for her to set up her business; as she could not raise the money, she obtained a loan with a very high daily rate of interest. She now feels desperate and is on the verge of closing the business which she worked so hard to set up. She now needs your help: a loan to pay back this debt and the opportunity to make payments to a reputable and fair organisation which is more interested in her success as a business owner than in making money.

loans.use: to pay back a debt she owes to someone.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 47 years old, married and has been managing her business for over three years. She buys and re-sells rice to get an income. She had been re-selling rice for about three years now.

Regina wants to increase her sales that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy cavans of rice to re-sell. She will also add vegetables to sell.

In the future, Regina hopes to improve her sales and achieve better profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy cavans of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Duvel De Jesus

texts.es:
Él es Duvel un orgulloso campesino, arriero de pura cepa, una persona que gusta y vive del campo, trabaja todos los días, construyo un sistema muy completo de cultivación, recolección y distribución de su producto, el cual es, la alverjas.
Duvel quiere mejorar su producción, cuidar sus cultivos y acelerar el proceso de maduración de los mismos, anteponiéndose a los efectos nefastos del fenómeno del niño, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo con los que comprará insumos agrícolas, insecticidas, fungicidas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Duvel is a proud farmer and mule driver who descends from a family of men in the same profession. He loves and lives in the countryside. Duvel works every day and has built a full system of cultivating, harvesting, and distributing his product, which is peas.

Duvel wants to improve his production, take care of his crops, and accelerate the maturation process to avoid the negative effects of El Niño when it comes. For this reason, Duvel is requesting a loan: to buy farming supplies: pesticides, fungicides, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies: pesticides, fungicides, and fertilizers to accelerate the maturation of his products.

loans.name: Naghma

texts.en:
Naghma is aged 27 and has been involved in an embroidered cloth selling business for about ten years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Naghma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Naghma thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter season's embroidered and printed clothing to resell at her home.

loans.name: Fetui'ai

texts.en: Fetui'ai is a 55 year old mother with 7 children and she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Fetui'ai requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtulga, 44 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He used to be welder at private firm and now he is self employed and makes furnaces which have the property of releasing less smoke into the air. His wife helps him in his business. Their son studies at university and their daughter goes to high school.

Using his previous loan, he has renovated his house and created comfortable living environment. Now he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy equipment and raw materials for making furnaces. As a result his business will continue to grow and his family's living standard will improve overtime.

loans.use: to buy equipment and raw materials for making furnaces.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is a food cafe. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, milk, rice, beans, etc., to cook in the cafe.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, sugar, wheat flour, milk, rice, beans, etc., to cook in the restaurant.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam was born in 1996 year. He is a clever and young man, is not married and lives with his parents. He is a student at the Medical University of Tajikistan, in his first year. Rustam reads many books and often goes to the library.

He dreams to be a good specialist in future. Rustam is asking for a loan of 7900 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your help.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition in Medical Studies

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 63 years old. She is single and blessed with four adult children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds. She will use the profits from her expanded business to reinvest into the business to boost it. Her hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad is IDP from Bilasuvar. He is living in the refugee settlement. He is married,49 years old and has 1 son and 2 daughters. He is very hard-working man and loves his job. He is a farmer and involved in daily farming activities. He has some cattle and raises small calves. He fattens them and sell their in the local market. People in Azerbaijan prepare traditional foods mostly with meat. For this he knows that the existing demand is high.

To meet the demand he must have calves to fatten and buy a few more cows. Currently he is planning to expand his business. In order to do this, he needs to buy 3 more calves. For this he needs 1200 AZN. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to buy 3 more calves.

loans.name: Al Mahaba Kayfoun Group

texts.en:
Rowaida, age 32 (pictured in the middle), is the featured borrower for the Al Mahaba Kayfoun group. She joined her other group members to request a loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. All three are working hard to develop their businesses and and improve their families' standard of living.

Rowaida and her husband have three children. She opened her grocery store five years ago in order to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is trying hard to develop her business, which is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. The loan funds will allow her to increase her business merchandise with new, frequently requested products to satisfy customer demand.
The other two borrowers are Fatima and Sawsan. Fatima is pictured at the right, while Sawsan is the lady at the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with newly requested products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Siatuvasa

texts.en: Siatuvasa is a 22 year old mother with 2 children. She runs and operates a small convenience store in her village to earn a living. Siatuvasa requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014, and she will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk and plastic bags.

loans.name: Tahoygul

texts.en:
Tahoygul is a kind woman from Tajikistan. She is married mother of 3 children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Tahoygul has a “Golden hands” and she is very responsible woman. Tahoygul sews and makes very wonderful women's dresses. She has worked in this field for more than 3 years. Tahoygul also sews the Tajik national mattress “Kurpacha”. She has regular clients and she always tries to keep them.

Tahoygul now is going to increase working capital and in this way to develop business. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of dairy feeds during dry season. She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to enlarge production.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en: Eulalia is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the town of Tubigon in Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has three children; one adult and two school-aged children. Her husband works hard as mason in a construction site while Eulalia is engaged in retailing food supplement. She and her husband together earn a living to provide the needs of their children. Thus, Eulalia is determined to improve their livelihood to give good education to her children. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. As for now, she is requesting a loan of PHP25000 for additional capital to buy more food supplements and operate her business continuously.

loans.use: for additional capital to buy more food supplements

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a native from the rural town of Talibon,Bohol. She is 52-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She goes fishing and sells fresh fish, clams and crabs. She is married to a fisherman and has two grown children.

She has been engaged in fishing for 11 years now, serving locals and town dwellers in her place.
She needs capital to boost her daily income.

Antonia wants to purchase fishing nets and engine for the motor boat. These are vital in her day to day livelihood activity. It could also help an ease of transporting their catch would have direct access to her respective customers. She is doing her best to improve the family's living condition.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to continue expand her livelihood to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and engine for the motor boat.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Wilma is borrowing PHP 6,750 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency.

Wilma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.
